Noor Al Huda

Hadith Kisa

YaÊ¿qÅ«b al-KulaynÄ«", "translator": "Muhammad Sarwar", "englishText": " 1. Abu Jaâ€™far Muhammad b. Yaâ€™qub (al-Kulayni) has said: A number of our people of whom one is Muhammad b. Yahya al-â€˜Attar narrated from Ahmad b. Muhammad from Hasan b. Mahbub from al-â€™Ala b. Razin from Muhammad b. Muslim that Abu Jaâ€™far (al-Baqir) (as) has said: â€œWhen Allah (swt) created the intellect (al-'Aql) He made it speak and said to it, â€˜Come forward', so it came forward. He then said, 'Go back' and it went back. Then Allah said, 'I swear by My Honor and Glory that I have not created any creation more beloved to Me than you. I will not perfect you in anyone except those whom I love. I will command you [to obey me] and prohibit you [from disobeying me] and I will punish you [for disobeying me] and I will reward you [for obeying me]. ", "arabicText": " 1Ù€ Ø£ÙØ®Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±ÙÙ†ÙØ§ Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙˆ Ø¬ÙØ¹Ù’ÙÙØ±Ù Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù ÙŠÙØ¹Ù’Ù‚ÙÙˆØ¨Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø­ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙØ«ÙÙ†ÙÙŠ Ø¹ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙØ©ÙŒ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØµÙ’Ø­ÙØ§Ø¨ÙÙ†ÙØ§ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù ÙŠÙØ­Ù’ÙŠÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ·Ù‘ÙØ§Ø±Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ­Ù’Ù…ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙØ³ÙÙ†Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ù…ÙØ­Ù’Ø¨ÙÙˆØ¨Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ„Ø§Ø¡Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø±ÙØ²ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ù…ÙØ³Ù’Ù„ÙÙ…Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø§Ø¨ÙŠ Ø¬Ø¹ÙØ± (Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§Ù…) Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ø®ÙÙ„ÙÙ‚Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù Ø§Ø³Ù’ØªÙÙ†Ù’Ø·ÙÙ‚ÙÙ‡Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø£ÙÙ‚Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ„Ù’ ÙÙØ£ÙÙ‚Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ„Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø£ÙØ¯Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±Ù’ ÙÙØ£ÙØ¯Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙˆÙØ¹ÙØ²Ù‘ÙØªÙÙŠ ÙˆÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ø§Ù„ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙØ§ Ø®ÙÙ„ÙÙ‚Ù’ØªÙ Ø®ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚Ø§Ù‹ Ù‡ÙÙˆÙ Ø£ÙØ­ÙØ¨Ù‘Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ÙƒÙ ÙˆÙÙ„Ø§ Ø£ÙÙƒÙ’Ù…ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙÙƒÙ Ø¥ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙÙÙŠÙ…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ­ÙØ¨Ù‘Ù Ø£ÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙŠ Ø¥ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØ§ÙƒÙ Ø¢Ù…ÙØ±Ù ÙˆÙØ¥ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØ§ÙƒÙ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡ÙÙ‰ ÙˆÙØ¥ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØ§ÙƒÙ Ø£ÙØ¹ÙØ§Ù‚ÙØ¨Ù ÙˆÙØ¥ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØ§ÙƒÙ Ø£ÙØ«ÙÙŠØ¨Ù.", "majlisiGrading": "ØµØ­ÙŠØ­", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/1/1/0/1", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "ØµØ­ÙŠØ­", "chapterInCategoryId": 0, "thaqalaynSanad": " 1. I will command you [to obey me] and prohibit you [from disobeying me] and I will punish you [for disobeying me] and I will reward you [for obeying me]. ", "gradingsFull": [ { "grade_en": null, "grade_ar": " ØµØ­ÙŠØ­ ", "reference_en": "MirÊ¾Ät al-Ê¿UqÅ«l fÄ« Shará¸¥ AkhbÄr Ä€l al-RasÅ«l (1/25)", "author": { "name_en": "Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi", "name_ar": null, "link": null, "death_date": null } }, { "grade_en": null, "grade_ar": "ØµØ­ÙŠØ­", "reference_en": "Sahih al-Kafi (1/ 1)", "author": { "name_en": "Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi", "name_ar": null, "link": null, "death_date": null } } ] }, { "id": 269, "bookId": "Al-Kafi-Volume-1-Kulayni", "book": "Al-KÄfi", "category": "The Book on Oneness of Allah (God)", "categoryId": "3", "chapter": "Chapter On The Invalidity of the Belief to see God (Ruâ€™yah of Allah)", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. YaÊ¿qÅ«b al-KulaynÄ«", "translator": "Muhammad Sarwar", "englishText": " 12. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from some of his people from Hisham ibn al-Hakam who has said the following. â€œThings can be perceived by two means: (1) By the senses and (2) by the heart, intellect. Perceptions of the senses are of three kinds: (1) Perception in the form of penetration, (2) Perception in the form of touching, and (3) Perception without penetration or touCh Perception by means of sounds, smells and tastes are formed through penetration. Perception through touching comes from the knowledge of shapes, such as rectangular or triangular etc., and also softness, hardness, heat and cold. Perception without touch or penetration is that of sight which is capable of perceiving things without touching or penetration, directly or indirectly. Perception through sight needs a path and medium. Its path is air and its medium is the light. If the path is continuous between the viewer and the object and the medium then seeing takes place such as colors and persons. If light falls on something without a path, it will return reflecting what is behind (the observed), like an observer looking into a mirror. Light does not penetrate into the mirror, because it finds no path. So it returns reflecting what lies behind the observed. It is similar to looking into the clear water returns light that reflects what is at the rear. This happens because there is no path for the penetration of light. Intellect dominates the air. It perceives all that is in the air and forms his Wahm (intuitive form of perception). If the heart will not find any thing in the air it comes back and reflects what is in the air. A person of reason should not force his heart against what is not in the air of the issue of the Oneness of Allah, the Majestic, the Glorious, otherwise, it will form his Wahm of what is there in the air as mentioned about the eye-witnessing. Allah, the Most High is far and above similarities with the creatures.â€", "arabicText": " 12Ù€ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¥ÙØ¨Ù’Ø±ÙØ§Ù‡ÙÙŠÙ…Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¶Ù Ø£ÙØµÙ’Ø­ÙØ§Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù‡ÙØ´ÙØ§Ù…Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙÙƒÙÙ…Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø´Ù’ÙŠÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙƒÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ù„Ø§ ØªÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙÙƒÙ Ø¥ÙÙ„Ø§ Ø¨ÙØ£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†Ù Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø³Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¨Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø³Ù‘Ù Ø¥ÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙØ§ÙƒÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø«ÙÙ„Ø§Ø«ÙØ©Ù Ù…ÙØ¹ÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø¥ÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙØ§ÙƒØ§Ù‹ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø®ÙÙ„ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¥ÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙØ§ÙƒØ§Ù‹ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø³Ù‘ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¥ÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙØ§ÙƒØ§Ù‹ Ø¨ÙÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø®ÙÙ„ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙÙ„Ø§Ø›Ù‘Ù‘ Ù…ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø³Ù‘ÙØ©Ù ÙÙØ£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø¯Ù’Ø±ÙØ§ÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù‘ÙØ°ÙÙŠ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø®ÙÙ„ÙØ©Ù ÙÙØ§Ù„Ø§ØµÙ’ÙˆÙØ§ØªÙ ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ´ÙØ§Ù…Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø·Ù‘ÙØ¹ÙÙˆÙ…Ù ÙˆÙØ£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø¯Ù’Ø±ÙØ§ÙƒÙ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø³Ù‘ÙØ©Ù ÙÙÙ…ÙØ¹Ù’Ø±ÙÙÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø´Ù’ÙƒÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙØ±Ù’Ø¨ÙÙŠØ¹Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙØ«Ù’Ù„ÙÙŠØ«Ù ÙˆÙÙ…ÙØ¹Ù’Ø±ÙÙÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙÙ†Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø®ÙØ´ÙÙ†Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙØ±Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±Ù’Ø¯Ù ÙˆÙØ£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø¯Ù’Ø±ÙØ§ÙƒÙ Ø¨ÙÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø³Ù‘ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø®ÙÙ„ÙØ©Ù ÙÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØµÙØ±Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙŠÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø´Ù’ÙŠÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ø¨ÙÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø³Ù‘ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙØ¯ÙØ§Ø®ÙÙ„ÙØ©Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø­ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØ²Ù ØºÙÙŠÙ’Ø±ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙÙ„Ø§ ÙÙÙŠ Ø­ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØ²ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙØ¥ÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙØ§ÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØµÙØ±Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø³ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ„ÙŒ ÙˆÙØ³ÙØ¨ÙØ¨ÙŒ ÙÙØ³ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‡ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙØ³ÙØ¨ÙØ¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø¶Ù‘ÙÙŠÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙØ°ÙØ§ ÙƒÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ„Ù Ù…ÙØªÙ‘ÙØµÙÙ„Ø§Ù‹ Ø¨ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø¦ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙØ¨ÙØ¨Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ø¦ÙÙ…ÙŒ Ø£ÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙÙƒÙ Ù…ÙØ§ ÙŠÙÙ„Ø§Ù‚ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù„Ù’ÙˆÙØ§Ù†Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø§Ø´Ù’Ø®ÙØ§ØµÙ ÙÙØ¥ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø­ÙÙ…ÙÙ„Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØµÙØ±Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ù…ÙØ§ Ù„Ø§ Ø³ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙŠÙ‡Ù Ø±ÙØ¬ÙØ¹Ù Ø±ÙØ§Ø¬ÙØ¹Ø§Ù‹ ÙÙØ­ÙÙƒÙÙ‰ Ù…ÙØ§ ÙˆÙØ±ÙØ§Ø¡ÙÙ‡Ù ÙƒÙØ§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ§Ø¸ÙØ±Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø¢Ø©Ù Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙÙ†Ù’ÙÙØ°Ù Ø¨ÙØµÙØ±ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø¢Ø©Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ù„ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙŠÙÙƒÙÙ†Ù’ Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø³ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ„ÙŒ Ø±ÙØ¬ÙØ¹Ù Ø±ÙØ§Ø¬ÙØ¹Ø§Ù‹ ÙŠÙØ­Ù’ÙƒÙÙŠ Ù…ÙØ§ ÙˆÙØ±ÙØ§Ø¡ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙÙƒÙØ°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ§Ø¸ÙØ±Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ø§Ù„ØµÙ‘ÙØ§ÙÙÙŠ ÙŠÙØ±Ù’Ø¬ÙØ¹Ù Ø±ÙØ§Ø¬ÙØ¹Ø§Ù‹ ÙÙÙŠÙØ­Ù’ÙƒÙÙŠ Ù…ÙØ§ ÙˆÙØ±ÙØ§Ø¡ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¥ÙØ°Ù’ Ù„Ø§ Ø³ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù’ÙÙØ§Ø°Ù Ø¨ÙØµÙØ±ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙØ£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¨Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø³ÙÙ„Ù’Ø·ÙØ§Ù†ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‡ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙÙÙ‡ÙÙˆÙ ÙŠÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙÙƒÙ Ø¬ÙÙ…ÙÙŠØ¹Ù Ù…ÙØ§ ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‡ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙÙŠÙØªÙÙˆÙÙ‡Ù‘ÙÙ…ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø­ÙÙ…ÙÙ„Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¨Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ù…ÙØ§ Ù„ÙÙŠÙ’Ø³Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‡ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ù…ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¬ÙÙˆØ¯Ø§Ù‹ Ø±ÙØ¬ÙØ¹Ù Ø±ÙØ§Ø¬ÙØ¹Ø§Ù‹ ÙÙØ­ÙÙƒÙÙ‰ Ù…ÙØ§ ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‡ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙÙÙ„Ø§ ÙŠÙÙ†Ù’Ø¨ÙØºÙÙŠ Ù„ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ§Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ­Ù’Ù…ÙÙ„Ù Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ù…ÙØ§ Ù„ÙÙŠÙ’Ø³Ù Ù…ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¬ÙÙˆØ¯Ø§Ù‹ ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‡ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±Ù Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙÙˆÙ’Ø­ÙÙŠØ¯Ù Ø¬ÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙØ¹ÙØ²Ù‘Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙÙØ¹ÙÙ„Ù Ø°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ù„ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙŠÙØªÙÙˆÙÙ‡Ù‘ÙÙ…Ù’ Ø¥ÙÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙØ§ ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‡ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ù…ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¬ÙÙˆØ¯ÙŒ ÙƒÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù’Ù†ÙØ§ ÙÙÙŠ Ø£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØµÙØ±Ù ØªÙØ¹ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ´Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‡Ù Ø®ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙ‡Ù.", "majlisiGrading": "Ù…Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ù…ÙˆÙ‚Ùˆ Ù", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/1/3/9/12", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ®Ø±Ø¬Ù‡", "chapterInCategoryId": 9, "thaqalaynSanad": " 12. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from some of his people from Hisham ibn al-Hakam who has said the following. ", "thaqalaynMatn": "â€œThings can be perceived by two means: (1) By the senses and (2) by the heart, intellect. Perceptions of the senses are of three kinds: (1) Perception in the form of penetration, (2) Perception in the form of touching, and (3) Perception without penetration or touCh Perception by means of sounds, smells and tastes are formed through penetration. Perception through touching comes from the knowledge of shapes, such as rectangular or triangular etc., and also softness, hardness, heat and cold. Perception without touch or penetration is that of sight which is capable of perceiving things without touching or penetration, directly or indirectly. Perception through sight needs a path and medium. Its path is air and its medium is the light. If the path is continuous between the viewer and the object and the medium then seeing takes place such as colors and persons. If light falls on something without a path, it will return reflecting what is behind (the observed), like an observer looking into a mirror. Light does not penetrate into the mirror, because it finds no path. So it returns reflecting what lies behind the observed. It is similar to looking into the clear water returns light that reflects what is at the rear. This happens because there is no path for the penetration of light. Intellect dominates the air. It perceives all that is in the air and forms his Wahm (intuitive form of perception). If the heart will not find any thing in the air it comes back and reflects what is in the air. A person of reason should not force his heart against what is not in the air of the issue of the Oneness of Allah, the Majestic, the Glorious, otherwise, it will form his Wahm of what is there in the air as mentioned about the eye-witnessing. Allah, the Most High is far and above similarities with the creatures.â€", "gradingsFull": [ { "grade_en": null, "grade_ar": "Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ®Ø±Ø¬Ù‡", "reference_en": "Sahih al-Kafi", "author": { "name_en": "Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi", "name_ar": null, "link": null, "death_date": null } }, { "grade_en": null, "grade_ar": " Ù…Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ù…ÙˆÙ‚Ùˆ Ù ", "reference_en": "MirÊ¾Ät al-Ê¿UqÅ«l fÄ« Shará¸¥ AkhbÄr Ä€l al-RasÅ«l (1/141)", "author": { "name_en": "Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi", "name_ar": null, "link": null, "death_date": null } } ] }, { "id": 15, "bookId": "Al-Kafi-Volume-1-Kulayni", "book": "Al-KÄfi", "category": "The Book of Intelligence and Ignorance", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "The Book of Intelligence and Ignorance", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. YaÊ¿qÅ«b al-KulaynÄ«", "translator": "Muhammad Sarwar", "englishText": " 14. A group of our companions narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Ali ibn Hadeed, from Samaâ€™ah ibn Mehran, who said: \"I was with Abu Abdullah (a.s) and a group of his followers were also present. The discussion turned to the topics of intellect and ignorance. Abu Abdullah (a.s) said: 'Recognize intellect and its soldiers, and ignorance and its soldiers, and you will be guided.' Samaâ€™ah said: 'I said, \"May I be your ransom, we know only what you have taught us.\"' Abu Abdullah (a.s) replied: 'Indeed, Allah the Mighty and Majestic created intellect, and it was the first creation among the spiritual beings, on the right side of the Throne, from His light. Then He said to it, \"Move back,\" and it moved back. Then He said to it, \"Come forward,\" and it came forward. Then Allah, blessed and exalted, said: \"I created you as a great creation and honored you over all My creations.\" Then He created ignorance from the dark, salty sea. He said to it, \"Move back,\" and it moved back. Then He said to it, \"Come forward,\" but it did not come forward. He said to it, \"Did you act arrogantly?\" So He cursed it. Then He made for intellect seventy-five soldiers. When ignorance saw the honor Allah had bestowed upon intellect and what He had given it, it harbored enmity towards it. Ignorance said: \"O Lord, this is a creation like me. You created it, honored it, and strengthened it, and I am its opposite. I have no power over it, so give me soldiers like those You have given it.\" Allah said: \"Yes, but if you disobey after that, I will expel you and your soldiers from My mercy.\" Ignorance said: \"I am satisfied.\" So He gave it seventy-five soldiers. \u003Cbr\u003EAmong what He gave to intellect from the seventy-five soldiers were: goodness, which is the minister of intellect, and He made its opposite evil, which is the minister of ignorance; faith, and its opposite disbelief; affirmation, and its opposite denial; hope, and its opposite despair; justice, and its opposite injustice; contentment, and its opposite discontent; gratitude, and its opposite ingratitude; greed, and its opposite hopelessness; reliance (on Allah), and its opposite covetousness; compassion, and its opposite hardness; mercy, and its opposite anger; knowledge, and its opposite ignorance; understanding, and its opposite folly; chastity, and its opposite promiscuity; asceticism, and its opposite desire; gentleness, and its opposite coarseness; fear, and its opposite audacity; humility, and its opposite arrogance; deliberation, and its opposite hastiness; forbearance, and its opposite foolishness; silence, and its opposite verbosity; surrender, and its opposite arrogance; acceptance, and its opposite doubt; patience, and its opposite impatience; forgiveness, and its opposite vengeance; wealth, and its opposite poverty; remembrance, and its opposite forgetfulness; preservation, and its opposite neglect; kindness, and its opposite cutting off; contentment, and its opposite greed; sharing, and its opposite withholding; friendship, and its opposite enmity; loyalty, and its opposite betrayal; obedience, and its opposite disobedience; submission, and its opposite insolence; safety, and its opposite affliction; love, and its opposite hatred; truthfulness, and its opposite lying; truth, and its opposite falsehood; trustworthiness, and its opposite treachery; sincerity, and its opposite hypocrisy; discernment, and its opposite dullness; understanding, and its opposite stupidity; recognition, and its opposite denial; diplomacy, and its opposite disclosure; safeguarding the unseen, and its opposite cunning; concealment, and its opposite revelation; prayer, and its opposite neglect; fasting, and its opposite breaking the fast; striving (in Allah's way), and its opposite retreat; pilgrimage, and its opposite breaking the covenant; protection of speech, and its opposite slander; righteousness to parents, and its opposite disobedience; reality, and its opposite ostentation; virtue, and its opposite vice; concealment, and its opposite display; precaution, and its opposite publicity; fairness, and its opposite bias; preparation, and its opposite transgression; cleanliness, and its opposite filthiness; modesty, and its opposite shamelessness; moderation, and its opposite aggression; rest, and its opposite fatigue; ease, and its opposite difficulty; blessing, and its opposite curse; well-being, and its opposite affliction; uprightness, and its opposite excess; wisdom, and its opposite desire; dignity, and its opposite frivolity; happiness, and its opposite misery; repentance, and its opposite insistence (on sin); seeking forgiveness, and its opposite deception; preservation, and its opposite neglect; supplication, and its opposite disdain; activity, and its opposite laziness; joy, and its opposite sadness; unity, and its opposite separation; generosity, and its opposite stinginess. \u003Cbr\u003EThese qualities from the soldiers of the intellect are not all found together in anyone except in a prophet, or the successor of a prophet, or a believer whose heart Allah has tested for faith. As for the rest of our followers, none of them is free from having some of these soldiers until they are complete and cleansed from the soldiers of ignorance. At that time, they will be in the highest degree with the prophets and successors. This can only be achieved by recognizing intellect and its soldiers and avoiding ignorance and its soldiers. May Allah grant us and you success in obeying Him and seeking His pleasure.'\"", "arabicText": " 14Ù€ Ø¹ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙØ©ÙŒ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØµÙ’Ø­ÙØ§Ø¨ÙÙ†ÙØ§ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ­Ù’Ù…ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø­ÙØ¯ÙÙŠØ¯Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø³ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø¹ÙØ©Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ù…ÙÙ‡Ù’Ø±ÙØ§Ù†Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙƒÙÙ†Ù’ØªÙ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠ Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ (Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§Ù…) ÙˆÙØ¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¬ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø¹ÙØ©ÙŒ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù…ÙÙˆÙØ§Ù„ÙÙŠÙ‡Ù ÙÙØ¬ÙØ±ÙÙ‰ Ø°ÙÙƒÙ’Ø±Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙˆ Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ (Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§Ù…) Ø§Ø¹Ù’Ø±ÙÙÙÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù ÙˆÙØ¬ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„Ù ÙˆÙØ¬ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯ÙÙ‡Ù ØªÙÙ‡Ù’ØªÙØ¯ÙÙˆØ§ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø³ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø¹ÙØ©Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ Ø¬ÙØ¹ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ ÙÙØ¯ÙØ§ÙƒÙ Ù„Ø§ Ù†ÙØ¹Ù’Ø±ÙÙÙ Ø¥ÙÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙØ§ Ø¹ÙØ±Ù‘ÙÙÙ’ØªÙÙ†ÙØ§ ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙˆ Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ (Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§Ù…) Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹ÙØ²Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ø®ÙÙ„ÙÙ‚Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù ÙˆÙÙ‡ÙÙˆÙ Ø£ÙÙˆÙ‘ÙÙ„Ù Ø®ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙÙˆØ­ÙØ§Ù†ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙÙ…ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ±Ù’Ø´Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù†ÙÙˆØ±ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø£ÙØ¯Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±Ù’ ÙÙØ£ÙØ¯Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø£ÙÙ‚Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ„Ù’ ÙÙØ£ÙÙ‚Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ„Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªÙØ¨ÙØ§Ø±ÙÙƒÙ ÙˆÙØªÙØ¹ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙ‰ Ø®ÙÙ„ÙÙ‚Ù’ØªÙÙƒÙ Ø®ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚Ø§Ù‹ Ø¹ÙØ¸ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù‹ ÙˆÙÙƒÙØ±Ù‘ÙÙ…Ù’ØªÙÙƒÙ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø¬ÙÙ…ÙÙŠØ¹Ù Ø®ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙŠ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ø®ÙÙ„ÙÙ‚Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØ­Ù’Ø±Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø¬ÙØ§Ø¬Ù Ø¸ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ§Ù†ÙÙŠÙ‘Ø§Ù‹ ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø£ÙØ¯Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±Ù’ ÙÙØ£ÙØ¯Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø£ÙÙ‚Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ„Ù’ ÙÙÙ„ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙŠÙÙ‚Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ„Ù’ ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ø³Ù’ØªÙÙƒÙ’Ø¨ÙØ±Ù’ØªÙ ÙÙÙ„ÙØ¹ÙÙ†ÙÙ‡Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ø¬ÙØ¹ÙÙ„Ù Ù„ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù Ø®ÙÙ…Ù’Ø³ÙØ©Ù‹ ÙˆÙØ³ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¹ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø¬ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯Ø§Ù‹ ÙÙÙ„ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ø±ÙØ£ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ø£ÙÙƒÙ’Ø±ÙÙ…Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù ÙˆÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø£ÙØ¹Ù’Ø·ÙØ§Ù‡Ù Ø£ÙØ¶Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ¯ÙØ§ÙˆÙØ©Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„Ù ÙŠÙØ§ Ø±ÙØ¨Ù‘Ù Ù‡ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø®ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙŒ Ù…ÙØ«Ù’Ù„ÙÙŠ Ø®ÙÙ„ÙÙ‚Ù’ØªÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙÙƒÙØ±Ù‘ÙÙ…Ù’ØªÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙÙ‚ÙÙˆÙ‘ÙÙŠÙ’ØªÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙØ£ÙÙ†ÙØ§ Ø¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙÙ„Ø§ Ù‚ÙÙˆÙ‘ÙØ©Ù Ù„ÙÙŠ Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙØ£ÙØ¹Ù’Ø·ÙÙ†ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯Ù Ù…ÙØ«Ù’Ù„Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ø£ÙØ¹Ù’Ø·ÙÙŠÙ’ØªÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù†ÙØ¹ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¹ÙØµÙÙŠÙ’ØªÙ Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ø£ÙØ®Ù’Ø±ÙØ¬Ù’ØªÙÙƒÙ ÙˆÙØ¬ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯ÙÙƒÙ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø±ÙØ­Ù’Ù…ÙØªÙÙŠ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù‚ÙØ¯Ù’ Ø±ÙØ¶ÙÙŠØªÙ ÙÙØ£ÙØ¹Ù’Ø·ÙØ§Ù‡Ù Ø®ÙÙ…Ù’Ø³ÙØ©Ù‹ ÙˆÙØ³ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¹ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø¬ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯Ø§Ù‹ Ø¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù‘ÙØ±Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙÙ‡ÙÙˆÙ ÙˆÙØ²ÙÙŠØ±Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø§ÙŠÙ…ÙØ§Ù†Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’ÙƒÙÙÙ’Ø±Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙØµÙ’Ø¯ÙÙŠÙ‚Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙØ­ÙÙˆØ¯Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙƒÙØ§Ø´ÙÙÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ³ÙÙ„Ø§Ù…ÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’ØºÙÙŠÙ’Ø¨Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ…ÙØ§ÙƒÙØ±ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’ÙƒÙØªÙ’Ù…ÙØ§Ù†Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§ÙÙ’Ø´ÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„ØµÙ‘ÙÙ„Ø§Ø©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙÙ…ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙÙ‡Ù’ÙŠÙØ¦ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØºÙ’ÙŠÙ ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ¸ÙØ§ÙÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‚ÙØ°ÙØ±Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙÙŠÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ„ÙØ¹Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ù‚ÙØµÙ’Ø¯Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ¯Ù’ÙˆÙØ§Ù†Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ§Ø­ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙØ¹ÙØ¨Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙÙˆÙ„ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„ØµÙ‘ÙØ¹ÙÙˆØ¨ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±ÙÙƒÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ­Ù’Ù‚Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ§ÙÙÙŠÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ„Ø§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙˆÙØ§Ù…Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙƒÙØ§Ø«ÙØ±ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙÙƒÙ’Ù…ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‡ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’ÙˆÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ø±Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø®ÙÙÙ‘ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙØ¹ÙØ§Ø¯ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù‘ÙÙ‚ÙØ§ÙˆÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¨ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø³Ù’ØªÙÙ†Ù’ÙƒÙØ§ÙÙ ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ´ÙØ§Ø·Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’ÙƒÙØ³ÙÙ„Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’ÙÙØ±ÙØ­Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙØ²ÙÙ†Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø§Ù„Ù’ÙÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’ÙÙØ±Ù’Ù‚ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙØ®ÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙØ¶ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØ®Ù’Ù„Ù ÙÙÙ„Ø§ ØªÙØ¬Ù’ØªÙÙ…ÙØ¹Ù Ù‡ÙØ°ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø®ÙØµÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙƒÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ¬Ù’Ù†ÙØ§Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙÙÙŠ Ù†ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø£ÙÙˆÙ’ ÙˆÙØµÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ù†ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø£ÙÙˆÙ’ Ù…ÙØ¤Ù’Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ù‚ÙØ¯Ù Ø§Ù…Ù’ØªÙØ­ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ù„ÙÙ„Ø§ÙŠÙ…ÙØ§Ù†Ù ÙˆÙØ£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ø³ÙØ§Ø¦ÙØ±Ù Ø°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù…ÙÙˆÙØ§Ù„ÙÙŠÙ†ÙØ§ ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø£ÙØ­ÙØ¯ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙØ®Ù’Ù„ÙÙˆ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙÙƒÙÙˆÙ†Ù ÙÙÙŠÙ‡Ù Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¶Ù Ù‡ÙØ°ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ†ÙÙˆØ¯Ù Ø­ÙØªÙ‘ÙÙ‰ ÙŠÙØ³Ù’ØªÙÙƒÙ’Ù…ÙÙ„Ù ÙˆÙÙŠÙÙ†Ù’Ù‚ÙÙ‰ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¬ÙÙ†ÙÙˆØ¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„Ù ÙÙØ¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ ÙŠÙÙƒÙÙˆÙ†Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù‘ÙØ±ÙØ¬ÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ„Ù’ÙŠÙØ§ Ù…ÙØ¹Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù†Ù’Ø¨ÙÙŠÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø§ÙˆÙ’ØµÙÙŠÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ…ÙØ§ ÙŠÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙÙƒÙ Ø°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ø¨ÙÙ…ÙØ¹Ù’Ø±ÙÙÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù ÙˆÙØ¬ÙÙ†ÙÙˆØ¯ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙØ¨ÙÙ…ÙØ¬ÙØ§Ù†ÙØ¨ÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„Ù ÙˆÙØ¬ÙÙ†ÙÙˆØ¯ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙÙÙ‘ÙÙ‚ÙÙ†ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙØ¥ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØ§ÙƒÙÙ…Ù’ Ù„ÙØ·ÙØ§Ø¹ÙØªÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙÙ…ÙØ±Ù’Ø¶ÙØ§ØªÙÙ‡Ù.", "majlisiGrading": "Ø¶Ø¹ÙŠÙ", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/1/1/0/14", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ®Ø±Ø¬Ù‡", "chapterInCategoryId": 0, "thaqalaynSanad": " 14. A group of our companions narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Ali ibn Hadeed, from Samaâ€™ah ibn Mehran, who said: ", "thaqalaynMatn": "\"I was with Abu Abdullah (a.s) and a group of his followers were also present. The discussion turned to the topics of intellect and ignorance. Abu Abdullah (a.s) said: 'Recognize intellect and its soldiers, and ignorance and its soldiers, and you will be guided.' Samaâ€™ah said: 'I said, \"May I be your ransom, we know only what you have taught us.\"' Abu Abdullah (a.s) replied: 'Indeed, Allah the Mighty and Majestic created intellect, and it was the first creation among the spiritual beings, on the right side of the Throne, from His light. Then He said to it, \"Move back,\" and it moved back. Then He said to it, \"Come forward,\" and it came forward. Then Allah, blessed and exalted, said: \"I created you as a great creation and honored you over all My creations.\" Then He created ignorance from the dark, salty sea. He said to it, \"Move back,\" and it moved back. Then He said to it, \"Come forward,\" but it did not come forward. He said to it, \"Did you act arrogantly?\" So He cursed it. Then He made for intellect seventy-five soldiers. When ignorance saw the honor Allah had bestowed upon intellect and what He had given it, it harbored enmity towards it. Ignorance said: \"O Lord, this is a creation like me. You created it, honored it, and strengthened it, and I am its opposite. I have no power over it, so give me soldiers like those You have given it.\" Allah said: \"Yes, but if you disobey after that, I will expel you and your soldiers from My mercy.\" Ignorance said: \"I am satisfied.\" So He gave it seventy-five soldiers. \u003Cbr\u003EAmong what He gave to intellect from the seventy-five soldiers were: goodness, which is the minister of intellect, and He made its opposite evil, which is the minister of ignorance; faith, and its opposite disbelief; affirmation, and its opposite denial; hope, and its opposite despair; justice, and its opposite injustice; contentment, and its opposite discontent; gratitude, and its opposite ingratitude; greed, and its opposite hopelessness; reliance (on Allah), and its opposite covetousness; compassion, and its opposite hardness; mercy, and its opposite anger; knowledge, and its opposite ignorance; understanding, and its opposite folly; chastity, and its opposite promiscuity; asceticism, and its opposite desire; gentleness, and its opposite coarseness; fear, and its opposite audacity; humility, and its opposite arrogance; deliberation, and its opposite hastiness; forbearance, and its opposite foolishness; silence, and its opposite verbosity; surrender, and its opposite arrogance; acceptance, and its opposite doubt; patience, and its opposite impatience; forgiveness, and its opposite vengeance; wealth, and its opposite poverty; remembrance, and its opposite forgetfulness; preservation, and its opposite neglect; kindness, and its opposite cutting off; contentment, and its opposite greed; sharing, and its opposite withholding; friendship, and its opposite enmity; loyalty, and its opposite betrayal; obedience, and its opposite disobedience; submission, and its opposite insolence; safety, and its opposite affliction; love, and its opposite hatred; truthfulness, and its opposite lying; truth, and its opposite falsehood; trustworthiness, and its opposite treachery; sincerity, and its opposite hypocrisy; discernment, and its opposite dullness; understanding, and its opposite stupidity; recognition, and its opposite denial; diplomacy, and its opposite disclosure; safeguarding the unseen, and its opposite cunning; concealment, and its opposite revelation; prayer, and its opposite neglect; fasting, and its opposite breaking the fast; striving (in Allah's way), and its opposite retreat; pilgrimage, and its opposite breaking the covenant; protection of speech, and its opposite slander; righteousness to parents, and its opposite disobedience; reality, and its opposite ostentation; virtue, and its opposite vice; concealment, and its opposite display; precaution, and its opposite publicity; fairness, and its opposite bias; preparation, and its opposite transgression; cleanliness, and its opposite filthiness; modesty, and its opposite shamelessness; moderation, and its opposite aggression; rest, and its opposite fatigue; ease, and its opposite difficulty; blessing, and its opposite curse; well-being, and its opposite affliction; uprightness, and its opposite excess; wisdom, and its opposite desire; dignity, and its opposite frivolity; happiness, and its opposite misery; repentance, and its opposite insistence (on sin); seeking forgiveness, and its opposite deception; preservation, and its opposite neglect; supplication, and its opposite disdain; activity, and its opposite laziness; joy, and its opposite sadness; unity, and its opposite separation; generosity, and its opposite stinginess. \u003Cbr\u003EThese qualities from the soldiers of the intellect are not all found together in anyone except in a prophet, or the successor of a prophet, or a believer whose heart Allah has tested for faith. As for the rest of our followers, none of them is free from having some of these soldiers until they are complete and cleansed from the soldiers of ignorance. At that time, they will be in the highest degree with the prophets and successors. This can only be achieved by recognizing intellect and its soldiers and avoiding ignorance and its soldiers. May Allah grant us and you success in obeying Him and seeking His pleasure.'\"", "gradingsFull": [ { "grade_en": null, "grade_ar": "Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ®Ø±Ø¬Ù‡", "reference_en": "Sahih al-Kafi", "author": { "name_en": "Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi", "name_ar": null, "link": null, "death_date": null } }, { "grade_en": null, "grade_ar": " Ø¶Ø¹ÙŠÙ ", "reference_en": "MirÊ¾Ät al-Ê¿UqÅ«l fÄ« Shará¸¥ AkhbÄr Ä€l al-RasÅ«l (1/65)", "author": { "name_en": "Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi", "name_ar": null, "link": null, "death_date": null } } ] }, { "id": 16, "bookId": "Al-Kafi-Volume-1-Kulayni", "book": "Al-KÄfi", "category": "The Book of Intelligence and Ignorance", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "The Book of Intelligence and Ignorance", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. YaÊ¿qÅ«b al-KulaynÄ«", "translator": "Muhammad Sarwar", "englishText": " 2. (Through the same chain of narrators) it has been narrated from Abi â€˜Abdillah (a.s.) who has said the following. â€œOnce, in a meeting in the presence of my father with a group of people also present my father smiled and (the feeling was quite intense it caused) tears flooded his eyes. He then asked, â€œDo you know what made me laugh?â€ The narrator has said that they said, â€œNo, we do not know the reason.â€ The Imam (a.s.) said, â€œIbn â€˜Abbas thinks he is of the people mention in the following verse of the Holy Quran. â€œTo those who have said, â€œGod is our Lord, â€œ and who have remained steadfast to their belief, the angels will descend saying, â€œDo not be afraid or grieved. Receive the glad news of the Paradise which was promised to you.â€ (41:30). I asked him, â€œHave you seen the angels, O Ibn â€˜Abbas, telling you of the fact that they guard and protect you in this and the next world and provide you complete protection and security from fear and sadness?â€ The Imam (a.s.) then said that Ibn â€˜Abbas said, â€œBelievers are each otherâ€™s brothers. . .â€ (49:10) the whole community is included in this verse.â€ I then laughed.â€ Then I said, â€œO Ibn â€˜Abbas, you (perhaps) are right. However, I ask you to swear to Allah and answer me truthfully. Is there any disharmony in the judgment of Allah, Majestic is Whose mention?â€ He said, â€œNo, there is no disharmony in His judgment.â€ â€œI then asked him, â€œHow would you judge the case in which a man strikes the fingers of another man with a sword until they fall. Then another man comes and cuts off his palm. He is brought to you and you are the judge. How would you then judge?â€ He said, â€œI will order the one who cut off the palm to pay compensation for the whole hand. I will ask the affected party to reach a settlement with the defendant and for this purpose I send them to the people of justice (arbitrator).â€ I said, â€œ(In your judgment) disharmony has come in the laws of Allah, Majestic is Whose mention, thus, you invalidated what you said before (that there is no disharmony in the laws and judgment of Allah). Allah, Majestic is Whose mention, disdains to let a judicial case remain on earth without a clarified rule. You must order, as a judge, to cut the palm of the defendant totally and pay compensation for the fingers. Thus, is the judgment of Allah at the night wherein His orders descend. If you would reject after hearing from the Messenger of Allah then Allah will send you to fire just as He blinded you on the day you hid the (truth) in favor of Ali ibn abu Talib (a.s.).â€ Ibn â€˜Abbas then said, â€œIs that why my eyes have become blind?â€ He further said, â€œHow would you know that? I swear by Allah that my eyes turned blind only because of the flapping of the wing of the angel.â€ The Imam (a.s.) said, â€œThat made me laugh. I left him that day because of the silliness (dark and dullness) in his intellect and reason. I then met him latter and said to him, â€œO Ibn â€˜Abbas, you have not spoken as true as you did yesterday. Ali ibn abu Talib (a.s.) told you that the Night of Determination comes every year. On that night the command for the whole year comes down. For that matter and command is the people with Divine authority after the Messenger of Allah. You then asked, â€œWho are these people?â€ He (Ali (a.s.) said, â€œI myself and the eleven men from my descendents will be the Imams (leaders with divine authority) and the (people to whom angels speak) Muhaddathun.â€ You then said, â€œI do not see it (Night of Determination) except with the Messenger of Allah. Then the angel appeared to you; the angels that was speaking to him and said, â€œO â€˜Abdallah, you have lied. My eyes see it (the Night of Determination).of which Ali (a.s.) spoke to you. His (Aliâ€™s ) eyes did not see him (the angel) but his heart understood (the presence of the angel) and he impacted his ears. Then he (angel) flapped you with his wing and you turned blind.â€ Ibn â€˜Abbas then said, â€œIn the matters that we dispute it is up to Allah to judge.â€ I then said to him, â€œHas Allah judged one case with two judgments?â€ He replied, â€œNo, Allah has not done so.â€ I then said, â€œHere you perish and cause others to perish.â€", "arabicText": " 2Ù€ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠ Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ (Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§Ù…) Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø¨ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†ÙØ§ Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠ Ø¬ÙØ§Ù„ÙØ³ÙŒ ÙˆÙØ¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯ÙÙ‡Ù Ù†ÙÙÙØ±ÙŒ Ø¥ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø§Ø³Ù’ØªÙØ¶Ù’Ø­ÙÙƒÙ Ø­ÙØªÙ‘ÙÙ‰ Ø§ØºÙ’Ø±ÙÙˆÙ’Ø±ÙÙ‚ÙØªÙ’ Ø¹ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†ÙØ§Ù‡Ù Ø¯ÙÙ…ÙÙˆØ¹Ø§Ù‹ Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù‡ÙÙ„Ù’ ØªÙØ¯Ù’Ø±ÙÙˆÙ†Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ø£ÙØ¶Ù’Ø­ÙÙƒÙÙ†ÙÙŠ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙˆØ§ Ù„Ø§ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø²ÙØ¹ÙÙ…Ù Ø§Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù‘ÙØ§Ø³Ù Ø£ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù‘ÙØ°ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ù‚Ø§Ù„ÙÙˆØ§ Ø±ÙØ¨Ù‘ÙÙ†ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ø§Ø³Ù’ØªÙÙ‚Ø§Ù…ÙÙˆØ§ ÙÙÙ‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ù‡ÙÙ„Ù’ Ø±ÙØ£ÙÙŠÙ’ØªÙ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ„Ø§Ø¦ÙÙƒÙØ©Ù ÙŠÙØ§ Ø§Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù‘ÙØ§Ø³Ù ØªÙØ®Ù’Ø¨ÙØ±ÙÙƒÙ Ø¨ÙÙˆÙÙ„Ø§ÙŠÙØªÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ù„ÙÙƒÙ ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù‘ÙÙ†Ù’ÙŠÙØ§ ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ø§Ø®ÙØ±ÙØ©Ù Ù…ÙØ¹Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù…Ù’Ù†Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø®ÙÙˆÙ’ÙÙ ÙˆÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙØ²Ù’Ù†Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªÙØ¨ÙØ§Ø±ÙÙƒÙ ÙˆÙØªÙØ¹ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙ‰ ÙŠÙÙ‚ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ¤Ù’Ù…ÙÙ†ÙÙˆÙ†Ù Ø¥ÙØ®Ù’ÙˆÙØ©ÙŒ ÙˆÙÙ‚ÙØ¯Ù’ Ø¯ÙØ®ÙÙ„Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ù‡ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø¬ÙÙ…ÙÙŠØ¹Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù…Ù‘ÙØ©Ù ÙÙØ§Ø³Ù’ØªÙØ¶Ù’Ø­ÙÙƒÙ’ØªÙ Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ ØµÙØ¯ÙÙ‚Ù’ØªÙ ÙŠÙØ§ Ø§Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù‘ÙØ§Ø³Ù Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’Ø´ÙØ¯ÙÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù‡ÙÙ„Ù’ ÙÙÙŠ Ø­ÙÙƒÙ’Ù…Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¬ÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ø°ÙÙƒÙ’Ø±ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ø®Ù’ØªÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙŒ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„Ø§ ÙÙÙ‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ Ù…ÙØ§ ØªÙØ±ÙÙ‰ ÙÙÙŠ Ø±ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù Ø¶ÙØ±ÙØ¨Ù Ø±ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ø§Ù‹ Ø£ÙØµÙØ§Ø¨ÙØ¹ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ’ÙÙ Ø­ÙØªÙ‘ÙÙ‰ Ø³ÙÙ‚ÙØ·ÙØªÙ’ Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ø°ÙÙ‡ÙØ¨Ù ÙˆÙØ£ÙØªÙÙ‰ Ø±ÙØ¬ÙÙ„ÙŒ Ø¢Ø®ÙØ±Ù ÙÙØ£ÙØ·ÙØ§Ø±Ù ÙƒÙÙÙ‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙØ£ÙØªÙÙŠÙ Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’ÙƒÙ ÙˆÙØ£ÙÙ†Ù’ØªÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ø¶Ù ÙƒÙÙŠÙ’ÙÙ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ØªÙ ØµÙØ§Ù†ÙØ¹ÙŒ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø£ÙÙ‚ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‚ÙØ§Ø·ÙØ¹Ù Ø£ÙØ¹Ù’Ø·ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¯ÙÙŠÙØ©Ù ÙƒÙÙÙ‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙØ£ÙÙ‚ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ‚Ù’Ø·ÙÙˆØ¹Ù ØµÙØ§Ù„ÙØ­Ù’Ù‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ù…ÙØ§ Ø´ÙØ¦Ù’ØªÙ ÙˆÙØ§Ø¨Ù’Ø¹ÙØ«Ù’ Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø°ÙÙˆÙÙŠ Ø¹ÙØ¯Ù’Ù„Ù Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ Ø¬ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø®Ù’ØªÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙ ÙÙÙŠ Ø­ÙÙƒÙ’Ù…Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹ÙØ²Ù‘Ù Ø°ÙÙƒÙ’Ø±ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙÙ†ÙÙ‚ÙØ¶Ù’ØªÙ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙˆÙ’Ù„Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§ÙˆÙ‘ÙÙ„Ù Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹ÙØ²Ù‘Ù Ø°ÙÙƒÙ’Ø±ÙÙ‡Ù Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ­Ù’Ø¯ÙØ«Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø®ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙ‡Ù Ø´ÙÙŠÙ’Ø¦Ø§Ù‹ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙØ¯ÙÙˆØ¯Ù ÙˆÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ø³Ù ØªÙÙÙ’Ø³ÙÙŠØ±ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø±Ù’Ø¶Ù Ø§Ù‚Ù’Ø·ÙØ¹Ù’ Ù‚ÙØ§Ø·ÙØ¹Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’ÙƒÙÙÙ‘Ù Ø£ÙØµÙ’Ù„Ø§Ù‹ Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ø£ÙØ¹Ù’Ø·ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¯ÙÙŠÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ø§ØµÙØ§Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù Ù‡ÙÙƒÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø­ÙÙƒÙ’Ù…Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù„ÙØ©Ù‹ ÙŠÙÙ†Ù’Ø²ÙÙ„Ù ÙÙÙŠÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¬ÙØ­ÙØ¯Ù’ØªÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ø³ÙÙ…ÙØ¹Ù’ØªÙ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø±ÙØ³ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ (ØµÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙØ¢Ù„ÙÙ‡) ÙÙØ£ÙØ¯Ù’Ø®ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ§Ø±Ù ÙƒÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø£ÙØ¹Ù’Ù…ÙÙ‰ Ø¨ÙØµÙØ±ÙÙƒÙ ÙŠÙÙˆÙ’Ù…Ù Ø¬ÙØ­ÙØ¯Ù’ØªÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠ Ø·ÙØ§Ù„ÙØ¨Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙÙÙ„ÙØ°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ø¹ÙÙ…ÙÙŠÙ Ø¨ÙØµÙØ±ÙÙŠ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙˆÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø¹ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙÙƒÙ Ø¨ÙØ°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ ÙÙÙˆÙ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¹ÙÙ…ÙÙŠÙ Ø¨ÙØµÙØ±ÙÙŠ Ø¥ÙÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ ØµÙÙÙ’Ù‚ÙØ©Ù Ø¬ÙÙ†ÙØ§Ø­Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙÙØ§Ø³Ù’ØªÙØ¶Ù’Ø­ÙÙƒÙ’ØªÙ Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù ØªÙØ±ÙÙƒÙ’ØªÙÙ‡Ù ÙŠÙÙˆÙ’Ù…ÙÙ‡Ù Ø°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ù„ÙØ³ÙØ®ÙØ§ÙÙØ©Ù Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ù„ÙÙ‚ÙÙŠØªÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ ÙŠÙØ§ Ø§Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù‘ÙØ§Ø³Ù Ù…ÙØ§ ØªÙÙƒÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙ…Ù’ØªÙ Ø¨ÙØµÙØ¯Ù’Ù‚Ù Ù…ÙØ«Ù’Ù„Ù Ø£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø³Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„ÙÙƒÙ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠ Ø·ÙØ§Ù„ÙØ¨Ù (Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§Ù…) Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ù„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù„ÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‚ÙØ¯Ù’Ø±Ù ÙÙÙŠ ÙƒÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ø³ÙÙ†ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙŠÙÙ†Ù’Ø²ÙÙ„Ù ÙÙÙŠ ØªÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ’Ù„ÙØ©Ù Ø£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±Ù Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ†ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ù„ÙØ°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù…Ù’Ø±Ù ÙˆÙÙ„Ø§Ø©Ù‹ Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø±ÙØ³ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ (ØµÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙØ¢Ù„ÙÙ‡) ÙÙÙ‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù‡ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø£ÙÙ†ÙØ§ ÙˆÙØ£ÙØ­ÙØ¯Ù Ø¹ÙØ´ÙØ±Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ ØµÙÙ„Ù’Ø¨ÙÙŠ Ø£ÙØ¦ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ©ÙŒ Ù…ÙØ­ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙØ«ÙÙˆÙ†Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£ÙØ±ÙØ§Ù‡ÙØ§ ÙƒÙØ§Ù†ÙØªÙ’ Ø¥ÙÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙØ¹Ù Ø±ÙØ³ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙØªÙØ¨ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‰ Ù„ÙÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù‘ÙØ°ÙÙŠ ÙŠÙØ­ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙØ«ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙƒÙØ°ÙØ¨Ù’ØªÙ ÙŠÙØ§ Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø±ÙØ£ÙØªÙ’ Ø¹ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†ÙØ§ÙŠÙ Ø§Ù„Ù‘ÙØ°ÙÙŠ Ø­ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙØ«ÙÙƒÙ Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙŒ ÙˆÙÙ„ÙÙ…Ù’ ØªÙØ±ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†ÙØ§Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙÙ†Ù’ ÙˆÙØ¹ÙÙ‰ Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙÙˆÙÙ‚ÙØ±Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø³ÙÙ…Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‡Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù ØµÙÙÙÙ‚ÙÙƒÙ Ø¨ÙØ¬ÙÙ†ÙØ§Ø­ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙØ¹ÙÙ…ÙÙŠØªÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø§Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù‘ÙØ§Ø³Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ø§Ø®Ù’ØªÙÙ„ÙÙÙ’Ù†ÙØ§ ÙÙÙŠ Ø´ÙÙŠÙ’â€Ø¡Ù ÙÙØ­ÙÙƒÙ’Ù…ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙÙ‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙ‡ÙÙ„Ù’ Ø­ÙÙƒÙÙ…Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙÙŠ Ø­ÙÙƒÙ’Ù…Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø­ÙÙƒÙ’Ù…ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¨ÙØ£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ù„Ø§ ÙÙÙ‚ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙ Ù‡ÙØ§Ù‡ÙÙ†ÙØ§ Ù‡ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ’ØªÙ ÙˆÙØ£ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„ÙÙƒÙ’ØªÙ.", (Through the same chain of narrators) it has been narrated from Abi â€˜Abdillah (a.s.) who has said the following. ", "thaqalaynMatn": "â€œOnce, in a meeting in the presence of my father with a group of people also present my father smiled and (the feeling was quite intense it caused) tears flooded his eyes. He then asked, â€œDo you know what made me laugh?â€ The narrator has said that they said, â€œNo, we do not know the reason.â€ The Imam (a.s.) said, â€œIbn â€˜Abbas thinks he is of the people mention in the following verse of the Holy Quran. â€œTo those who have said, â€œGod is our Lord, â€œ and who have remained steadfast to their belief, the angels will descend saying, â€œDo not be afraid or grieved. Receive the glad news of the Paradise which was promised to you.â€ (41:30). I asked him, â€œHave you seen the angels, O Ibn â€˜Abbas, telling you of the fact that they guard and protect you in this and the next world and provide you complete protection and security from fear and sadness?â€ The Imam (a.s.) then said that Ibn â€˜Abbas said, â€œBelievers are each otherâ€™s brothers. . .â€ (49:10) the whole community is included in this verse.â€ I then laughed.â€ Then I said, â€œO Ibn â€˜Abbas, you (perhaps) are right. However, I ask you to swear to Allah and answer me truthfully. Is there any disharmony in the judgment of Allah, Majestic is Whose mention?â€ He said, â€œNo, there is no disharmony in His judgment.â€ â€œI then asked him, â€œHow would you judge the case in which a man strikes the fingers of another man with a sword until they fall. Then another man comes and cuts off his palm. He is brought to you and you are the judge. How would you then judge?â€ He said, â€œI will order the one who cut off the palm to pay compensation for the whole hand. I will ask the affected party to reach a settlement with the defendant and for this purpose I send them to the people of justice (arbitrator).â€ I said, â€œ(In your judgment) disharmony has come in the laws of Allah, Majestic is Whose mention, thus, you invalidated what you said before (that there is no disharmony in the laws and judgment of Allah). Allah, Majestic is Whose mention, disdains to let a judicial case remain on earth without a clarified rule. You must order, as a judge, to cut the palm of the defendant totally and pay compensation for the fingers. Thus, is the judgment of Allah at the night wherein His orders descend. If you would reject after hearing from the Messenger of Allah then Allah will send you to fire just as He blinded you on the day you hid the (truth) in favor of Ali ibn abu Talib (a.s.).â€ Ibn â€˜Abbas then said, â€œIs that why my eyes have become blind?â€ He further said, â€œHow would you know that? I swear by Allah that my eyes turned blind only because of the flapping of the wing of the angel.â€ The Imam (a.s.) said, â€œThat made me laugh. I left him that day because of the silliness (dark and dullness) in his intellect and reason. I then met him latter and said to him, â€œO Ibn â€˜Abbas, you have not spoken as true as you did yesterday. Ali ibn abu Talib (a.s.) told you that the Night of Determination comes every year. On that night the command for the whole year comes down. For that matter and command is the people with Divine authority after the Messenger of Allah. You then asked, â€œWho are these people?â€ He (Ali (a.s.) said, â€œI myself and the eleven men from my descendents will be the Imams (leaders with divine authority) and the (people to whom angels speak) Muhaddathun.â€ You then said, â€œI do not see it (Night of Determination) except with the Messenger of Allah. Then the angel appeared to you; the angels that was speaking to him and said, â€œO â€˜Abdallah, you have lied. My eyes see it (the Night of Determination).of which Ali (a.s.) spoke to you. His (Aliâ€™s ) eyes did not see him (the angel) but his heart understood (the presence of the angel) and he impacted his ears. Then he (angel) flapped you with his wing and you turned blind.â€ Ibn â€˜Abbas then said, â€œIn the matters that we dispute it is up to Allah to judge.â€ I then said to him, â€œHas Allah judged one case with two judgments?â€ He replied, â€œNo, Allah has not done so.â€ I then said, â€œHere you perish and cause others to perish.â€", "gradingsFull": [ { "grade_en": null, "grade_ar": "Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ®Ø±Ø¬Ù‡", "reference_en": "Sahih al-Kafi", "author": { "name_en": "Shaykh Baqir al-Behbudi", "name_ar": null, "link": null, "death_date": null } }, { "grade_en": null, "grade_ar": " Ø³Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ ÙƒÙ…Ø§ ØªÙ‚Ø¯Ù… ", "reference_en": "MirÊ¾Ät al-Ê¿UqÅ«l fÄ« Shará¸¥ AkhbÄr Ä€l al-RasÅ«l (3/74)", "author": { "name_en": "Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi", "name_ar": null, "link": null, "death_date": null } } ] }, { "id": 128, "bookId": "Al-Kafi-Volume-1-Kulayni", "book": "Al-KÄfi", "category": "The Book on Virtue of Knowledge", "categoryId": "2", "chapter": "Chapter on Miscellaneous Issues", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. Humbleness is his head, freedom from jealousy forms his eyes, proper understanding shapes his ears, truthfulness constitutes his tongue, research and investigation produce his memory, optimism stands for his heart, the knowledge of facts and affairs strengthen his intellect. Intelligence and kindness are his hands, visitation of the scholars builds his legs, safety and peace emerge from his stamina, chastity develops his wisdom, salvation is his head quarters, good health and tranquility are his lead, loyalty will provide him his conveyance, politeness in communication gives him weapons, consent frames his sword, yielding to the truth stands for his bow and arrow, communication with the scholars establishes his army, proper discipline treasures his wealth, avoiding sins preserves his savings, uprightness institutes his supplies, amicable dealings supply him Abu â€˜Abdallah al-â€˜Asimiy has narrated from Ali ibn al-Hassan from Ali ibn Asbat from al-Hassan ibn al-Juham from Abul Hassan al-Ridha (as) that when our people mentioned the intellect (al-'Aql) he (al-Ridha) (as) said: \"Those without intellect (al-'Aql) are not regarded among the people of religion.\" I said, \"May I be your ransom, some describe this matter (i.e. Imamah) to a group who are acceptable to us, yet lack such intelligence.\" He replied, \"These are not the ones Allah addressed. Indeed, Allah created the intellect (al-'Aql) and said to it, 'Step forward' and it came forward. Then he said, 'Step back,' and it went back. He then said, 'By My glory and majesty, I have not created anything better than you, nor anything dearer to me than you.
