Ø£ÙˆØ¬Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù„ÙŠÙ„ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù…Ù„Ø© Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ØªÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø­ÙƒÙ…Ø© ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ØªÙ‚Ø¹ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ ØµÙˆØ§Ø¨Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ¬Ø² Ù„Ø¬Ù‡Ù„Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ù„Ù„ ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„ØªÙØµÙŠÙ„ Ø£Ù† Ù†Ù‚Ù ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ Ø¹Ø±ÙÙ†Ø§Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø¬Ù…Ù„Ø© Ø£Ø­ÙƒØ§Ù…Ù‡Ø§ØŒ Ù„Ø§ Ø³ÙŠÙ…Ø§ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ø¹Ø±ÙÙ†Ø§ Ø¹Ø¬Ø² Ø£Ù†ÙØ³Ù†Ø§ Ø¹Ù† Ù…Ø¹Ø±ÙØ© Ø¹Ù„Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø´ÙŠØ§Ø¡ ÙˆÙ‚ØµÙˆØ±Ù‡Ø§ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ø­Ø§Ø·Ø© Ø¨Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø²Ø¦ÙŠØ§ØªØŒ Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ Ø£Ø±Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ù† Ù†Ø¹Ø±Ù Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù…Ù„Ø© Ø§Ù„ØªÙŠ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ³Ø¹ Ø¬Ù‡Ù„Ù‡Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø­ÙƒØ§Ù… Ø£ÙØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ØŒ ÙØ£Ù…Ø§ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ Ø£Ø±Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ù† Ù†Ø³ØªÙ‚ØµÙŠ Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ù†ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ ÙˆÙ†Ø¨Ø­Ø« Ø¹Ù† Ø¹Ù„Ù„Ù‡Ø§ ÙÙ„Ù† Ù†Ø¹Ø¯Ù… ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø¨Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ø±ÙÙ†Ø§ Ù…Ù† ÙˆØ¬Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙƒÙ…Ø© ÙÙŠ ØªÙØµÙŠÙ„Ø§ØªÙ‡Ø§ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØµØ¯Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù„Ø§Ù„Ø© Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø¬Ù…Ù„ØªÙ‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¯Ù„ÙŠÙ„ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù† Ø£ÙØ¹Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø­ÙƒÙ…Ø© Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯Ù‡Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„ØªÙ†Ø§Ù‚Ø¶ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ø§Ù…ØªÙ‡Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„ØªÙØ§ÙˆØª ÙˆØªØ¹Ù„Ù‚ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ø§ Ø¨Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ ÙˆØ­Ø§Ø¬Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø´Ø¦ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø«Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ§Ø¦ØªÙ„Ø§ÙÙ‡ Ø¨Ø´ÙƒÙ„Ù‡ ÙˆØ§ØªØµØ§Ù„ ÙƒÙ„ Ù†ÙˆØ¹ Ø¨Ø´Ø¨Ù‡Ù‡ Ø­ØªÙ‰ Ù„Ùˆ ØªÙˆÙ‡Ù…Øª Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø®Ù„Ø§Ù Ù…Ø§ Ù‡ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù† Ø¯ÙˆØ±Ø§Ù† Ø£ÙÙ„Ø§ÙƒÙ‡Ø§ ÙˆØ­Ø±ÙƒØ© Ø´Ù…Ø³Ù‡Ø§ ÙˆÙ‚Ù…Ø±Ù‡Ø§ ÙˆÙ…Ø³ÙŠØ± ÙƒÙˆØ§ÙƒØ¨Ù‡Ø§ Ù„Ø§Ù†ØªÙ‚Ø¶Øª ÙˆÙØ³Ø¯ØªØŒ ÙÙ„Ù…Ø§ Ø§Ø³ØªÙˆÙØª Ø£ÙØ¹Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ù…Ø§ Ø°ÙƒØ±Ù†Ø§Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø´Ø±Ø§Ø¦Ø· Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¯Ù„ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù…Øª Ù…Ù…Ø§ Ù‚Ø¯Ù…Ù†Ø§Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø¹Ù„Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¬ÙˆØ± ØµØ­ Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ø§ Ø­ÙƒÙ…Ø©ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¯Ù„ÙŠÙ„ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ‚Ø¹ Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¸Ù„Ù… ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠÙØ¹Ù„Ù‡ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù‚Ø¯ Ø«Ø¨Øª Ø£Ù†Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠÙ… ØºÙ†ÙŠ Ø¹Ø§Ù„Ù… Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ¬Ù‡Ù„ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¸Ù„Ù… Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ‚Ø¹ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø¬Ø§Ù‡Ù„ Ø¨Ù‚Ø¨Ø­Ù‡ Ø£Ùˆ Ù…Ø­ØªØ§Ø¬ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ ÙØ¹Ù„Ù‡ Ù…Ù†ØªÙØ¹ Ø¨Ù‡ØŒ ÙÙ„Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø£Ù†Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØºÙ†ÙŠØ§ Ù„Ø§ ØªØ¬ÙˆØ² Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø§ÙØ¹ Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¶Ø§Ø± Ø¹Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø§ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† ÙˆÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ù…Ù† Ù‚Ø¨ÙŠØ­ ÙˆØ­Ø³Ù† ØµØ­ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙØ¹Ù„ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙƒÙ…Ø© ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ­Ø¯Ø« Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø§Ù„ØµÙˆØ§Ø¨ØŒ Ø£Ù„Ø§ ØªØ±Ù‰ Ø£Ù† Ù…Ù† ØµØ­Øª Ø­ÙƒÙ…ØªÙ‡ Ù…Ù†Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØªÙˆÙ‚Ø¹ Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø¹ ØºÙ†Ø§Ø¦Ù‡ Ø¹Ù† ÙØ¹Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¨ÙŠØ­ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯Ø±ØªÙ‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ØªØ±ÙƒÙ‡ ÙˆØ¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ Ø¨Ù‚Ø¨Ø­Ù‡ ÙˆÙ…Ø§ ÙŠØ³ØªØ­Ù‚ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø°Ù… Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ÙØ¹Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ø±ØªÙƒØ§Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¸Ø§Ø¦Ù… ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ®Ø§Ù Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…ÙˆØ§Ù‚Ø¹Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¨Ø§Ø¦Ø­ØŒ ÙˆÙ‡Ø°Ø§ Ø¨ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ù„Ù„Ù‡. ", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/14/2/61/12", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 61, "thaqalaynSanad": "12. And with the same chain of transmission: on the authority of Hammad ibn `Uthman, on the authority of `Amir ibn `Abd Allah that Abu `Abd Allah al-Sadiq (AS) said, ", "thaqalaynMatn": "On the grave of Ibrahim, son of the Messenger of Allah (SA), there was a branch that shaded it from sunlight. By the time the branch dried up, the marks of the grave had vanished and its place was not know. He (AS) also added, When Ibrahim, son of the Messenger of Allah (SA) died, he was eighteen months old. Therefore, Allah, the Mighty and High, had his suckling period completed in Paradise. The Compiler of this book says concerning children and their state: Verily, the process of recognizing justice and injustice, and the way of differentiation between the two or aversion from them, is not something innate. In fact, it is due to the approval or disapproval of the intellect. Therefore, it is not permissible for us to refuse the evil of an action due to our ignorance of its causes. Nor should we take it out from the boundary of justice based on its apparent from. Rather the method, when we intend to understand the reality of a category of actions that is hidden to us, should be the rational one. We should turn to proofs that indicate the wisdom of their doers, and we should be devoted to proofs that introduce us to the state of its doer. If He acts wisely and justly, then it must necessarily apply to all of His actions, whether or not we are ignorant of their causes. This is because, as far as the intellect is concerned, there is no shortcoming in one category of actions without the other, or specification for one genus without the other. Take the case of a father, for example, who we know to be just. If he amputates a limb from his son for a reason that we are ignorant of, we cannot declare that he is unjust since we are unaware of the reason for which he did so. As a whole, this is due to his fair appearance and good intent for his son. The actions of Allah, the All-Knowing of the ends and beginnings, are similar, Blessed and Exalted be Hi. Reason requires us to believe that His Actions must be wise and just. We cannot limit ourselves to what we know because we are ignorant of all the details which motivate His Actions. We understand that we are unable to understand the causes of all things, since we do not understand them in full. This is when we intend to understand a sentence that enables its ignorance from the rules of His Actions, the Mighty and High. However, if we intend to explore its meanings and discuss its causes then we are not short of intellects, with the praise of Allah, that may make us recognize the rational reasoning in their details, what confirms the indication on a whole. The proof that the actions of Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, are based on wisdom is that they are far form contradiction and secure from differentiation. The proof can also be found in their interconnectedness, the need of things to their likes, and the damaging of its shape and connecting of every category to its resemblance until it is imagined that it is other than what is seems. The rotation of the heavens and the movement of the sun and the moon, and the travel of the stars would certainly obliterate and be destroyed. Thus, when the actions of Allah, the Mighty and High, execute what we have mentioned regarding the reasons for justice and injustice, we can only conclude that they are based on wisdom. The proof the Mighty and High does not oppress can be found in the fact hat He, Blessed and Exalted, is Eternal, Self-Sufficient, and All-Knowing. Furthermore, He cannot act ignorantly. Oppression only occurs among the ignorant or those who seek personal benefit. Since He, the Blessed and Exalted, is Eternal and Self-Sufficient, He does not benefit or lose anything fro knowing what was, and what will be good and evil. Everything He does is out of wisdom, and everything He does is Right. Do you to see that those who are wise do not commit evil, as he has sufficient self-control to refrain from evil. Whoever commits a major sin deserves criticism. Therefore, the existence of evil is not feared from Him and this is clear. All praise is due to Allah.", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 161, "bookId": "Uyun-akhbar-al-Rida-Volume-1-Saduq", "book": "Ê¿UyÅ«n akhbÄr al-Riá¸Ä", "category": "Content", "categoryId": "2", "chapter": "A Session in the Presence of Al-maâ€™mun of al-Ridhaâ€™s Debate On Unity With Soleiman Al-marwazi - the Theologian From Khorasan", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Dr. Ali Peiravi", "englishText": "13-1 Abu Jaâ€™far Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Ahmad, the jurist, narrated that Abu Muhammad Al-Hassan ibn Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Sadaqat al-Qumi quoted on the authority of Abu Amr Muhammad ibn Abdul Aziz Al-Ansari al-Kajji, on the authority of Al-Hassan ibn Muhammad al-Nawfali, that Soleiman al-Marwazi, the most prominent religious scholar in Khorasan, went to see Al-Maâ€™mun. Al-Maâ€™mun honored him, granted him gifts and said, â€œMy cousin Ali ibn Musa Al-Ridha (s) has come here from Hijaz. He likes theology and theologians. Thus it would not be any trouble if you came to hold adebate with him on the 8th of Dhul-Hajja (the Day of Tarwiyah) to have a debate with him.â€Soleiman said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! I dislike questioning him in your session and amongst a group of the Hashemites. The people will regard him as incapable when he debates with me on theology. Incapabilities are not permissible for him.â€Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œI have invited you because I know that you are learned (in theology). I have no intentions except for you to silence him in an argument.â€ Soleiman said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! I will do it for you. Just bring us together. Just sit back and watch.â€Then Al-Maâ€™mun sent someone after Al-Ridha (s) and said, â€œA man from Marwaz who is not equal to you in theology has come and asked for you to come to us. Come here if you do not mind.â€ The Imam (s) made ablutions and told us to go ahead. Imran As-Saâ€™ebee was with us. We went until we arrived at Al-Maâ€™munâ€™s court. Yasir and Khalid took my hands and led me in. When I got in and greeted (Al-Maâ€™mun), he asked, â€œWhere is my brother Abul Hassan whom may the Sublime God maintain?â€ I said, â€œWhen we were coming he was putting on his clothes. He ordered us to go ahead.â€ Then I added, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! Your servant Imran is also with me. He is right outside.â€ He said, â€œWho is Imran?â€ I said, â€œHe is the Sabian who became a Muslim because of you.â€ He said, â€œLet him in.â€ Then Imran came in. Al-Maâ€™mun welcomed him and then told him, â€œO Imran! You did not die and join the Hashemites!â€ Imran said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! Praise be to God who honored me by you.â€ Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Imran! This is Soleiman al-Marwazi who is the theologian from Khorasan.â€ Imran said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! He thinks that he is the only one in Khorasan versed in theoretical principles and refutes origination (bidaâ€™). Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œWhy donâ€™t you have a debate with him?â€ Imran said, â€œThis depends on him.â€ Then Al-Ridha (s) came in and asked, â€œWhat were you discussing?â€ Imran said, â€œO son of the Prophet of God! This is Soleiman al-Marwazi.â€Soleiman told Imran, â€œWill you be pleased with Abil Hassan (s) and what he says about origination. Imran said, â€œYes, I will if he (s) presents arguments which I can present when I argue with other theologians like myself.â€Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Abul Hassan! What is your opinion regarding what they argue about?â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! How could you not believe in origination while the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of nothing?â€™ And the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜It is He Who begins (the process of) Creation; then repeats itâ€¦â€™ And says, â€˜To Him is due the primal origin of the heavens and the earthâ€¦â€™ Moreover, the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜He adds to Creation as He pleasesâ€¦â€™ and says, â€˜â€¦He began the Creation of man with (nothing more than) clay.â€™ Also the Honorable the Exalted God says, â€˜There are (yet) others, held in suspense for the command of God, whether He will punish them, or turn in mercy to themâ€¦â€™ And the Honorable the Exalted God says, â€˜â€¦Nor is a man long-lived granted length of days, nor is a part cut off from his life, but is in a Decree (ordained)â€¦â€™ Soleiman asked, â€œHas anything been narrated to you on this issue from your forefather?â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œYes. It has been narrated by my father on the authority of Abi Abdullah (s) who said, â€œThe Honorable the Exalted God has two bodies of knowledge: a Treasured Knowledge, Hidden Knowledge which no one but Him is informed of. Origination is rooted in that knowledge. And He has a second knowledge which He has taught the angels and His Messengers which the knowledgeable Members of the Holy Household are also aware of.â€Soleiman said, â€œI would like you to present this from the Book of the Honorable the Exalted God.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThe Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜So turn away from them: not thine is the blame.â€™ At first God wanted to destroy them. But then the Sublime God changed His mind and said, â€˜But teach (thy Message) for teaching benefits the Believers.â€™ Soleiman said, â€œMay I be your ransom! Tell me more.â€ Then Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œMy father (s) informed me on the authority of his forefathers (s), on the authority of Godâ€™s Prophet (s) that the Honorable the Exalted God revealed to one of His Prophets to let one of the Kings know that God will take away his life at such and such a time. The Prophet (s) went to see the King and told him that. Then the King pleaded to God while he was on his bed and fell off of it. He said, â€œO Lord! Postpone my demise until I see my son grow up to undertake my affairs.â€ Then the Honorablethe Exalted God revealed to that Prophet (s), â€œGo to that King and inform him that I have decided to postpone his death. I have added fifteen years to his life.â€The Prophet (s) said, â€œO Lord! You well know that I have never lied.â€ Then the Honorable the Exalted God revealed to him, â€œYou are just an agent. Announce this to him. God is never questioned about what He does.â€ Then the Imam (s) turned towards Soleiman and said, â€œI think you have the same opinion as the Jews in this regard.â€ Soleiman said, â€œFrom this I seek refuge in God.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThe Jews say, â€˜Godâ€™s hand is tied up...â€™ They mean that God is finished working and is sitting back and does not Create anything else. But the Honorable the Exalted God has given them the following answer, â€˜â€¦Be their hands tied up and be they accursed for the (blasphemy) they utterâ€¦.â€™ I have also heard my father Musa ibn Jaâ€™far (s) say the following when asked about Origination, â€˜How could the people refute origination, and that God might procrastinate the affairs of some people for a decision regarding them?â€™â€Soleiman asked, â€œCan you tell me for what has the following verse been revealed? â€˜We have indeed revealed this (Message) in the Night of Power.â€™ The Imam (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! The Honorable the Exalted God will decide the destiny (of an individual) for one year including life or death, good or bad, and sustenance on the Night of Power. Whatever God destines on that night comes to be.â€ Soleiman said, â€œNow I understand. Please tell me more.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Some of the affairs are up to the Honorable the Exalted God and what He wills. He can expedite what He wills and procrastinate what He wills. He can destroy what He wills. O Soleiman, Ali (s) said, â€œKnowledge is of two types: Knowledge which God has taught His angels and His Messengers - that which God has taught His angels and His Messengers will be done, and that which is hidden near Him and He has informed none of His creatures of it. It is by this knowledge which He expedites what He wills to expedite, procrastinates what He wills to procrastinate; destroys what He wills to destroy, and He stabilizes what He wills to stabilize.â€Soleiman told Al-Maâ€™mun, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! From today on I will not refute Creation or deny it by Godâ€™s Will.â€ Al-Maâ€™mun said,â€œO Soleiman! Ask Abul Hassan whatever you wish. Just listen carefully and be fair.â€ Soleiman said, â€œO my Master! May I ask?â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œAsk whatever you wish.â€Soleiman said, â€œWhat is your view about someone who considers will to be a name - an attribute similar to â€˜ livingâ€™, â€˜hearingâ€™, â€˜seeingâ€™, and â€˜powerfulâ€™?â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYou say that things were originated and became different because He so desired and willed. But you do not say that things were originated and became different because He is All-Hearing and All-Seeing. This is a proof that they (i.e. will and desire) are not similar to All-Hearing, All-Seeing, and All-Powerful.â€Soleiman said, â€œHe has always been willing.â€ The Imam answered him, â€œO Soleiman! Is His will something other than Him?â€He replied, â€œYes.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen you have proved that there has always been something along with Him forever.â€ Soleiman said, â€œNo, I have not.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œIs will originated?â€ Soleiman said, â€œNo. It is not.â€ Then Al-Maâ€™mun shouted at him and said, â€œO Soleiman! Are you showing obstinacy and giving vague answers to such a person as him. You must be fair. Donâ€™t you see that people of intellect are sitting around you?â€ Then Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Abul Hassan! Continue your debate on theology with him since he is the theologian of Khorasan.â€Then the Imam asked him, â€œO Soleiman! Is it (the will) originated? Whatever is not Eternal is certainly originated. And if it is not originated it is Eternal.â€Soleiman said, â€œHis (Allahâ€™s) will is (part) of Him just as His Hearing, His Sight and His Knowledge are (parts) of Him.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDid He will Himself?â€ Soleiman answered, â€œNo.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œTherefore, willing is not like the hearing and the seeing.â€ Soleiman said, â€œSurely, He willed Himself just as He heard Himself, saw Himself, and recognized Himself.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œWhat is the meaning of â€˜He willed Himselfâ€™? Did He will to be a thing? Did He will to be All-Living, All-Hearing, All-Seeing or All-Powerful?â€Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDid that occur through His will?â€ Soleiman answered, â€˜Yes.â€™ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThen your statement, â€˜Hewilled to be All-Living, All-Hearing, and All-Seeing,â€™ does not make any sense since they were not done through His Will.â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes. That was through His Will.â€Then Al-Maâ€™mun and the people around him burst into laughter. Al-Ridha (s) laughed too and said, â€œDo not be too hard on the theologian from Khorasan. O Soleiman! â€œDo you think that He (i.e. Allah, the Exalted) has altered from state to state and changed due to it? This is something by which the Honorable the Exalted God cannot be described.â€ Soleiman remained silent.Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! May I ask you a question?â€Soleiman said, â€œMay I be your ransom! Ask.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œTell me about you and your companions: Do you debate with the people on theology according to what you understand and know or according to what you do not understand and do not know?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes! (We debate) according to what we understand and know.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThe thing which the people know is that the willing is different from the will. The willing exists before the will. The subject is before the object. This (statement) disproves your statement, â€˜The willing and the willed are the same thing.â€™â€ Soleiman said, â€œMay I be your ransom! This is not what the people know about and understand.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œI think that you have claimed to have the knowledge without having a true recognition of it and said, â€™Willing is like hearing and seeingâ€™ while this view is not based on knowledge or the intellect.â€ Soleiman could not answer.Then Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Does God have knowledge of all those who are in Paradise and the Fire?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œWill what the Sublime God knows would be created in the future, actually be created?â€ Soleiman answered, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œIf it is done to the extent that nothing else remains, can God add more to them or will He stop doing so?â€Soleiman said, â€œHe will add to them.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen based on what you have said, God adds to them what He did not know would be created.â€ Then he added, â€œMay I be your ransom! There is no limit foradding.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen in your opinion His Knowledge does not encompass what is therein (in Paradise), since He does not know the limit of that which will be in Paradise. If His Knowledge does not encompass what is therein, then He would not know what will be there before they existed. The Honorable the Exalted God is Exalted High above that!â€Soleiman said, â€œWhen I said God does not know about them it was because they have no limit and the Honorable the Exalted God Himself has described them as eternal. Therefore we do not want to assume an end for them.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œGodâ€™s Knowledge of them will not limit them. There are many instances of which He has knowledge, then He adds to them and does not take away what He has added to them. These are supported by the Words of the Honorable the Exalted God in His Book, â€˜â€¦as often as their skins are roasted through, We shall change them for fresh skins, that they may taste the penaltyâ€¦â€™ And He told the residents of Paradise, â€˜â€¦a gift without break.â€™ And the Honorable the Exalted said, â€˜Whose season is not limited, nor (supply) forbidden?â€™ Therefore the Honorable the Exalted God knows about these and does not block them from accessing to what is added. Will He not replace what the residents of Paradise eat and drink?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œHas He stopped His Granting now that He has replaced the consumed foods and drinks?â€ Soleiman said, â€œNo.â€Then Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Tell me about Will: Is it an action or not?â€Soleiman said, â€œIt is an action.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œTherefore it is originated, for all actions are originated.â€ Soleiman said, â€œIt is not an action.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œHas there then been something else with Him who is eternal?â€ Soleiman said, â€œThe Will is the same as bringing forth.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! This is exactly what you criticized Dirar and his companions of, saying that everything that the Honorable the Exalted God has created in the heavens, the Earth, the oceans or on land such as dogs, pigs, monkeys, humans or animals are Godâ€™s Will, and that Godâ€™s Will lives, dies, goes away, eats, drinks, marries, feels pleasure, oppresses, commits immoral acts, disbelieves, becomes a polytheist. We denounce this and oppose it. This is its limit.â€Soleiman said, â€œIt (i.e. will) is like hearing, seeing and knowledge.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYou just returned to what you said before. Tell me: Are hearing, seeing and knowledge made?â€Soleiman said, â€œNo.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œHow do you then refute Will? You sometimes say that He did not will and sometimes you say that He willed, and that it (i.e. will) was not one of His actions.â€Soleiman said, â€œSurely, that is like saying, He sometimes knows and sometimes does not know!â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThat is not the same, for negating the known is not like negating knowledge; negating what is willed is (not like) negating the will, for if the thing is not willed, there will be no will. However, sometimes there is knowledge, but there may be no known thing. This is like seeing. Man may be able to see, but there may be nothing there for him to see. Likewise, there may be knowledge, but there is no known thing.â€ Soleiman said, â€œIt (i.e. will) is made.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œTherefore, it (will) is originated and is not like hearing and seeing, for hearing and seeing are not made, and it (will) is made.â€Soleiman said, â€œIt (will) is one of His eternal attributes.â€ The Imam (s) answered, â€œTherefore, man must be eternal, for his quality is eternal.â€Soleiman said, â€œNo, because He did not do it (will)â€. Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Khorasani! How often you make mistakes! Are things not made according to His Will and Words?â€ Soleiman said, â€œNo.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œIf things are not made according to His Will or Volition, His Command or His Practice, then how are they made? God is High Exalted above that!â€ Soleiman could not respond.Then Al-Ridha (s) asked, â€œWill you not tell me about these Words of the Honorable the Exalted God: â€˜When We decide to destroy a population, We (first) send a definite order to those among them who are given the good things of this life and yet transgressâ€¦â€™By â€˜We decideâ€™ does God mean that He creates His own Will?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) answered him, â€œIf He creates His own Will, then your statement that â€˜Will is He Himself or is a part of himâ€™ is futile, for it is not (possible) for Him to create Himself and God does not change His State. God is High Exalted above that.â€Soleiman told him, â€œYes.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen if He originates the Will, what you said, â€œWill is the same as God Himself or a part thereofâ€ is wrong since God does not originate Himself or change from His current state. God is High Exalted above that.â€Soleiman asked, â€œBy that He does not mean that He creates His own will?â€The Imam (s) asked, â€œSo what does He mean?â€Soleiman said, â€œHe means doing something.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œWoe unto you! How many times have you repeated this issue? I told you that will is originated, since the action and the Creation of a thing is originated.â€Soleiman said, â€œThen this has no meaning.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDo you then think that He describes Himself with will which has no meaning? If will has no eternal or originated meaning, then that will nullify your statement, â€œThe Honorable the Exalted God has always been willing.â€ Soleiman said, â€œI mean to say that willing has been one of the eternal actions of the Sublime God.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œDonâ€™t you know that what is eternal cannot be made, originated and eternal at the same time?â€Soleiman could not answer. Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œNever mind! Complete your questions.â€ Soleiman said, â€œDid you say that Will is one of His Attributes?â€The Imam (s) said, â€œWhy do you repeat this so many times? Are His Attributes originated or eternal?â€ Soleiman said, â€œOriginated.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œGod is the Greatest! You are telling me that the Will is originated, even though it is one of His Eternal Attributes. Therefore God has not willed anything!â€ The Imam (s) added, â€œWhatever is eternal is not created.â€Soleiman said, â€œThings are not the same as the will, and He did not will anything.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! You are whispering. Has God created what He has not willed to create? This is an attribute of someone who does not know what he is doing. God is High Exalted above that!â€Soleiman said, â€œO my Master! I have already informed you that it is like hearing, seeing and knowing.â€Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Soleiman! Woe unto you! How often have you erred and how often have you have repeated yourself? Stop it and take up another issue since you seem to be unable to provide any better answer than that.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! Leave him alone! Do not interrupt his questions, since then he will regard it as an argument (against me). O Soleiman! Speak.â€Soleiman said, â€œI have already informed you that it is like hearing, seeing and knowing.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œNever mind! Tell me whether will has one meaning or several meanings.â€ Soleiman said, â€œOne meaning.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œIs the meaning of all the wills then the same?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œIf its meanings are the same, then it must be that the will to stand up is the same as the will to sit down, or the will to live isthe same as the will to die. If His Will is all one thing, then none of Godâ€™s desires will take precedence over any others. None will be any different from any others. They will all be one thing.â€Soleiman replied, â€œSurely, the meanings are different.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œThen, tell me about the willed. Is it the same as the will or is it something else?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes. It is the same as the will.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThen according to you the willed is something else since it is the same as the will.â€ Soleiman said, â€œO my Master! Will is not the same as the willed.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThen will is originated. Otherwise it must be that something else existed along with God. Understand this well. Continue on with your questions.â€Soleiman said, â€œIt is one of His Names.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDid He name Himself that?â€Soleimam replied, â€œNo. He did not name Himself that.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œTherefore, you have no right to name Him with what He did not name Himself.â€ Soleiman said, â€œBut He described Himself to be willed.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThe fact that He has described Himself as willed does not mean that He wanted to inform us that He is the Will, or that Will is one of His Names.â€ Soleiman said, â€œThat is because His Will is the same as His Knowledge.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Ignorant one! If He knows something, does that not mean that He has willed it.â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€ The Imam (s) asked, â€œBut if He does not will something, does that mean that He does not know it?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œWhat is your source for that statement? What is the evidence that His Will is the same as His Knowledge? He may know something but never Will it. This is supported by what the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜If it were Our Will, We could take away that which We have sent thee by inspirationâ€¦â€™ And God knows how to take it away, but He never will.â€ Soleiman said, â€œThat is because He has finished running the affairs and will not add anything to what He has destined.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThis is what the Jews say. The Sublime God said, â€˜â€¦Call on Me; I will answer your (Prayer)â€¦â€™ Soleiman said, â€œBy this He means that He is able to do that.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œDoes He then make a promise which He will not fulfill?â€ Then how come He said, â€˜â€¦He adds to Creation as He pleasesâ€¦â€™ And the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜Allah doth blot out or confirm what He pleaseth: with Him is the Mother of the Book.â€™ Has He finished running the affairs?â€ Soleiman could not answer.Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Does He know that a human being would be created while He did not will to create a human being by no means? That a human being will die today while He has not willed to make him die today?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€Al-Ridha (s) asked, â€œDoes He know that what He wills exists or does He know about what He has not willed does not exist?â€ Soleiman said, â€œHe knows that both of them exist.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œTherefore, He knows that man is simultaneously alive and dead, is standing and sitting, is blind and seeing at the same time. This is impossible.â€ Soleiman said, â€œMay I be your ransom! He knows that one of them will exist.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œDo not worry. Which one will exist? The one which He willed, or the one which He did not will?â€ Soleiman said, â€œWhat He has willed to be!â€Al-Ridha (s), Al-Maâ€™mun and the scholars started to laugh.Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYou have erred and departed from your initial statements, â€œHe knows that some people will die today while He has not willed to make them die today, that He creates creatures while He does not will to create them.â€ If your hold that knowledge does not apply to what He has not willed, then He alone knows what He has willed.Soleiman said, â€œMy statement is that Will is neither He nor something other than Him!â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Ignorant one! If you say that will is not He, then you have regarded it as (something) other than him. If you say that willis not (something) other than Him, then you have regarded it as Him.â€ Soleiman asked, â€œDoes God know how He creates things?â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYes.â€ Soleiman said, â€œSurely, this establishes something.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYou have said something impossible. That is because man may know how to build a wall, even though he does not build one; may know how to sew, even though he does not sew anything; or may know how to make something well, even though he does not make it.â€Then Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Does God know that He is One without anything with Him?â€ Soleiman replied, â€œYes.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDoes this establish that there is something along with Him?â€ Soleiman said, â€œHe does not know that He is One without anything with Him.â€Al-Ridha (s) asked, â€œDo you know that?â€Soleiman replied, â€œYes.â€â€œO Soleiman! Therefore you are more knowledgeable than Him!â€ Soleiman said, â€œThis is impossible.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œIs it impossible in your view that He is One without anything with Him, that He is All-Hearing, All-Seeing, All-Wise, and All-Powerful?â€ He replied, â€œYes.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen how did the Honorable the Exalted God say that He was One, All-Living, All-Hearing, All-Seeing, All-Wise, All-Powerful, All-Knowing, All-Aware, while He did not know that? This refutes what you say. God is High Exalted above that.â€Then Al-Ridha (s) asked him, â€œHow does He will to create that which He does not know how to create and what it is? If a creator does not know how to create something before he creates it, then he is perplexed. The Sublime God is Exalted High above that!â€Soleiman said, â€œWill is the same as Power.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œHe - the Honorable the Exalted always has power over what He wills. There is no escape from that, for He - the Blessed the Sublime said, â€˜If it were Our Will, We could take away that which We have sent thee by inspirationâ€¦â€™ If will is the same as power, God had Willed to take it away because of His Power.â€ Then Soleiman remained silent.At this time Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Soleiman! This is the most learned of the Hashemites!â€ Then the people dispersed.The author of this book (Sheikh Sadooq) - may God be pleased with him - said, â€œAl-Maâ€™mun was jealous of (the scholarly position of) Al-Ridha (s). Therefore, he invited the scholars of the various sects and religions who had deviated from the straight path and anyone he knew or had heard of around the globe to have debates with Al-Ridha (s) and defeat the Imam (s) in his (s) proofs, so that Al-Maâ€™munâ€™s feelings of jealousy be somewhat relieved and the Imamâ€™s (s) scientific position be discredited. However, whoever held a debate with the Imam (s) acknowledged his (s) nobility and was convinced by the proofs presented by the Imam (s). This was because God - High be His Remembrance - did not like anyone to defeat Al-Ridha (s). God perfects His Light and assists His Proof. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙÙ„ÙŠØ³ ÙŠØ­ÙŠØ· Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ÙƒÙ… Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ¹Ø±Ù ØºØ§ÙŠØ© Ø°Ù„ÙƒØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ø°Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ­Ø· Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡Ù…Ø§ Ù‚Ø¨Ù„ Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ†ØŒ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø¹Ù„ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ¨ÙŠØ±Ø§. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†: Ø¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ Ù‚Ù„Øª Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ØºØ§ÙŠØ© Ù„Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ù„Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙˆØµÙÙ‡Ù…Ø§ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„ÙˆØ¯ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ±Ù‡Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ù† Ù†Ø¬Ø¹Ù„ Ù„Ù‡Ù…Ø§ Ø§Ù†Ù‚Ø·Ø§Ø¹Ø§. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¶Ø§ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ Ø¨Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø¨Ù…ÙˆØ¬Ø¨ Ù„Ø§Ù†Ù‚Ø·Ø§Ø¹Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡Ù…ØŒ Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù‚Ø¯ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ²ÙŠØ¯Ù‡Ù…ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ‚Ø·Ø¹Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙÙŠ ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨Ù‡: { ÙƒÙÙ„ÙÙ‘Ù…ÙØ§ Ù†ÙØ¶ÙØ¬ÙØªÙ’ Ø¬ÙÙ„ÙÙˆØ¯ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ø¨ÙØ¯ÙÙ‘Ù„Ù’Ù†ÙØ§Ù‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ø¬ÙÙ„ÙÙˆØ¯Ù‹Ø§ ØºÙÙŠÙ’Ø±ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ù„ÙÙŠÙØ°ÙÙˆÙ‚ÙÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ°ÙØ§Ø¨Ù} [Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø³Ø§Ø¡: 56] ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ù„Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø©: {Ø¹ÙØ·ÙØ§Ø¡Ù‹ ØºÙÙŠÙ’Ø±Ù Ù…ÙØ¬Ù’Ø°ÙÙˆØ°Ù} [Ù‡ÙˆØ¯: 108] ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: {ÙˆÙÙÙØ§ÙƒÙÙ‡ÙØ©Ù ÙƒÙØ«ÙÙŠØ±ÙØ©Ù * Ù„ÙØ§ Ù…ÙÙ‚Ù’Ø·ÙÙˆØ¹ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙÙ„ÙØ§ Ù…ÙÙ…Ù’Ù†ÙÙˆØ¹ÙØ©Ù} [Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ§Ù‚Ø¹Ø©: 32ØŒ 33] ÙÙ‡Ùˆ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠÙ‚Ø·Ø¹ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø²ÙŠØ§Ø¯Ø©ØŒ Ø£Ø±Ø£ÙŠØª Ù…Ø§ Ø£ÙƒÙ„ Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø© ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø´Ø±Ø¨ÙˆØ§ Ø£Ù„ÙŠØ³ ÙŠØ®Ù„Ù Ù…ÙƒØ§Ù†Ù‡ØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø¨Ù„Ù‰. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø£ÙÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙŠÙ‚Ø·Ø¹ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ø£Ø®Ù„Ù Ù…ÙƒØ§Ù†Ù‡ØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†: Ù„Ø§. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ ÙƒÙ„Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ Ø£Ø®Ù„Ù Ù…ÙƒØ§Ù†Ù‡ ÙÙ„ÙŠØ³ Ø¨Ù…Ù‚Ø·ÙˆØ¹ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡Ù…. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†: Ø¨Ù„Ù‰. ÙŠÙ‚Ø·Ø¹Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ²ÙŠØ¯Ù‡Ù…. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¶Ø§ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: Ø¥Ø°Ø§ ÙŠØ¨ÙŠØ¯ Ù…Ø§ ÙÙŠÙ‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙ‡Ø°Ø§ ÙŠØ§ Ø³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù† Ø¥Ø¨Ø·Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„ÙˆØ¯ØŒ ÙˆØ®Ù„Ø§Ù Ø§Ù„ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ØŒ Ù„Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: {Ù„ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ù…ÙØ§ ÙŠÙØ´ÙØ§Ø¡ÙÙˆÙ†Ù ÙÙÙŠÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙÙ„ÙØ¯ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†ÙØ§ Ù…ÙØ²ÙÙŠØ¯ÙŒ } [Ù‚: 35] ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: {Ø¹ÙØ·ÙØ§Ø¡Ù‹ ØºÙÙŠÙ’Ø±Ù Ù…ÙØ¬Ù’Ø°ÙÙˆØ°Ù} [Ù‡ÙˆØ¯: 108] ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: {ÙˆÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ù‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡ÙØ§ Ø¨ÙÙ…ÙØ®Ù’Ø±ÙØ¬ÙÙŠÙ†Ù} [Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø¬Ø±: 48] ÙˆØ¨Ù‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: { Ø®ÙØ§Ù„ÙØ¯ÙÙŠÙ†Ù ÙÙÙŠÙ‡ÙØ§} [Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ù‚Ø±Ø©: 162] ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: {ÙˆÙÙÙØ§ÙƒÙÙ‡ÙØ©Ù ÙƒÙØ«ÙÙŠØ±ÙØ©Ù * Ù„ÙØ§ Ù…ÙÙ‚Ù’Ø·ÙÙˆØ¹ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙÙ„ÙØ§ Ù…ÙÙ…Ù’Ù†ÙÙˆØ¹ÙØ©Ù } [Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ§Ù‚Ø¹Ø©: 32ØŒ 33] ÙÙ„Ù… ÙŠØ­Ø± Ø¬ÙˆØ§Ø¨Ø§. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙŠØ§ Ø³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù† Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ø¹Ø¨ØªÙ…ÙˆÙ‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø¶Ø±Ø§Ø± ÙˆØ£ØµØ­Ø§Ø¨Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡Ù…: (Ø£Ù† ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ø§ Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙÙŠ Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ Ø£Ùˆ Ø£Ø±Ø¶ Ø£Ùˆ Ø¨Ø­Ø± Ø£Ùˆ Ø¨Ø± Ù…Ù†: ÙƒÙ„Ø¨ Ø£Ùˆ Ø®Ù†Ø²ÙŠØ± Ø£Ùˆ Ù‚Ø±Ø¯ Ø£Ùˆ Ø¥Ù†Ø³Ø§Ù† Ø£Ùˆ Ø¯Ø§Ø¨Ø© Ø¥Ø±Ø§Ø¯Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù† Ø¥Ø±Ø§Ø¯Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ­ÙŠÙ‰ ÙˆØªÙ…ÙˆØªØŒ ÙˆØªØ°Ù‡Ø¨ØŒ ÙˆØªØ£ÙƒÙ„ ÙˆØªØ´Ø±Ø¨ØŒ ÙˆØªÙ†ÙƒØ­ØŒ ÙˆØªÙ„Ø¯ ÙˆØªØ¸Ù„Ù…ØŒ ÙˆØªÙØ¹Ù„ Ø§Ù„ÙÙˆØ§Ø­Ø´ØŒ ÙˆØªÙƒÙØ±ØŒ ÙˆØªØ´Ø±ÙƒØŒ ÙØªØ¨Ø±Ø£ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ø§ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ø¯ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ ÙˆÙ‡Ø°Ø§ Ø­Ø¯Ù‡Ø§. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†: Ø¥Ù†Ù‡Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø¹ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¨ØµØ± ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù… . Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¶Ø§ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: Ù‚Ø¯ Ø±Ø¬Ø¹Øª Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø«Ø§Ù†ÙŠØ©!
