Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¶Ø§ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø³ÙˆØ§Ø¡ Ù„Ø£Ù† Ù†ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¹Ù„ÙˆÙ… Ù„ÙŠØ³ ÙŠÙ†ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ†ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø±Ø§Ø¯ Ù†ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ø±Ø§Ø¯Ø© Ø£Ù† ØªÙƒÙˆÙ†ØŒ Ù„Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø´Ø¦ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ±Ø¯ Ù„Ù… ØªÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ø±Ø§Ø¯Ø©ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø«Ø§Ø¨ØªØ§ ÙˆØ¥Ù† Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙƒÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¹Ù„ÙˆÙ…ØŒ Ø¨Ù…Ù†Ø²Ù„Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¨ØµØ± ÙÙ‚Ø¯ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ù†Ø³Ø§Ù† Ø¨ØµÙŠØ±Ø§ ÙˆØ¥Ù† Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙƒÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¨ØµØ±ØŒ ÙˆÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø«Ø§Ø¨ØªØ§ ÙˆØ¥Ù† Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙƒÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¹Ù„ÙˆÙ…. ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ²Ø§Ù„ Ø³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù† ÙŠØ±Ø¯Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³Ø£Ù„Ø© ÙˆÙŠÙ†Ù‚Ø·Ø¹ ÙÙŠÙ‡Ø§ ÙˆÙŠØ³ØªØ£Ù†ÙØŒ ÙˆÙŠÙ†ÙƒØ± Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø£Ù‚Ø± Ø¨Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙŠÙ‚Ø± Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ù†ÙƒØ±ØŒ ÙˆÙŠÙ†ØªÙ‚Ù„ Ù…Ù† Ø´Ø¦ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø´Ø¦ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø±Ø¶Ø§ ØµÙ„ÙˆØ§Øª Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙŠÙ†Ù‚Ø¶ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø°Ù„ÙƒØŒ Ø­ØªÙ‰ Ø·Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø¨ÙŠÙ†Ù‡Ù…Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ¸Ù‡Ø± Ù„ÙƒÙ„ Ø£Ø­Ø¯ Ø§Ù†Ù‚Ø·Ø§Ø¹Ù‡ Ù…Ø±Ø§Øª ÙƒØ«ÙŠØ±Ø©ØŒ ØªØ±ÙƒÙ†Ø§ Ø¥ÙŠØ±Ø§Ø¯ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù…Ø®Ø§ÙØ© Ø§Ù„ØªØ·ÙˆÙŠÙ„ØŒ ÙØ¢Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù…Ø± Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù† Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†: Ø¥Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ø±Ø§Ø¯Ø© Ù‡ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯Ø±Ø©. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¶Ø§ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙŠÙ‚Ø¯Ø± Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ±ÙŠØ¯ Ø£Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨Ø¯ÙŠÙ† Ù…Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ : {ÙˆÙÙ„ÙØ¦ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø´ÙØ¦Ù’Ù†ÙØ§ Ù„ÙÙ†ÙØ°Ù’Ù‡ÙØ¨ÙÙ†ÙÙ‘ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙ‘Ø°ÙÙŠ Ø£ÙÙˆÙ’Ø­ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†ÙØ§ Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’ÙƒÙ} [Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ø³Ø±Ø§Ø¡: 86] ÙÙ„Ùˆ ÙƒØ§Ù†Øª Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ø±Ø§Ø¯Ø© Ù‡ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯Ø±Ø© ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù‚Ø¯ Ø£Ø±Ø§Ø¯ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ°Ù‡Ø¨ Ø¨Ù‡ Ù„Ù‚Ø¯Ø±ØªÙ‡. ÙØ§Ù†Ù‚Ø·Ø¹ Ø³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù† ÙˆØªØ±Ùƒ Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù†Ù‚Ø·Ø§Ø¹ØŒ Ø«Ù… ØªÙØ±Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙˆÙ….", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/11/2/13/1", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 13, "thaqalaynSanad": "13-1 Abu Jaâ€™far Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Ahmad, the jurist, narrated that Abu Muhammad Al-Hassan ibn Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Sadaqat al-Qumi quoted on the authority of Abu Amr Muhammad ibn Abdul Aziz Al-Ansari al-Kajji, on the authority of Al-Hassan ibn Muhammad al-Nawfali, that", "thaqalaynMatn": " Soleiman al-Marwazi, the most prominent religious scholar in Khorasan, went to see Al-Maâ€™mun. Al-Maâ€™mun honored him, granted him gifts and said, â€œMy cousin Ali ibn Musa Al-Ridha (s) has come here from Hijaz. He likes theology and theologians. Thus it would not be any trouble if you came to hold adebate with him on the 8th of Dhul-Hajja (the Day of Tarwiyah) to have a debate with him.â€Soleiman said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! I dislike questioning him in your session and amongst a group of the Hashemites. The people will regard him as incapable when he debates with me on theology. Incapabilities are not permissible for him.â€Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œI have invited you because I know that you are learned (in theology). I have no intentions except for you to silence him in an argument.â€ Soleiman said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! I will do it for you. Just bring us together. Just sit back and watch.â€Then Al-Maâ€™mun sent someone after Al-Ridha (s) and said, â€œA man from Marwaz who is not equal to you in theology has come and asked for you to come to us. Come here if you do not mind.â€ The Imam (s) made ablutions and told us to go ahead. Imran As-Saâ€™ebee was with us. We went until we arrived at Al-Maâ€™munâ€™s court. Yasir and Khalid took my hands and led me in. When I got in and greeted (Al-Maâ€™mun), he asked, â€œWhere is my brother Abul Hassan whom may the Sublime God maintain?â€ I said, â€œWhen we were coming he was putting on his clothes. He ordered us to go ahead.â€ Then I added, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! Your servant Imran is also with me. He is right outside.â€ He said, â€œWho is Imran?â€ I said, â€œHe is the Sabian who became a Muslim because of you.â€ He said, â€œLet him in.â€ Then Imran came in. Al-Maâ€™mun welcomed him and then told him, â€œO Imran! You did not die and join the Hashemites!â€ Imran said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! Praise be to God who honored me by you.â€ Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Imran! This is Soleiman al-Marwazi who is the theologian from Khorasan.â€ Imran said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! He thinks that he is the only one in Khorasan versed in theoretical principles and refutes origination (bidaâ€™). Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œWhy donâ€™t you have a debate with him?â€ Imran said, â€œThis depends on him.â€ Then Al-Ridha (s) came in and asked, â€œWhat were you discussing?â€ Imran said, â€œO son of the Prophet of God! This is Soleiman al-Marwazi.â€Soleiman told Imran, â€œWill you be pleased with Abil Hassan (s) and what he says about origination. Imran said, â€œYes, I will if he (s) presents arguments which I can present when I argue with other theologians like myself.â€Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Abul Hassan! What is your opinion regarding what they argue about?â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! How could you not believe in origination while the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of nothing?â€™ And the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜It is He Who begins (the process of) Creation; then repeats itâ€¦â€™ And says, â€˜To Him is due the primal origin of the heavens and the earthâ€¦â€™ Moreover, the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜He adds to Creation as He pleasesâ€¦â€™ and says, â€˜â€¦He began the Creation of man with (nothing more than) clay.â€™ Also the Honorable the Exalted God says, â€˜There are (yet) others, held in suspense for the command of God, whether He will punish them, or turn in mercy to themâ€¦â€™ And the Honorable the Exalted God says, â€˜â€¦Nor is a man long-lived granted length of days, nor is a part cut off from his life, but is in a Decree (ordained)â€¦â€™ Soleiman asked, â€œHas anything been narrated to you on this issue from your forefather?â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œYes. It has been narrated by my father on the authority of Abi Abdullah (s) who said, â€œThe Honorable the Exalted God has two bodies of knowledge: a Treasured Knowledge, Hidden Knowledge which no one but Him is informed of. Origination is rooted in that knowledge. And He has a second knowledge which He has taught the angels and His Messengers which the knowledgeable Members of the Holy Household are also aware of.â€Soleiman said, â€œI would like you to present this from the Book of the Honorable the Exalted God.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThe Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜So turn away from them: not thine is the blame.â€™ At first God wanted to destroy them. But then the Sublime God changed His mind and said, â€˜But teach (thy Message) for teaching benefits the Believers.â€™ Soleiman said, â€œMay I be your ransom! Tell me more.â€ Then Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œMy father (s) informed me on the authority of his forefathers (s), on the authority of Godâ€™s Prophet (s) that the Honorable the Exalted God revealed to one of His Prophets to let one of the Kings know that God will take away his life at such and such a time. The Prophet (s) went to see the King and told him that. Then the King pleaded to God while he was on his bed and fell off of it. He said, â€œO Lord! Postpone my demise until I see my son grow up to undertake my affairs.â€ Then the Honorablethe Exalted God revealed to that Prophet (s), â€œGo to that King and inform him that I have decided to postpone his death. I have added fifteen years to his life.â€The Prophet (s) said, â€œO Lord! You well know that I have never lied.â€ Then the Honorable the Exalted God revealed to him, â€œYou are just an agent. Announce this to him. God is never questioned about what He does.â€ Then the Imam (s) turned towards Soleiman and said, â€œI think you have the same opinion as the Jews in this regard.â€ Soleiman said, â€œFrom this I seek refuge in God.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThe Jews say, â€˜Godâ€™s hand is tied up...â€™ They mean that God is finished working and is sitting back and does not Create anything else. But the Honorable the Exalted God has given them the following answer, â€˜â€¦Be their hands tied up and be they accursed for the (blasphemy) they utterâ€¦.â€™ I have also heard my father Musa ibn Jaâ€™far (s) say the following when asked about Origination, â€˜How could the people refute origination, and that God might procrastinate the affairs of some people for a decision regarding them?â€™â€Soleiman asked, â€œCan you tell me for what has the following verse been revealed? â€˜We have indeed revealed this (Message) in the Night of Power.â€™ The Imam (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! The Honorable the Exalted God will decide the destiny (of an individual) for one year including life or death, good or bad, and sustenance on the Night of Power. Whatever God destines on that night comes to be.â€ Soleiman said, â€œNow I understand. Please tell me more.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Some of the affairs are up to the Honorable the Exalted God and what He wills. He can expedite what He wills and procrastinate what He wills. He can destroy what He wills. O Soleiman, Ali (s) said, â€œKnowledge is of two types: Knowledge which God has taught His angels and His Messengers - that which God has taught His angels and His Messengers will be done, and that which is hidden near Him and He has informed none of His creatures of it. It is by this knowledge which He expedites what He wills to expedite, procrastinates what He wills to procrastinate; destroys what He wills to destroy, and He stabilizes what He wills to stabilize.â€Soleiman told Al-Maâ€™mun, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! From today on I will not refute Creation or deny it by Godâ€™s Will.â€ Al-Maâ€™mun said,â€œO Soleiman! Ask Abul Hassan whatever you wish. Just listen carefully and be fair.â€ Soleiman said, â€œO my Master! May I ask?â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œAsk whatever you wish.â€Soleiman said, â€œWhat is your view about someone who considers will to be a name - an attribute similar to â€˜ livingâ€™, â€˜hearingâ€™, â€˜seeingâ€™, and â€˜powerfulâ€™?â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYou say that things were originated and became different because He so desired and willed. But you do not say that things were originated and became different because He is All-Hearing and All-Seeing. This is a proof that they (i.e. will and desire) are not similar to All-Hearing, All-Seeing, and All-Powerful.â€Soleiman said, â€œHe has always been willing.â€ The Imam answered him, â€œO Soleiman! Is His will something other than Him?â€He replied, â€œYes.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen you have proved that there has always been something along with Him forever.â€ Soleiman said, â€œNo, I have not.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œIs will originated?â€ Soleiman said, â€œNo. It is not.â€ Then Al-Maâ€™mun shouted at him and said, â€œO Soleiman! Are you showing obstinacy and giving vague answers to such a person as him. You must be fair. Donâ€™t you see that people of intellect are sitting around you?â€ Then Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Abul Hassan! Continue your debate on theology with him since he is the theologian of Khorasan.â€Then the Imam asked him, â€œO Soleiman! Is it (the will) originated? Whatever is not Eternal is certainly originated. And if it is not originated it is Eternal.â€Soleiman said, â€œHis (Allahâ€™s) will is (part) of Him just as His Hearing, His Sight and His Knowledge are (parts) of Him.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDid He will Himself?â€ Soleiman answered, â€œNo.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œTherefore, willing is not like the hearing and the seeing.â€ Soleiman said, â€œSurely, He willed Himself just as He heard Himself, saw Himself, and recognized Himself.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œWhat is the meaning of â€˜He willed Himselfâ€™? Did He will to be a thing? Did He will to be All-Living, All-Hearing, All-Seeing or All-Powerful?â€Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDid that occur through His will?â€ Soleiman answered, â€˜Yes.â€™ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThen your statement, â€˜Hewilled to be All-Living, All-Hearing, and All-Seeing,â€™ does not make any sense since they were not done through His Will.â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes. That was through His Will.â€Then Al-Maâ€™mun and the people around him burst into laughter. Al-Ridha (s) laughed too and said, â€œDo not be too hard on the theologian from Khorasan. O Soleiman! â€œDo you think that He (i.e. Allah, the Exalted) has altered from state to state and changed due to it? This is something by which the Honorable the Exalted God cannot be described.â€ Soleiman remained silent.Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! May I ask you a question?â€Soleiman said, â€œMay I be your ransom! Ask.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œTell me about you and your companions: Do you debate with the people on theology according to what you understand and know or according to what you do not understand and do not know?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes! (We debate) according to what we understand and know.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThe thing which the people know is that the willing is different from the will. The willing exists before the will. The subject is before the object. This (statement) disproves your statement, â€˜The willing and the willed are the same thing.â€™â€ Soleiman said, â€œMay I be your ransom! This is not what the people know about and understand.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œI think that you have claimed to have the knowledge without having a true recognition of it and said, â€™Willing is like hearing and seeingâ€™ while this view is not based on knowledge or the intellect.â€ Soleiman could not answer.Then Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Does God have knowledge of all those who are in Paradise and the Fire?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œWill what the Sublime God knows would be created in the future, actually be created?â€ Soleiman answered, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œIf it is done to the extent that nothing else remains, can God add more to them or will He stop doing so?â€Soleiman said, â€œHe will add to them.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen based on what you have said, God adds to them what He did not know would be created.â€ Then he added, â€œMay I be your ransom! There is no limit foradding.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen in your opinion His Knowledge does not encompass what is therein (in Paradise), since He does not know the limit of that which will be in Paradise. If His Knowledge does not encompass what is therein, then He would not know what will be there before they existed. The Honorable the Exalted God is Exalted High above that!â€Soleiman said, â€œWhen I said God does not know about them it was because they have no limit and the Honorable the Exalted God Himself has described them as eternal. Therefore we do not want to assume an end for them.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œGodâ€™s Knowledge of them will not limit them. There are many instances of which He has knowledge, then He adds to them and does not take away what He has added to them. These are supported by the Words of the Honorable the Exalted God in His Book, â€˜â€¦as often as their skins are roasted through, We shall change them for fresh skins, that they may taste the penaltyâ€¦â€™ And He told the residents of Paradise, â€˜â€¦a gift without break.â€™ And the Honorable the Exalted said, â€˜Whose season is not limited, nor (supply) forbidden?â€™ Therefore the Honorable the Exalted God knows about these and does not block them from accessing to what is added. Will He not replace what the residents of Paradise eat and drink?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œHas He stopped His Granting now that He has replaced the consumed foods and drinks?â€ Soleiman said, â€œNo.â€Then Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Tell me about Will: Is it an action or not?â€Soleiman said, â€œIt is an action.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œTherefore it is originated, for all actions are originated.â€ Soleiman said, â€œIt is not an action.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œHas there then been something else with Him who is eternal?â€ Soleiman said, â€œThe Will is the same as bringing forth.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! This is exactly what you criticized Dirar and his companions of, saying that everything that the Honorable the Exalted God has created in the heavens, the Earth, the oceans or on land such as dogs, pigs, monkeys, humans or animals are Godâ€™s Will, and that Godâ€™s Will lives, dies, goes away, eats, drinks, marries, feels pleasure, oppresses, commits immoral acts, disbelieves, becomes a polytheist. We denounce this and oppose it. This is its limit.â€Soleiman said, â€œIt (i.e. will) is like hearing, seeing and knowledge.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYou just returned to what you said before. Tell me: Are hearing, seeing and knowledge made?â€Soleiman said, â€œNo.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œHow do you then refute Will? You sometimes say that He did not will and sometimes you say that He willed, and that it (i.e. will) was not one of His actions.â€Soleiman said, â€œSurely, that is like saying, He sometimes knows and sometimes does not know!â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThat is not the same, for negating the known is not like negating knowledge; negating what is willed is (not like) negating the will, for if the thing is not willed, there will be no will. However, sometimes there is knowledge, but there may be no known thing. This is like seeing. Man may be able to see, but there may be nothing there for him to see. Likewise, there may be knowledge, but there is no known thing.â€ Soleiman said, â€œIt (i.e. will) is made.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œTherefore, it (will) is originated and is not like hearing and seeing, for hearing and seeing are not made, and it (will) is made.â€Soleiman said, â€œIt (will) is one of His eternal attributes.â€ The Imam (s) answered, â€œTherefore, man must be eternal, for his quality is eternal.â€Soleiman said, â€œNo, because He did not do it (will)â€. Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Khorasani! How often you make mistakes! Are things not made according to His Will and Words?â€ Soleiman said, â€œNo.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œIf things are not made according to His Will or Volition, His Command or His Practice, then how are they made? God is High Exalted above that!â€ Soleiman could not respond.Then Al-Ridha (s) asked, â€œWill you not tell me about these Words of the Honorable the Exalted God: â€˜When We decide to destroy a population, We (first) send a definite order to those among them who are given the good things of this life and yet transgressâ€¦â€™By â€˜We decideâ€™ does God mean that He creates His own Will?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) answered him, â€œIf He creates His own Will, then your statement that â€˜Will is He Himself or is a part of himâ€™ is futile, for it is not (possible) for Him to create Himself and God does not change His State. God is High Exalted above that.â€Soleiman told him, â€œYes.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen if He originates the Will, what you said, â€œWill is the same as God Himself or a part thereofâ€ is wrong since God does not originate Himself or change from His current state. God is High Exalted above that.â€Soleiman asked, â€œBy that He does not mean that He creates His own will?â€The Imam (s) asked, â€œSo what does He mean?â€Soleiman said, â€œHe means doing something.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œWoe unto you! How many times have you repeated this issue? I told you that will is originated, since the action and the Creation of a thing is originated.â€Soleiman said, â€œThen this has no meaning.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDo you then think that He describes Himself with will which has no meaning? If will has no eternal or originated meaning, then that will nullify your statement, â€œThe Honorable the Exalted God has always been willing.â€ Soleiman said, â€œI mean to say that willing has been one of the eternal actions of the Sublime God.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œDonâ€™t you know that what is eternal cannot be made, originated and eternal at the same time?â€Soleiman could not answer. Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œNever mind! Complete your questions.â€ Soleiman said, â€œDid you say that Will is one of His Attributes?â€The Imam (s) said, â€œWhy do you repeat this so many times? Are His Attributes originated or eternal?â€ Soleiman said, â€œOriginated.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œGod is the Greatest! You are telling me that the Will is originated, even though it is one of His Eternal Attributes. Therefore God has not willed anything!â€ The Imam (s) added, â€œWhatever is eternal is not created.â€Soleiman said, â€œThings are not the same as the will, and He did not will anything.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! You are whispering. Has God created what He has not willed to create? This is an attribute of someone who does not know what he is doing. God is High Exalted above that!â€Soleiman said, â€œO my Master! I have already informed you that it is like hearing, seeing and knowing.â€Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Soleiman! Woe unto you! How often have you erred and how often have you have repeated yourself? Stop it and take up another issue since you seem to be unable to provide any better answer than that.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Commander of the Faithful! Leave him alone! Do not interrupt his questions, since then he will regard it as an argument (against me). O Soleiman! Speak.â€Soleiman said, â€œI have already informed you that it is like hearing, seeing and knowing.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œNever mind! Tell me whether will has one meaning or several meanings.â€ Soleiman said, â€œOne meaning.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œIs the meaning of all the wills then the same?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œIf its meanings are the same, then it must be that the will to stand up is the same as the will to sit down, or the will to live isthe same as the will to die. If His Will is all one thing, then none of Godâ€™s desires will take precedence over any others. None will be any different from any others. They will all be one thing.â€Soleiman replied, â€œSurely, the meanings are different.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œThen, tell me about the willed. Is it the same as the will or is it something else?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes. It is the same as the will.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThen according to you the willed is something else since it is the same as the will.â€ Soleiman said, â€œO my Master! Will is not the same as the willed.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThen will is originated. Otherwise it must be that something else existed along with God. Understand this well. Continue on with your questions.â€Soleiman said, â€œIt is one of His Names.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDid He name Himself that?â€Soleimam replied, â€œNo. He did not name Himself that.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œTherefore, you have no right to name Him with what He did not name Himself.â€ Soleiman said, â€œBut He described Himself to be willed.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThe fact that He has described Himself as willed does not mean that He wanted to inform us that He is the Will, or that Will is one of His Names.â€ Soleiman said, â€œThat is because His Will is the same as His Knowledge.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Ignorant one! If He knows something, does that not mean that He has willed it.â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€ The Imam (s) asked, â€œBut if He does not will something, does that mean that He does not know it?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œWhat is your source for that statement? What is the evidence that His Will is the same as His Knowledge? He may know something but never Will it. This is supported by what the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜If it were Our Will, We could take away that which We have sent thee by inspirationâ€¦â€™ And God knows how to take it away, but He never will.â€ Soleiman said, â€œThat is because He has finished running the affairs and will not add anything to what He has destined.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œThis is what the Jews say. The Sublime God said, â€˜â€¦Call on Me; I will answer your (Prayer)â€¦â€™ Soleiman said, â€œBy this He means that He is able to do that.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œDoes He then make a promise which He will not fulfill?â€ Then how come He said, â€˜â€¦He adds to Creation as He pleasesâ€¦â€™ And the Honorable the Exalted God said, â€˜Allah doth blot out or confirm what He pleaseth: with Him is the Mother of the Book.â€™ Has He finished running the affairs?â€ Soleiman could not answer.Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Does He know that a human being would be created while He did not will to create a human being by no means? That a human being will die today while He has not willed to make him die today?â€ Soleiman said, â€œYes.â€Al-Ridha (s) asked, â€œDoes He know that what He wills exists or does He know about what He has not willed does not exist?â€ Soleiman said, â€œHe knows that both of them exist.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œTherefore, He knows that man is simultaneously alive and dead, is standing and sitting, is blind and seeing at the same time. This is impossible.â€ Soleiman said, â€œMay I be your ransom! He knows that one of them will exist.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œDo not worry. Which one will exist? The one which He willed, or the one which He did not will?â€ Soleiman said, â€œWhat He has willed to be!â€Al-Ridha (s), Al-Maâ€™mun and the scholars started to laugh.Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYou have erred and departed from your initial statements, â€œHe knows that some people will die today while He has not willed to make them die today, that He creates creatures while He does not will to create them.â€ If your hold that knowledge does not apply to what He has not willed, then He alone knows what He has willed.Soleiman said, â€œMy statement is that Will is neither He nor something other than Him!â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Ignorant one! If you say that will is not He, then you have regarded it as (something) other than him. If you say that willis not (something) other than Him, then you have regarded it as Him.â€ Soleiman asked, â€œDoes God know how He creates things?â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYes.â€ Soleiman said, â€œSurely, this establishes something.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œYou have said something impossible. That is because man may know how to build a wall, even though he does not build one; may know how to sew, even though he does not sew anything; or may know how to make something well, even though he does not make it.â€Then Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œO Soleiman! Does God know that He is One without anything with Him?â€ Soleiman replied, â€œYes.â€Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œDoes this establish that there is something along with Him?â€ Soleiman said, â€œHe does not know that He is One without anything with Him.â€Al-Ridha (s) asked, â€œDo you know that?â€Soleiman replied, â€œYes.â€â€œO Soleiman! Therefore you are more knowledgeable than Him!â€ Soleiman said, â€œThis is impossible.â€The Imam (s) said, â€œIs it impossible in your view that He is One without anything with Him, that He is All-Hearing, All-Seeing, All-Wise, and All-Powerful?â€ He replied, â€œYes.â€ The Imam (s) said, â€œThen how did the Honorable the Exalted God say that He was One, All-Living, All-Hearing, All-Seeing, All-Wise, All-Powerful, All-Knowing, All-Aware, while He did not know that? This refutes what you say. God is High Exalted above that.â€Then Al-Ridha (s) asked him, â€œHow does He will to create that which He does not know how to create and what it is? If a creator does not know how to create something before he creates it, then he is perplexed. The Sublime God is Exalted High above that!â€Soleiman said, â€œWill is the same as Power.â€ Al-Ridha (s) said, â€œHe - the Honorable the Exalted always has power over what He wills. There is no escape from that, for He - the Blessed the Sublime said, â€˜If it were Our Will, We could take away that which We have sent thee by inspirationâ€¦â€™ If will is the same as power, God had Willed to take it away because of His Power.â€ Then Soleiman remained silent.At this time Al-Maâ€™mun said, â€œO Soleiman! This is the most learned of the Hashemites!â€ Then the people dispersed.The author of this book (Sheikh Sadooq) - may God be pleased with him - said, â€œAl-Maâ€™mun was jealous of (the scholarly position of) Al-Ridha (s). Therefore, he invited the scholars of the various sects and religions who had deviated from the straight path and anyone he knew or had heard of around the globe to have debates with Al-Ridha (s) and defeat the Imam (s) in his (s) proofs, so that Al-Maâ€™munâ€™s feelings of jealousy be somewhat relieved and the Imamâ€™s (s) scientific position be discredited. However, whoever held a debate with the Imam (s) acknowledged his (s) nobility and was convinced by the proofs presented by the Imam (s). This was because God - High be His Remembrance - did not like anyone to defeat Al-Ridha (s). God perfects His Light and assists His Proof. This is what the Blessed the Sublime God has promised in His Book, â€˜We will, without doubt, help our apostles and those who believe, (both) in this worldâ€™s lifeâ€¦â€™ By â€˜those who believeâ€™, God means the Immaculate Imams, their knowledgeable followers and those who have adopted the Imamsâ€™ proof against their enemies for as long as they are in this world. God will treat them likewise in the Hereafter. The Honorable the Exalted God will never act against His Promise.", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 359, "bookId": "Al-Amali-Mufid", "book": "Al-AmÄlÄ«", "category": "Thirty Eighth Assembly", "categoryId": "38", "chapter": "Benefit of meeting others", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. Muá¸¥ammad al-MufÄ«d", "translator": "Mulla Asgharali M M Jaffer", "englishText": "13. He said: Al-Shareef al-Swaleh Abu Muhammad al-Hasan ibn Hamza, may Allah bless him with mercy, reported to me from Abul Hasan â€˜Ali ibn al-Fadhl, who reported from Abu Turab Ubaidullah ibn Musa, who reported from Abul Qasim Abdul Azim ibn Abdullah al-Hasani, may Allah bless him with mercy, who said: I heard Abu Jaâ€™far Muhammad ibn â€˜Ali ibn Musa, peace be upon them, say: \"Meeting with the brothers widens your intellect and fertilizes your wisdom, even if your meeting with them may be very few.\" And may Allah bless upon our master Muhammad, the Prophet and his pure progeny.", "arabicText": "13 - Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ø±ÙŠÙ Ø§Ù„ØµØ§Ù„Ø­ Ø£Ø¨Ùˆ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù† Ø¨Ù† Ø­Ù…Ø²Ø© Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ø¨Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ø§Ù„ÙØ¶Ù„ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ø¨Ùˆ ØªØ±Ø§Ø¨ Ø¹Ø¨ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ù† Ù…ÙˆØ³Ù‰ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ø¨Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø³Ù… Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¸ÙŠÙ… Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù†ÙŠ Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø³Ù…Ø¹Øª Ø£Ø¨Ø§ Ø¬Ø¹ÙØ± Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ù…ÙˆØ³Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: Ù…Ù„Ø§Ù‚Ø§Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ø®ÙˆØ§Ù† Ù†Ø´Ø±Ø© ÙˆØªÙ„Ù‚ÙŠØ­ Ù„Ù„Ø¹Ù‚Ù„ ÙˆØ¥Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù†Ø²Ø±Ø§ Ù‚Ù„ÙŠÙ„Ø§. ÙˆØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø³ÙŠØ¯Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¨ÙŠ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø·Ø§Ù‡Ø±ÙŠÙ† ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù….", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/13/38/13/1", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 13, "thaqalaynSanad": "13. He said: Al-Shareef al-Swaleh Abu Muhammad al-Hasan ibn Hamza, may Allah bless him with mercy, reported to me from Abul Hasan â€˜Ali ibn al-Fadhl, who reported from Abu Turab Ubaidullah ibn Musa, who reported from Abul Qasim Abdul Azim ibn Abdullah al-Hasani, may Allah bless him with mercy, who said: I heard Abu Jaâ€™far Muhammad ibn â€˜Ali ibn Musa, peace be upon them, say: ", "thaqalaynMatn": "\"Meeting with the brothers widens your intellect and fertilizes your wisdom, even if your meeting with them may be very few.\" And may Allah bless upon our master Muhammad, the Prophet and his pure progeny.", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 49, "bookId": "Al-Tawhid-Saduq", "book": "Al-Tawá¸¥Ä«d", "category": "Content", "categoryId": "2", "chapter": "Divine Unity andâ€¬â€¬ Negation of Anthropomorphism", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Sayed Ali Raza Rizvi", "englishText": "13. `Ali Ibn Ahmad Ibn Muhammad ibn `Imran al-Daqqaq (may Allah have mercy on him) said: Muhammad ibn Abu `Abd Allah al-Kufi said: Muhammad ibn Ismai`il al-Barmaki said: `Ali ibn al- `Abbas related to me that Isma`il ibn Mihran al-Kufi related to me on the authority of Isma`il ibn Ishaq al-Juhani, on the authority of Faraj ibn Farwah, on the authority of Mas`adah ibn Sadaqah, on the authority of Abu `Abd Allah that While the Commander of the Faithful (AS) was preaching from his pulpit in (the Mosque of) al-Kufah, a man stood up and said: â€œO Commander of the Faithful! Describe for us your Lord, Blessed and Exalted be He, so that we can increase our love and understanding of Him.â€ Hence, the Commander of the Faithful (AS) became angry, and called all to attend. Thus, the people gathered until the mosque was packed. Then he stood up, with his face flushed, and addressed the congregation as such: All praise be to Allah for Whom refusal to give does not enrich, and for Whom munificence does not make poor! All who give lose, expect He. He is full of beneficial bounties and plentiful gifts. All of creation depends on His Generosity for their sustenance. He has prepared the way for those who seek Him. He is as Generous when He is asked, as He is when He is not asked. Time does not affect Him as this would imply that He is subject to change. His Essence would not be affected, and His Wealth would not be diminished, even if He gave away all of the silver and all of the gold found in the mines in the mountains, and all of the pearls which the shells of the ocean produce for His Servants. His Wealth would remain great and unaffected, even if He answered the demands of every beggar because He is the Most Generous. Giving does not decrease His Wealth, not do the request of His Supplicants make Him miserly. His Command, when He intends anything, is only to say to it: Be, so it is.1 The Angels are incapable of approaching the nobility of His Throne. They are confused when they attempt to understand Him and the greatness of His Might and Majesty. Although they are close to His Realm, they know nothing about His Affair except what He informs them. They are so close to the sanctity of His Realm, that they recognize the limitations with which they were created saying: Glory be to Thee! We have no knowledge but that which Thou hast taught us; surely Thou art the Knowing, the Wise. Then what is your opinion, O questioner, about the One I have described in such terms? Praise and glory be to Him. He has no beginning, and is not subject to change. His Essence does not change states. Long stretches of day and night have no affect on Him. He originated the creation without any example which He could follow, and without any specimen prepared by any deity that was before Him. Attributes do no encompass Him so that we can comprehend Him, much less comprehend Him by means of limitations. He is Still. There is nothing whatsoever like unto Him. Exalted is He from the attributes of the created. Eyes cannot perceive Him so that He may be described by sight. His Essence is only known to Himself and cannot be recognized by His Creation. His Greatness surpasses the greatest conjectures of the most imaginative. He is Higher than anything that could be conceived by the feeble minds who seek to understand His Inner Greatness. He does not have a likeness. Nothing He creates is similar to Him. To the ones that recognize Him, He is above compeers and opponents. The ones who give partners to Allah are liars as they compare Him to their own kind. They embellish Him through their imaginations with the ornaments of creation. They divided Him in parts through speculation. They use their intellects to assess Him on the basis of creation, giving Him different strengths. How can this be done when it is impossible for the intellect to measure His Extent? Misleading dreams have gone astray in perceiving His Essence; because He is higher than the limits of human reasoning. Even the Angels, who are close to His Realm of Glory, cannot encompass Him. Exalted is He from having a parallel with which He may be resembled. He is the Subtle [al-Latif]. He prevents the imagination from finding Him in the depth of His Realm. He prevents the minds which are free from evil thoughts from comprehending His Being. He prevents the hearts who long to embrace His Attributes from going beyond description, and securing knowledge of His Divinity. He turns back those who cross the dark pitfalls of the unknown in their search for Him. Glorified be He! All those who seek to comprehend him return defeated, admitting that His Knowledge cannot be understood through such random efforts. They admit that not an iota of His Honor can enter the intellect of the greatest thinkers. They admit that He is far from the most powerful strengths of limited beings because He is other than His Creation. Therefore, He has no peer in His Creation. Verily, things are compared to their equal. However, if something has no equal, how can it be compared with something which is completely different from it? He is the Originator who had nothing before Him, and He is the Last who has nothing after Him. Eyes cannot perceive Him due to the magnificence of His Power. Eyes are concealed with veils, and cannot penetrate their density. Eyes cannot penetrate the Veils of the Possessor of the Throne, and they cannot reach the One who Governs Everything through His Will. The pride of all tyrants cringes except the Majesty of His Greatness. All slaves surrender to Him, and all faces fear His Wrath. The signs of His Wisdom are apparent from everything He has created. Everything He created is His Proof, and is linked to Him. It is a silent creation, it is His Proof that speaks through planning. He has fixed limits for everything He has created and has set everything firm. He has put everything in its place through the gracefulness of His Planning. He has fixed the direction for everything. Nothing surpasses or falls shorts of the position He has willed. Nothing disobeys His Command to move, when He intends it to move. He does so without effort, and without challenge to His Order. Thus was completed the creation, and it bowed in obedience to Him. It was time for His creation to respond to Him. The laziness of any slug or the inertness of any excusefinder did not prevent them from doing so. So He straightened the curves of things, and completed the traces of their limits. With His Power He created coherence n their contradictory parts, and joined together the factors of similarity. Then He distinguished their colors, and separated them in varieties which differ in quantities, properties, and shapes. All of this was a new creation. He made them firm, shaped them as He intended, and invented them. Through His Knowledge He organized everything into species. His Planning perceives the splendor of its destiny. O questioner! Know that he who describes our Sublime Lord by means of limbs and extremities knows nothing about His Nature. Verily, his heart did not profess with certainty that He is devoid of partners. It is as though he has not heard people renouncing their false gods by saying: By Allah! We were certainly in manifest error, when we made you equal to the Lord of the worlds.1 Whoever equates our Lord with anything has given Him a partner. Whoever gives Him a partner is an unbeliever as is stated in His Unambiguous verses, and as is indicated by His Clear Arguments. This is because Allah cannot be conceived by the limits of human intelligence. If He could be, He would be subject to change. Nor can Allah be conceived by means of intellectual efforts. If He could be, he would be limited, and an object subject t alteration. He is the Producer [al-Munshiâ€™] who created everything without a need for imagination, without the urge of a hidden impulse, without any past experiment, and without the assistance of any partner who may have helped Him in creating wonderful things. Those who compare Him to His Creation divided Him into parts: some are limited, some vary in size, and others fall into different categories. He, the Mighty and High, Exists on His Own Accord, and is not dependent. People have not honored Him with the honor that He deserves. In order to demonstrate that He cannot be compared to His Creation, that He has no equals, and that He is far above the analogies of the unbelievers who give him limitations, He said: Any they have not honored Allah with the honor that is due to Him; and the whole Earth shall be in His grip on the Day of Resurrection and heavens rolled up in His right hand; glory be to Him, and may He be exalted above what they associate (with Him).2 When describing Allah, limit your selves to the Divine Attributes which the Qur`an has provided, and seek light from the effulgence of its guidance. Leave to Allah that knowledge which Satan has prompted you to seek, and which neither the Qur`an enjoins you to seek, nor is there any trace of it in the actions or sayings of the Prophet and other Imams of Guidance. This is the extreme limit of Allahâ€™s claim upon you. Know that those who are firm in knowledge refrain from opening through the veils of the unseen. The firm in knowledge, acknowledge their ignorance, and refuse to seek justification for their belief by means of the unseen. Hence, they say: We believe in it, it is all from our Lord.3 Allah, the Mighty and High praises them for admitting that they cannot obtain forbidden knowledge. They do not engage in deep discussions regarding the knowledge which is hidden from them and remain firm in their faith. Be content with this, and do not limit the Greatness of Allah on the basis of the limits of your own intelligence; otherwise, you will be destroyed.", "arabicText": "13 - Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ø£Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ù…Ø±Ø§Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù‚Ø§Ù‚ Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙˆÙÙŠ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø¥Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¹ÙŠÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø±Ù…ÙƒÙŠØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø³ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø¥Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¹ÙŠÙ„ Ø¨Ù† Ù…Ù‡Ø±Ø§Ù† Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙˆÙÙŠØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø¥Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¹ÙŠÙ„ Ø¨Ù† Ø¥Ø³Ø­Ø§Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù‡Ù†ÙŠØŒ Ø¹Ù† ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø¨Ù† ÙØ±ÙˆØ©ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ù…Ø³Ø¹Ø¯Ø© Ø¨Ù† ØµØ¯Ù‚Ø©ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø³Ù…Ø¹Øª Ø£Ø¨Ø§ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: Ø¨ÙŠÙ†Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… ÙŠØ®Ø·Ø¨ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø¨Ø± Ø¨Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙˆÙØ© Ø¥Ø° Ù‚Ø§Ù… Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø±Ø¬Ù„ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ØµÙ Ù„Ù†Ø§ Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ù„Ù†Ø²Ø¯Ø§Ø¯ Ù„Ù‡ Ø­Ø¨Ø§ ÙˆØ¨Ù‡ Ù…Ø¹Ø±ÙØ©ØŒ ÙØºØ¶Ø¨ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ†Ø§Ø¯Ù‰ Ø§Ù„ØµÙ„Ø§Ø© Ø¬Ø§Ù…Ø¹Ø© ÙØ§Ø¬ØªÙ…Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø³ Ø­ØªÙ‰ ØºØµ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³Ø¬Ø¯ Ø¨Ø£Ù‡Ù„Ù‡ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ù‚Ø§Ù… Ù…ØªØºÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù„ÙˆÙ† ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„: Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙØ±Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø¹ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠÙƒØ¯ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø¹Ø·Ø§Ø¡ Ø¥Ø° ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ø¹Ø· Ù…Ù†ØªÙ‚Øµ Ø³ÙˆØ§Ù‡ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø¦ Ø¨ÙÙˆØ§Ø¦Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¹Ù… ÙˆØ¹ÙˆØ§Ø¦Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø²ÙŠØ¯ØŒ ÙˆØ¨Ø¬ÙˆØ¯Ù‡ Ø¶Ù…Ù† Ø¹ÙŠØ§Ù„Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ØŒ ÙØ£Ù†Ù‡Ø¬ Ø³Ø¨ÙŠÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø·Ù„Ø¨ Ù„Ù„Ø±Ø§ØºØ¨ÙŠÙ† Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ØŒ ÙÙ„ÙŠØ³ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ø³Ø¦Ù„ Ø£Ø¬ÙˆØ¯ Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ³Ø£Ù„ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø§Ø®ØªÙ„Ù Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø¯Ù‡Ø± ÙÙŠØ®ØªÙ„Ù Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø§Ù„ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ùˆ ÙˆÙ‡Ø¨ Ù…Ø§ ØªÙ†ÙØ³Øª Ø¹Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ø¯Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø¨Ø§Ù„ ÙˆØ¶Ø­ÙƒØª Ø¹Ù†Ù‡ Ø£ØµØ¯Ø§Ù Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø­Ø§Ø± Ù…Ù† ÙÙ„Ø° Ø§Ù„Ù„Ø¬ÙŠÙ† ÙˆØ³Ø¨Ø§Ø¦Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù‚ÙŠØ§Ù† ÙˆÙ†Ø¶Ø§Ø¦Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø±Ø¬Ø§Ù† Ù„Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø¹Ø¨ÙŠØ¯Ù‡ØŒ Ù„Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ø«Ø± Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙÙŠ ÙˆØ¬ÙˆØ¯Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ø£Ù†ÙØ¯ Ø³Ø¹Ø© Ù…Ø§ Ø¹Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø¹Ù†Ø¯Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø°Ø®Ø§Ø¦Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø§ÙØ¶Ø§Ù„ Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†ÙØ°Ù‡ Ù…Ø·Ø§Ù„Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø¤Ø§Ù„ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ®Ø·Ø± Ù„ÙƒØ«Ø±ØªÙ‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø¨Ø§Ù„ØŒ Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø¬ÙˆØ§Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ†Ù‚ØµÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§Ù‡Ø¨ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø­Ù„Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø­Ø§Ø­ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø­ÙŠÙ† (ÙˆØ¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ù…Ø±Ù‡ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ Ø£Ø±Ø§Ø¯ Ø´ÙŠØ¦Ø§ Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ù„Ù‡ ÙƒÙ† ÙÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ†) Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ø¹Ø¬Ø²Øª Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù‚Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† ÙƒØ±Ø³ÙŠ ÙƒØ±Ø§Ù…ØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆØ·ÙˆÙ„ ÙˆÙ„Ù‡Ù‡Ù… Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø¸ÙŠÙ… Ø¬Ù„Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ø²Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† ØºÙŠØ¨ Ù…Ù„ÙƒÙˆØªÙ‡ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù…Ø±Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ù…Ù„ÙƒÙˆØª Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯Ø³ Ø¨Ø­ÙŠØ« Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø¹Ø±ÙØªÙ‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø§ ÙØ·Ø±Ù‡Ù… Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø£Ù† Ù‚Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ§: (Ø³Ø¨Ø­Ø§Ù†Ùƒ Ù„Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ù„Ù†Ø§ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù…ØªÙ†Ø§ Ø¥Ù†Ùƒ Ø£Ù†Øª Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙƒÙŠÙ…) . ÙÙ…Ø§ Ø¸Ù†Ùƒ Ø£ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø§Ø¦Ù„ Ø¨Ù…Ù† Ù‡Ùˆ Ù‡ÙƒØ°Ø§ØŒ Ø³Ø¨Ø­Ø§Ù†Ù‡ ÙˆØ¨Ø­Ù…Ø¯Ù‡ØŒ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ­Ø¯Ø« ÙÙŠÙ…ÙƒÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„ØªØºÙŠØ± ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§Ù†ØªÙ‚Ø§Ù„ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ù… ÙŠØªØµØ±Ù ÙÙŠ Ø°Ø§ØªÙ‡ Ø¨ÙƒØ±ÙˆØ± Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø­ÙˆØ§Ù„ ÙˆÙ„Ù… ÙŠØ®ØªÙ„Ù Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø­Ù‚Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ù„ÙŠØ§Ù„ÙŠ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø£ÙŠØ§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ø§Ø¨ØªØ¯Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ØºÙŠØ± Ù…Ø«Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù…ØªØ«Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ù…Ù‚Ø¯Ø§Ø± Ø§Ø­ØªØ°Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø¹Ø¨ÙˆØ¯ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù‚Ø¨Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„Ù… ØªØ­Ø· Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„ØµÙØ§Øª ÙÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø¥Ø¯Ø±Ø§ÙƒÙ‡Ø§ Ø¥ÙŠØ§Ù‡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø¯ÙˆØ¯ Ù…ØªÙ†Ø§Ù‡ÙŠØ§ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø²Ø§Ù„ - Ù„ÙŠØ³ ÙƒÙ…Ø«Ù„Ù‡ Ø´Ø¦ - Ø¹Ù† ØµÙØ© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ‚ÙŠÙ† Ù…ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„ÙŠØ§ ÙˆØ§Ù†Ø­Ø³Ø±Øª Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ù† ØªÙ†Ø§Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¹ÙŠØ§Ù† Ù…ÙˆØµÙˆÙØ§ ÙˆØ¨Ø§Ù„Ø°Ø§Øª Ø§Ù„ØªÙŠ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡Ø§ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù‡Ùˆ Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ Ù…Ø¹Ø±ÙˆÙØ§ØŒ ÙˆÙØ§Øª Ù„Ø¹Ù„ÙˆÙ‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø´ÙŠØ§Ø¡ Ù…ÙˆØ§Ù‚Ø¹ Ø±Ø¬Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…ØªÙˆÙ‡Ù…ÙŠÙ† ÙˆØ§Ø±ØªÙØ¹ Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ù† ØªØ­ÙˆÙŠ ÙƒÙ†Ù‡ Ø¹Ø¸Ù…ØªÙ‡ ÙÙ‡Ø§Ù‡Ø© Ø±ÙˆÙŠØ§Øª Ø§Ù„Ù…ØªÙÙƒØ±ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙÙ„ÙŠØ³ Ù„Ù‡ Ù…Ø«Ù„ ÙÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ®Ù„Ù‚ Ù…Ø´Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ Ø¨Ù‡ ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø²Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¹Ø±ÙØ© Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø´Ø¨Ø§Ù‡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø£Ø¶Ø¯Ø§Ø¯ Ù…Ù†Ø²Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ÙƒØ°Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ø¯Ù„ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¥Ø° Ø´Ø¨Ù‡ÙˆÙ‡ Ø¨Ù…Ø«Ù„ Ø£ØµÙ†Ø§ÙÙ‡Ù… ÙˆØ­Ù„ÙˆÙ‡ Ø­Ù„ÙŠØ© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ‚ÙŠÙ† Ø¨Ø£ÙˆÙ‡Ø§Ù…Ù‡Ù…ØŒ ÙˆØ¬Ø²ÙˆÙ‡ Ø¨ØªÙ‚Ø¯ÙŠØ± Ù…Ù†ØªØ¬ Ø®ÙˆØ§Ø·Ø±Ù‡Ù… ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯Ø±ÙˆÙ‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø®ØªÙ„ÙØ© Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙˆÙ‰ Ø¨Ù‚Ø±Ø§Ø¦Ø­ Ø¹Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡Ù… ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ù…Ù† Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ‚Ø¯Ø± Ù‚Ø¯Ø±Ù‡ Ù…Ù‚Ø¯Ø±Ø§ ÙÙŠ Ø±ÙˆÙŠØ§Øª Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙˆÙ‡Ø§Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ø¶Ù„Øª ÙÙŠ Ø¥Ø¯Ø±Ø§Ùƒ ÙƒÙ†Ù‡Ù‡ Ù‡ÙˆØ§Ø¬Ø³ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø­Ù„Ø§Ù… Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ø£Ø¬Ù„ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ­Ø¯Ù‡ Ø£Ù„Ø¨Ø§Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø± Ø¨Ø§Ù„ØªÙÙƒÙŠØ±ØŒ Ø£Ùˆ ÙŠØ­ÙŠØ· Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù‚Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ù…Ù„ÙƒÙˆØª Ø¹Ø²ØªÙ‡ Ø¨ØªÙ‚Ø¯ÙŠØ±ØŒ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ù„Ù‡ ÙƒÙÙˆ ÙÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¨Ù‡ Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ø·ÙŠÙ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ Ø£Ø±Ø§Ø¯Øª Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙˆÙ‡Ø§Ù… Ø£Ù† ØªÙ‚Ø¹ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙÙŠ Ø¹Ù…ÙŠÙ‚Ø§Øª ØºÙŠÙˆØ¨ Ù…Ù„ÙƒÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆØ­Ø§ÙˆÙ„Øª Ø§Ù„ÙÙƒØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¨Ø±Ø£Ø© Ù…Ù† Ø®Ø·Ø± Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ³ÙˆØ§Ø³ Ø¥Ø¯Ø±Ø§Ùƒ Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø°Ø§ØªÙ‡ ÙˆØªÙˆÙ„Ù‡Øª Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ù„ÙˆØ¨ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù„ØªØ­ÙˆÙŠ Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ù…ÙƒÙŠÙØ§ ÙÙŠ ØµÙØ§ØªÙ‡ ÙˆØºÙ…Ø¶Øª Ù…Ø¯Ø§Ø®Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù‚ÙˆÙ„ Ù…Ù† Ø­ÙŠØ« Ù„Ø§ ØªØ¨Ù„ØºÙ‡ Ø§Ù„ØµÙØ§Øª Ù„ØªÙ†Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø¥Ù„Ù‡ÙŠØªÙ‡ Ø±Ø¯Ø¹Øª Ø®Ø§Ø³Ø¦Ø© ÙˆÙ‡ÙŠ ØªØ¬ÙˆØ¨ Ù…Ù‡Ø§ÙˆÙŠ Ø³Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠÙˆØ¨ Ù…ØªØ®Ù„ØµØ© Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø³Ø¨Ø­Ø§Ù†Ù‡ØŒ Ø±Ø¬Ø¹Øª Ø¥Ø° Ø¬Ø¨Ù‡Øª Ù…Ø¹ØªØ±ÙØ© Ø¨Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø§Ù„ Ø¨Ø¬ÙˆØ¨ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø¹ØªØ³Ø§Ù ÙƒÙ†Ù‡ Ù…Ø¹Ø±ÙØªÙ‡ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ®Ø·Ø± Ø¨Ø¨Ø§Ù„ Ø£ÙˆÙ„ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø±ÙˆÙŠØ§Øª Ø®Ø§Ø·Ø±Ø© Ù…Ù† ØªÙ‚Ø¯ÙŠØ± Ø¬Ù„Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ø²ØªÙ‡ Ù„Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠ Ù‚ÙˆÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­Ø¯ÙˆØ¯ÙŠÙ† Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ø®Ù„Ø§Ù Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ØŒ ÙÙ„Ø§ Ø´Ø¨Ù‡ Ù„Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ‚ÙŠÙ† ÙˆØ¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ø¦ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ÙŠÙ„Ù‡ØŒ ÙØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ø§ Ø¹Ø¯ÙŠÙ„ Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙƒÙŠÙ ÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¨ØºÙŠØ± Ù…Ø«Ø§Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø¯Ø¦ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙƒÙ† Ø´Ø¦ Ù‚Ø¨Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¢Ø®Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ø´Ø¦ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯Ù‡ØŒ Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ†Ø§Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø¬Ø¯ Ø¬Ø¨Ø±ÙˆØªÙ‡ Ø¥Ø° Ø­Ø¬Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ Ø¨Ø­Ø¬Ø¨ Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ†ÙØ° ÙÙŠ Ø«Ø®Ù† ÙƒØ«Ø§ÙØªÙ‡ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ØªØ®Ø±Ù‚ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø°ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø±Ø´ Ù…ØªØ§Ù†Ø© Ø®ØµØ§Ø¦Øµ Ø³ØªØ±Ø§ØªÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ ØµØ¯Ø±Øª Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù…ÙˆØ± Ø¹Ù† Ù…Ø´ÙŠØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆØªØµØ§ØºØ±Øª Ø¹Ø²Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…ØªØ¬Ø¨Ø±ÙŠÙ† Ø¯ÙˆÙ† Ø¬Ù„Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ø¸Ù…ØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆØ®Ø¶Ø¹Øª Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ù‚Ø§Ø¨ØŒ ÙˆØ¹Ù†Øª Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ¬ÙˆÙ‡ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø®Ø§ÙØªÙ‡ ÙˆØ¸Ù‡Ø±Øª ÙÙŠ Ø¨Ø¯Ø§Ø¦Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ø£Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù‡Ø§ Ø¢Ø«Ø§Ø± Ø­ÙƒÙ…ØªÙ‡ ÙˆØµØ§Ø± ÙƒÙ„ Ø´Ø¦ Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø­Ø¬Ø© Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙ…Ù†ØªØ³Ø¨Ø§ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙØ¥Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ø§ ØµØ§Ù…ØªÙ‡Ø§ ÙØ­Ø¬ØªÙ‡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„ØªØ¯Ø¨ÙŠØ± Ù†Ø§Ø·Ù‚Ø© ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø¯Ø± Ù…Ø§ Ø®Ù„Ù‚ØŒ ÙØ£Ø­ÙƒÙ… ØªÙ‚Ø¯ÙŠØ±Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙˆØ¶Ø¹ ÙƒÙ„ Ø´Ø¦ Ø¨Ù„Ø·Ù ØªØ¯Ø¨ÙŠØ±Ù‡ Ù…ÙˆØ¶Ø¹Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙˆØ¬Ù‡Ù‡ Ø¨Ø¬Ù‡Ø© ÙÙ„Ù… ÙŠØ¨Ù„Øº Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ø´Ø¦ Ø­Ø¯ÙˆØ¯ Ù…Ù†Ø²Ù„ØªÙ‡ ÙˆÙ„Ù… ÙŠÙ‚ØµØ± Ø¯ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù†ØªÙ‡Ø§Ø¡ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø´ÙŠØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ù… ÙŠØ³ØªØ¹ØµØ¨ Ø¥Ø° Ø£Ù…Ø±Ù‡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¶ÙŠ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ø±Ø§Ø¯ØªÙ‡ØŒ Ø¨Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ù†Ø§Ø© Ù„Ù„ØºÙˆØ¨ Ù…Ø³Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ù…ÙƒØ§Ø¦Ø¯Ø© Ù„Ù…Ø®Ø§Ù„Ù Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù…Ø±Ù‡ ÙØªÙ… Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ø°Ø¹Ù† Ù„Ø·Ø§Ø¹ØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆÙˆØ§ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„ÙˆÙ‚Øª Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ø£Ø®Ø±Ø¬Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø¥Ø¬Ø§Ø¨Ø© Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ¹ØªØ±Ø¶ Ø¯ÙˆÙ†Ù‡Ø§ Ø±ÙŠØ« Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¨Ø·Ø¦ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ø£Ù†Ø§Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…ØªÙ„ÙƒØ¦ ÙØ£Ù‚Ø§Ù… Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø´ÙŠØ§Ø¡ Ø£ÙˆØ¯Ù‡Ø§ (Ù¡) ÙˆÙ†Ù‡Ù‰ Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ù„Ù… Ø­Ø¯ÙˆØ¯Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø£Ù… Ø¨Ù‚Ø¯Ø±ØªÙ‡ Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ù…ØªØ¶Ø§Ø¯ØªÙ‡Ø§ (Ù¢) ÙˆÙˆØµÙ„ Ø£Ø³Ø¨Ø§Ø¨ Ù‚Ø±Ø§Ø¦Ù†Ù‡Ø§ (Ù£) ÙˆØ®Ø§Ù„Ù Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ø£Ù„ÙˆØ§Ù†Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙØ±Ù‚Ù‡Ø§ Ø£Ø¬Ù†Ø§Ø³Ø§ Ù…Ø®ØªÙ„ÙØ§Øª ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù‚Ø¯Ø§Ø± ÙˆØ§Ù„ØºØ±Ø§Ø¦Ø² ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù‡ÙŠØ¦Ø§ØªØŒ Ø¨Ø¯Ø§ÙŠØ§ Ø®Ù„Ø§Ø¦Ù‚ Ø£Ø­ÙƒÙ… ØµÙ†Ø¹Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙØ·Ø±Ù‡Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ø±Ø§Ø¯ Ø¥Ø° Ø§Ø¨ØªØ¯Ø¹Ù‡Ø§ØŒ Ø§Ù†ØªØ¸Ù… Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ ØµÙ†ÙˆÙ Ø°Ø±Ø¦Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ø¯Ø±Ùƒ ØªØ¯Ø¨ÙŠØ±Ù‡ Ø­Ø³Ù† ØªÙ‚Ø¯ÙŠØ±Ù‡Ø§. Ø£ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø§Ø¦Ù„ Ø¥Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ù…Ù† Ø´Ø¨Ù‡ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù„ÙŠÙ„ Ø¨ØªØ¨Ø§ÙŠÙ† Ø£Ø¹Ø¶Ø§Ø¡ Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ ÙˆØ¨ØªÙ„Ø§Ø­Ù… Ø£Ø­Ù‚Ø§Ù‚ Ù…ÙØ§ØµÙ„Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­ØªØ¬Ø¨Ø© Ø¨ØªØ¯Ø¨ÙŠØ± Ø­ÙƒÙ…ØªÙ‡ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ¹Ù‚Ø¯ ØºÙŠØ¨ Ø¶Ù…ÙŠØ±Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø¹Ø±ÙØªÙ‡ (Ù¤) ÙˆÙ„Ù… ÙŠØ´Ø§Ù‡Ø¯ Ù‚Ù„Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙ‚ÙŠÙ† Ø¨Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ Ù†Ø¯ Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ³Ù…Ø¹ Ø¨ØªØ¨Ø±ÙŠ Ø§Ù„ØªØ§Ø¨Ø¹ÙŠÙ† Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…ØªØ¨ÙˆØ¹ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙ‡Ù… ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ÙˆÙ†: ï´¿ØªØ§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø£Ù† ÙƒÙ†Ø§ Ù„ÙÙŠ Ø¶Ù„Ø§Ù„ Ù…Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ø¥Ø° Ù†Ø³ÙˆÙŠÙƒÙ… Ø¨Ø±Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙŠÙ†ï´¾ ÙÙ…Ù† Ø³Ø§ÙˆÙ‰ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø´Ø¦ ÙÙ‚Ø¯ Ø¹Ø¯Ù„ Ø¨Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ø¯Ù„ Ø¨Ù‡ ÙƒØ§ÙØ± Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ù†Ø²Ù„Øª Ø¨Ù‡ Ù…Ø­ÙƒÙ…Ø§Øª Ø¢ÙŠØ§ØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ†Ø·Ù‚Øª Ø¨Ù‡ Ø´ÙˆØ§Ù‡Ø¯ Ø­Ø¬Ø¬ Ø¨ÙŠÙ†Ø§ØªÙ‡ØŒ Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØªÙ†Ø§Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù‚ÙˆÙ„ ÙÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠ Ù…Ù‡Ø¨ ÙÙƒØ±Ù‡Ø§ Ù…ÙƒÙŠÙØ§ØŒ ÙˆÙÙŠ Ø­ÙˆØ§ØµÙ„ Ø±ÙˆÙŠØ§Øª Ù‡Ù…Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù†ÙÙˆØ³ Ù…Ø­Ø¯ÙˆØ¯Ø§ Ù…ØµØ±ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø´Ø¦ Ø£ØµÙ†Ø§Ù Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø´ÙŠØ§Ø¡ Ø¨Ù„Ø§ Ø±ÙˆÙŠØ© Ø§Ø­ØªØ§Ø¬ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ù‚Ø±ÙŠØ­Ø© ØºØ±ÙŠØ²Ø© Ø£Ø¶Ù…Ø± Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ØªØ¬Ø±Ø¨Ø© Ø£ÙØ§Ø¯Ù‡Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø± Ø­ÙˆØ§Ø¯Ø« Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù‡ÙˆØ± (Ù¡) ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ø´Ø±ÙŠÙƒ Ø£Ø¹Ø§Ù†Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ø¨ØªØ¯Ø§Ø¹ Ø¹Ø¬Ø§Ø¦Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù…ÙˆØ±ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ù„Ù…Ø§ Ø´Ø¨Ù‡Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ø¯Ù„ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­Ø¯ÙˆØ¯ ÙÙŠ ØµÙØ§ØªÙ‡ØŒ Ø°ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù‚Ø·Ø§Ø± ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù†ÙˆØ§Ø­ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø®ØªÙ„ÙØ© ÙØ·Ø¨Ù‚Ø§ØªÙ‡ØŒ Ùˆ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ¬ÙˆØ¯ Ø¨Ù†ÙØ³Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ Ø¨Ø£Ø¯Ø§ØªÙ‡ØŒ Ø§Ù†ØªÙÙ‰ Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ù‚Ø¯Ø±ÙˆÙ‡ Ø­Ù‚ Ù‚Ø¯Ø±Ù‡ (Ù¢) ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ ØªÙ†Ø²ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ù„Ù†ÙØ³Ù‡ Ø¹Ù† Ù…Ø´Ø§Ø±ÙƒØ© Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù†Ø¯Ø§Ø¯ ÙˆØ§Ø±ØªÙØ§Ø¹Ø§ Ø¹Ù† Ù‚ÙŠØ§Ø³ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‚Ø¯Ø±ÙŠÙ† Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø¯ÙˆØ¯ Ù…Ù† ÙƒÙØ±Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø¯: ï´¿ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ù‚Ø¯Ø±ÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø­Ù‚ Ù‚Ø¯Ø±Ù‡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ Ø¬Ù…ÙŠØ¹Ø§ Ù‚Ø¨Ø¶ØªÙ‡ ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠÙ…Ø© ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§ÙˆØ§Øª Ù…Ø·ÙˆÙŠØ§Øª Ø¨ÙŠÙ…ÙŠÙ†Ù‡ Ø³Ø¨Ø­Ø§Ù†Ù‡ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¹Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø±ÙƒÙˆÙ†ï´¾ Ù…Ø§ Ø¯Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø±Ø¢Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù† ØµÙØªÙ‡ ÙØ§ØªØ¨Ø¹Ù‡ Ù„ÙŠÙˆØµÙ„ Ø¨ÙŠÙ†Ùƒ ÙˆØ¨ÙŠÙ† Ù…Ø¹Ø±ÙØªÙ‡ ÙˆØ£ØªÙ… Ø¨Ù‡ ÙˆØ§Ø³ØªØ¶Ø¦ Ø¨Ù†ÙˆØ± Ù‡Ø¯Ø§ÙŠØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙØ¥Ù†Ù‡Ø§ Ù†Ø¹Ù…Ø© ÙˆØ­ÙƒÙ…Ø© Ø£ÙˆØªÙŠØªÙ‡Ù…Ø§ ÙØ®Ø° Ù…Ø§ Ø£ÙˆØªÙŠØª ÙˆÙƒÙ† Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø´Ø§ÙƒØ±ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø¯Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø´ÙŠØ·Ø§Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù…Ø§ Ù„ÙŠØ³ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø±Ø¢Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙƒ ÙØ±Ø¶Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙÙŠ Ø³Ù†Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ ÙˆØ£Ø¦Ù…Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù‡Ø¯Ù‰ Ø£Ø«Ø±Ù‡ ÙÙƒÙ„ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ØŒ ÙØ¥Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù…Ù†ØªÙ‡Ù‰ Ø­Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙƒ. ÙˆØ§Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø§Ø³Ø®ÙŠÙ† ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† Ø£ØºÙ†Ø§Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù‚ØªØ­Ø§Ù… ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø¯Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¶Ø±ÙˆØ¨Ø© Ø¯ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠÙˆØ¨ ÙÙ„Ø²Ù…ÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù‚Ø±Ø§Ø± Ø¨Ø¬Ù…Ù„Ø© Ù…Ø§ Ø¬Ù‡Ù„ÙˆØ§ ØªÙØ³ÙŠØ±Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­Ø¬ÙˆØ¨ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ§: (Ø¢Ù…Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ù‡ ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ù† Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§) ÙÙ…Ø¯Ø­ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ø§Ø¹ØªØ±Ø§ÙÙ‡Ù… Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¬Ø² Ø¹Ù† ØªÙ†Ø§ÙˆÙ„ Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ­ÙŠØ·ÙˆØ§ Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ³Ù…Ù‰ ØªØ±ÙƒÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„ØªØ¹Ù…Ù‚ ÙÙŠ Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙƒÙ„ÙÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø­Ø« Ø¹Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø±Ø³ÙˆØ®Ø§ØŒ ÙØ§Ù‚ØªØµØ± Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø°Ù„ÙƒØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ØªÙ‚Ø¯Ø± Ø¹Ø¸Ù…Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ (Ø³Ø¨Ø­Ø§Ù†Ù‡) Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù‚Ø¯Ø± Ø¹Ù‚Ù„Ùƒ ÙØªÙƒÙˆÙ† Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù‡Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙŠÙ†. ", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/14/2/2/13", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 2, "thaqalaynSanad": "13. `Ali Ibn Ahmad Ibn Muhammad ibn `Imran al-Daqqaq (may Allah have mercy on him) said: Muhammad ibn Abu `Abd Allah al-Kufi said: Muhammad ibn Ismai`il al-Barmaki said: `Ali ibn al- `Abbas related to me that Isma`il ibn Mihran al-Kufi related to me on the authority of Isma`il ibn Ishaq al-Juhani, on the authority of Faraj ibn Farwah, on the authority of Mas`adah ibn Sadaqah, on the authority of Abu `Abd Allah that ", "thaqalaynMatn": "While the Commander of the Faithful (AS) was preaching from his pulpit in (the Mosque of) al-Kufah, a man stood up and said: â€œO Commander of the Faithful! Describe for us your Lord, Blessed and Exalted be He, so that we can increase our love and understanding of Him.â€ Hence, the Commander of the Faithful (AS) became angry, and called all to attend. Thus, the people gathered until the mosque was packed. Then he stood up, with his face flushed, and addressed the congregation as such: All praise be to Allah for Whom refusal to give does not enrich, and for Whom munificence does not make poor! All who give lose, expect He. He is full of beneficial bounties and plentiful gifts. All of creation depends on His Generosity for their sustenance. He has prepared the way for those who seek Him. He is as Generous when He is asked, as He is when He is not asked. Time does not affect Him as this would imply that He is subject to change. His Essence would not be affected, and His Wealth would not be diminished, even if He gave away all of the silver and all of the gold found in the mines in the mountains, and all of the pearls which the shells of the ocean produce for His Servants. His Wealth would remain great and unaffected, even if He answered the demands of every beggar because He is the Most Generous. Giving does not decrease His Wealth, not do the request of His Supplicants make Him miserly. His Command, when He intends anything, is only to say to it: Be, so it is.1 The Angels are incapable of approaching the nobility of His Throne. They are confused when they attempt to understand Him and the greatness of His Might and Majesty. Although they are close to His Realm, they know nothing about His Affair except what He informs them. They are so close to the sanctity of His Realm, that they recognize the limitations with which they were created saying: Glory be to Thee! We have no knowledge but that which Thou hast taught us; surely Thou art the Knowing, the Wise. Then what is your opinion, O questioner, about the One I have described in such terms? Praise and glory be to Him. He has no beginning, and is not subject to change. His Essence does not change states. Long stretches of day and night have no affect on Him. He originated the creation without any example which He could follow, and without any specimen prepared by any deity that was before Him. Attributes do no encompass Him so that we can comprehend Him, much less comprehend Him by means of limitations. He is Still. There is nothing whatsoever like unto Him. Exalted is He from the attributes of the created. Eyes cannot perceive Him so that He may be described by sight. His Essence is only known to Himself and cannot be recognized by His Creation. His Greatness surpasses the greatest conjectures of the most imaginative. He is Higher than anything that could be conceived by the feeble minds who seek to understand His Inner Greatness. He does not have a likeness. Nothing He creates is similar to Him. To the ones that recognize Him, He is above compeers and opponents. The ones who give partners to Allah are liars as they compare Him to their own kind. They embellish Him through their imaginations with the ornaments of creation. They divided Him in parts through speculation. They use their intellects to assess Him on the basis of creation, giving Him different strengths. How can this be done when it is impossible for the intellect to measure His Extent? Misleading dreams have gone astray in perceiving His Essence; because He is higher than the limits of human reasoning. Even the Angels, who are close to His Realm of Glory, cannot encompass Him. Exalted is He from having a parallel with which He may be resembled. He is the Subtle [al-Latif]. He prevents the imagination from finding Him in the depth of His Realm. He prevents the minds which are free from evil thoughts from comprehending His Being. He prevents the hearts who long to embrace His Attributes from going beyond description, and securing knowledge of His Divinity. He turns back those who cross the dark pitfalls of the unknown in their search for Him. Glorified be He! All those who seek to comprehend him return defeated, admitting that His Knowledge cannot be understood through such random efforts. They admit that not an iota of His Honor can enter the intellect of the greatest thinkers. They admit that He is far from the most powerful strengths of limited beings because He is other than His Creation. Therefore, He has no peer in His Creation. Verily, things are compared to their equal. However, if something has no equal, how can it be compared with something which is completely different from it? He is the Originator who had nothing before Him, and He is the Last who has nothing after Him. Eyes cannot perceive Him due to the magnificence of His Power. Eyes are concealed with veils, and cannot penetrate their density. Eyes cannot penetrate the Veils of the Possessor of the Throne, and they cannot reach the One who Governs Everything through His Will. The pride of all tyrants cringes except the Majesty of His Greatness. All slaves surrender to Him, and all faces fear His Wrath. The signs of His Wisdom are apparent from everything He has created. Everything He created is His Proof, and is linked to Him. It is a silent creation, it is His Proof that speaks through planning. He has fixed limits for everything He has created and has set everything firm. He has put everything in its place through the gracefulness of His Planning. He has fixed the direction for everything. Nothing surpasses or falls shorts of the position He has willed. Nothing disobeys His Command to move, when He intends it to move. He does so without effort, and without challenge to His Order. Thus was completed the creation, and it bowed in obedience to Him. It was time for His creation to respond to Him. The laziness of any slug or the inertness of any excusefinder did not prevent them from doing so. So He straightened the curves of things, and completed the traces of their limits. With His Power He created coherence n their contradictory parts, and joined together the factors of similarity. Then He distinguished their colors, and separated them in varieties which differ in quantities, properties, and shapes. All of this was a new creation. He made them firm, shaped them as He intended, and invented them. Through His Knowledge He organized everything into species. His Planning perceives the splendor of its destiny. O questioner! Know that he who describes our Sublime Lord by means of limbs and extremities knows nothing about His Nature. Verily, his heart did not profess with certainty that He is devoid of partners. It is as though he has not heard people renouncing their false gods by saying: By Allah! We were certainly in manifest error, when we made you equal to the Lord of the worlds.1 Whoever equates our Lord with anything has given Him a partner. Whoever gives Him a partner is an unbeliever as is stated in His Unambiguous verses, and as is indicated by His Clear Arguments. This is because Allah cannot be conceived by the limits of human intelligence. If He could be, He would be subject to change. Nor can Allah be conceived by means of intellectual efforts. If He could be, he would be limited, and an object subject t alteration. He is the Producer [al-Munshiâ€™] who created everything without a need for imagination, without the urge of a hidden impulse, without any past experiment, and without the assistance of any partner who may have helped Him in creating wonderful things. Those who compare Him to His Creation divided Him into parts: some are limited, some vary in size, and others fall into different categories. He, the Mighty and High, Exists on His Own Accord, and is not dependent. People have not honored Him with the honor that He deserves. In order to demonstrate that He cannot be compared to His Creation, that He has no equals, and that He is far above the analogies of the unbelievers who give him limitations, He said: Any they have not honored Allah with the honor that is due to Him; and the whole Earth shall be in His grip on the Day of Resurrection and heavens rolled up in His right hand; glory be to Him, and may He be exalted above what they associate (with Him).2 When describing Allah, limit your selves to the Divine Attributes which the Qur`an has provided, and seek light from the effulgence of its guidance. Leave to Allah that knowledge which Satan has prompted you to seek, and which neither the Qur`an enjoins you to seek, nor is there any trace of it in the actions or sayings of the Prophet and other Imams of Guidance. This is the extreme limit of Allahâ€™s claim upon you. Know that those who are firm in knowledge refrain from opening through the veils of the unseen. The firm in knowledge, acknowledge their ignorance, and refuse to seek justification for their belief by means of the unseen. Hence, they say: We believe in it, it is all from our Lord.3 Allah, the Mighty and High praises them for admitting that they cannot obtain forbidden knowledge. They do not engage in deep discussions regarding the knowledge which is hidden from them and remain firm in their faith. Be content with this, and do not limit the Greatness of Allah on the basis of the limits of your own intelligence; otherwise, you will be destroyed.", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 18, "bookId": "Al-Kafi-Volume-8-Kulayni", "book": "Al-KÄfi", "category": "The Book - Garden (of Flowers)", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "The letter of Abu Jaâ€™far, 'Alayhim al-Salam, to Saâ€™ad al-Khayr", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. YaÊ¿qÅ«b al-KulaynÄ«", "translator": "Muhammad Sarwar", "englishText": "16. Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al-Husayn, from Muhammad Bin Ismail Bin Yaziâ€™e, from his uncle Hamza Bin Yaziâ€™e and Al-Husayn Bin Muhammad Bin Al-Ashary, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Abdullah, from Yazeed Bin Abdullah, from the one who narrated to him said: â€˜Abu Jaâ€™far (asws) wrote to Saâ€™ad Al-Khayr: - In the Name of Allah (azwj), the Beneficent, the Merciful. Having said that, I (asws) hereby bequeath to you to fear Allah (azwj) for therein is safety from destruction and a gain during the returning (to Allah (azwj)). Allah (azwj) Mighty and Majestic Protects the servant by means of his piety from whatever his intellect was remote from; and by means of piety he gets clarity from his blindness and his ignorance. And it was by piety that Noah (as) got salvation and those who were with him (as) in the ark got safety from the storm. And it was by piety that the patient ones succeeded and survived from the calamities, and they have brethren upon that path seeking those preferences, having renounced their insolence and their intentions by the desires when the examples from the Book reached them. They praised their Lord (azwj) on what He (azwj) has Sustained them with and that He (azwj) was the One (azwj) Deserving of the Praise, and they blamed their own selves upon what they had wasted and that they themselves were deserving of the condemnation. And they knew that Allah (azwj) Blessed and High, is the Forbearing, the Knowledgeable, however, He (azwj) is Angry on the one who does not care about His (azwj) Pleasure and (as a result) He (azwj) Withholds from the one who does not accept His (azwj) Favours, and but rather the one does not accept guidance from Him (azwj) goes astray. Then it is possible for the sinful people to turn to the repentance and change to the doing of good deeds. He (azwj) has Called His (azwj) servants in the Book to that with a Loud Voice. He (azwj) Never Cut-off nor Prevented the calling of His (azwj) servants. So Allah (azwj) has Cursed the ones who conceal what Allah (azwj) has Revealed, and Obligated upon Himself (azwj), the Mercy to be before the Wrath. So He (azwj) Completed the Truth and the Mercy, so there is no beginning for the servant with the Wrath before he arouses His (azwj) Anger, and that is from the knowledge of certainty and the knowledge of piety. And every community from whom Allah (azwj) has Raised the Knowledge from them (Taken away), the Knowledge of the Book is when they rejected it, and befriended His (azwj) enemies when they made them to be the rulers. And from their rejection of the Book was that they established its letters and distorted its Limits. So they were narrating it but were not acting upon it. And the ignorant ones were pleased with the preservation of the narrations, whereas the scholars became aggrieved at their abandonment of the correct aspects of the narrations. And from their rejection of the Book was that they made such people as rulers who did not know, so they took them (in a direction) of wherever their own desires led them, and released them to the death (ruination). They amended the ties of the Religion, and then they left it as a legacy among the foolish and the childish (people). So the community was issued with the commands devised by the people instead of the Commands of Allah (azwj) Blessed and High, and it is to them that they referred to. So evil it was what the unjust took in exchange, the governance of the people instead of the Governance of Allah (azwj), and took the reward of the people instead of the Reward of Allah (azwj), and the pleasure of the people instead of the Pleasure of Allah (azwj). So this is how the community has become, and among them were those who strived (The Mujtahids) in the worship upon that misguidance. They (the people) were fascinated by them, and admired them, and their worship became a strife (Fitna) for them as well as those who followed them, whereas in the Messengers (as) there was a Reminder for the worshippers. Of these Prophets (as) was a Prophet (as) who was complete in his (as) worship, but then he (as) disobeyed Allah (azwj) Blessed and High in one aspect, so he (as) was exited from the Paradise, and he (as) was thrown into the belly of the whale. Then he (as) was not rescued until he (as) recognised (Al-Wilayah) and repented. So understand that there are similar ones to â€˜Al-Ahbaar and Al-Rahbaanâ€™ who go around concealing the Book, and alter it. So their business did not give them any gain and they were not of the guided ones. Then understand those that are similar to them in this community who establish the letters of the Book and alter its Limits. So they are with the chiefs and the notables, and when they disperse there are guided by the desires and they are with those who have a lot of the world (wealth), and that is what has reached to them from the knowledge. They do not cease to be like that in the copying (emulating) and the greed. The voice of Iblees (la) does not cease to be heard from their tongues with the falsehood, a great deal. The scholars observe patience from them from the harm that they (asws) suffer and their bullying, whereas they themselves blame the scholars for having burdened them. And the scholars in themselves are disloyal for having concealed the advice when they see a lost and strayed one with no guidance to him, or for not having revived a dead one. So evil it is what they do because Allah (azwj) Blessed and High has Taken a Covenant to them in the Book that they would enjoin the doing of good and by what He (azwj) has Ordered for, and forbid them from what He (azwj) has Forbidden them from, and that they would help each other upon the goodness, and the piety, and will not co-operate upon the sins and the animosity. So the scholars are in a struggle in their efforts from the ignorant ones, that if they give good advice, the people would say that they have transgressed. And if they come to know the truth which they had avoided, they would say that they have opposed. And if they quit they would say that they have separated, and they say, â€˜Give us your proof on what you are narratingâ€™, they would say that they have become hypocrites, and if they obey them, they would say that Allah (azwj) Mighty and Majestic has been disobeyed. So the ignorant ones are destroyed in what they do not know, unlettered in what they recite. They ratify the Book when it is defined and deny it in its altered state (Meaning they accept the present altered one and reject the original one which they consider to be the altered one), and so they are not deniers as such. They are similar to Al-Ahbaar and Al-Rahbaan, leaders in matters of desires and chiefs in matters of ruination, and others from among them are seated in between the misguidance and the guidance, not understanding one community from the other. They are saying that the people do not know this, not will they return to what it used to be. And they are right. The Messenger (saww) of Allah (azwj) left them upon the clarity, its night from its day. No innovations appeared among them, nor was the Sunnah changed among them. There was no opposition from them or differences among them. So what made the people to be covered in darkness of their errors (sins) is when two imams appeared, one (asws) calling to Allah (azwj) Blessed and High, and one calling to the Fire. At that time Satan (la) spoke in a loud voice by the tongues of his (la) friends and numerous were his horsemen, and infantry, and he included them in the wealth and the sons, the ones who associated with him (la). So they acted by the innovations, and avoided the Book and the Sunnah, whereas the Guardians (asws) of Allah (azwj) spoke by the Proof and took to the Book and the Wisdom. So from that day on, the people of the truth separated from the people of the falsehood. The people of guidance were abandoned and insulted, whilst the people of the misguidance helped each other until they became a group with so and so, and the like of him. So, understand this type, and the other type and look at them by the eyes of the excellent ones, and be firm with them until you come to your family, for the losers are the one who have lost themselves and their families on the Day of Judgement. Indeed! That is the clear lossâ€™. (Up to here is the report of Al-Husayn, and in the report of Muhammad Bin Yahya this is the extra bit). â€˜They (people of the truth) know the path, if without them (asws) there are afflictions do not hold it against them (asws). If without them (asws) there is tyranny from the tyrannous people, and sinking of the earth and other afflictions, it will soon pass, then you will travel to the prosperity (through them (asws)). Then know that the reliable brothers are an ammunition, some of them for the other. Had it not been that you would leave from me (asws) due to your conjectures, I (asws) would have clarified for you certain things from the truth which I (asws) have kept covered, and would make public certain things from the truth which I (asws) have kept concealed, but I (asws) fear for you, and want you to remain (alive), and it is not for the forbearing person that he would not fear for anyone in the place of the piety, and the forbearance is the robe of the scholar, so do not be without it. â€˜Salamâ€™ (peace be with you)â€™.", "arabicText": "Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù ÙŠÙØ­Ù’ÙŠÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø£ÙØ´Ù’Ø¹ÙØ±ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ­Ù’Ù…ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ²ÙÙŠØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø­ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙØ«ÙÙ‡Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù ÙƒÙØªÙØ¨Ù Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙˆ Ø¬ÙØ¹Ù’ÙÙØ±Ù ( Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… ) Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø³ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø®ÙÙŠÙ’Ø±Ù Ø¨ÙØ³Ù’Ù…Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ­Ù’Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ­ÙÙŠÙ…Ù Ø£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙŠ Ø£ÙÙˆØµÙÙŠÙƒÙ Ø¨ÙØªÙÙ‚Ù’ÙˆÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù ÙÙÙŠÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„ÙØ§Ù…ÙØ©Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙÙ„ÙÙÙ ÙˆÙ Ø§Ù„Ù’ØºÙÙ†ÙÙŠÙ…ÙØ©Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‚ÙÙ„ÙØ¨Ù Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙØ²Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¬ÙÙ„Ù‘Ù ÙŠÙÙ‚ÙÙŠ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙÙ‚Ù’ÙˆÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ø¹ÙØ²ÙØ¨Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ ÙŠÙØ¬Ù’Ù„ÙÙŠ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙÙ‚Ù’ÙˆÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙÙ‚Ù’ÙˆÙÙ‰ Ù†ÙØ¬ÙØ§ Ù†ÙÙˆØ­ÙŒ ÙˆÙ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù…ÙØ¹ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙÙÙŠÙ†ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ ØµÙØ§Ù„ÙØ­ÙŒ ÙˆÙ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù…ÙØ¹ÙÙ‡Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„ØµÙ‘ÙØ§Ø¹ÙÙ‚ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙÙ‚Ù’ÙˆÙÙ‰ ÙÙØ§Ø²Ù Ø§Ù„ØµÙ‘ÙØ§Ø¨ÙØ±ÙÙˆÙ†Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙØ¬ÙØªÙ’ ØªÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙØµÙØ¨Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ‡ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙƒÙ ÙˆÙ Ù„ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ø¥ÙØ®Ù’ÙˆÙØ§Ù†ÙŒ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ ØªÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ø·Ù‘ÙØ±ÙÙŠÙ‚ÙØ©Ù ÙŠÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙÙ…ÙØ³ÙÙˆÙ†Ù ØªÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙ ÙŠÙØ¹Ù’Ù„ÙÙ…ÙÙˆÙ†Ù ÙÙØ£ÙÙˆÙ’Ø±ÙØ¯ÙÙˆÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù‡ÙÙˆÙÙ‰ ÙˆÙ Ø£ÙØµÙ’Ø¯ÙØ±ÙÙˆÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¯ÙÙ‰ ÙˆÙ ØºÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØ±ÙÙˆØ§ Ø¹ÙØ±ÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙØ±Ù‘ÙØ«ÙÙˆÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§Ù„ØµÙ‘ÙØ¨ÙØ§ ÙÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ©Ù ÙŠÙØµÙ’Ø¯ÙØ±ÙÙˆÙ†Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±Ù Ø§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ§Ø³Ù Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ØªÙØ¨ÙØ§Ø±ÙÙƒÙ ÙˆÙ ØªÙØ¹ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙ‰ ÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù ÙŠÙØ±ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙˆÙ†Ù ÙÙØ¨ÙØ¦Ù’Ø³Ù Ù„ÙÙ„Ø¸Ù‘ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙ…ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯ÙÙ„Ù‹Ø§ ÙˆÙÙ„ÙØ§ÙŠÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ§Ø³Ù Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù ÙˆÙÙ„ÙØ§ÙŠÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø«ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¨Ù Ø§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ§Ø³Ù Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø«ÙÙˆÙØ§Ø¨Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø±ÙØ¶ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ§Ø³Ù Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø±ÙØ¶ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙØ£ÙØµÙ’Ø¨ÙØ­ÙØªÙ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ©Ù ÙƒÙØ°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ ÙˆÙ ÙÙÙŠÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ù…ÙØ¬Ù’ØªÙÙ‡ÙØ¯ÙÙˆÙ†Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ¨ÙØ§Ø¯ÙØ©Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ ØªÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ø¶Ù‘ÙÙ„ÙØ§Ù„ÙØ©Ù Ù…ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¬ÙØ¨ÙÙˆÙ†Ù Ù…ÙÙÙ’ØªÙÙˆÙ†ÙÙˆÙ†Ù ÙÙØ¹ÙØ¨ÙØ§Ø¯ÙØªÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙÙØªÙ’Ù†ÙØ©ÙŒ Ù„ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙˆÙ Ù„ÙÙ…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§Ù‚Ù’ØªÙØ¯ÙÙ‰ Ø¨ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ¯Ù’ ÙƒÙØ§Ù†Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ³ÙÙ„Ù Ø§Ù„ÙØ§Ø¹Ù’ØªÙØ±ÙØ§ÙÙ ÙˆÙ Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¨ÙØ©Ù ÙÙØ§Ø¹Ù’Ø±ÙÙÙ’ Ø£ÙØ´Ù’Ø¨ÙØ§Ù‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø£ÙØ­Ù’Ø¨ÙØ§Ø±Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù’Ø¨ÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù‘ÙØ°ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø³ÙØ§Ø±ÙÙˆØ§ Ø¨ÙÙƒÙØªÙ’Ù…ÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’ÙƒÙØªÙØ§Ø¨Ù ÙˆÙ ØªÙØ­Ù’Ø±ÙÙŠÙÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙ…Ø§ Ø±ÙØ¨ÙØ­ÙØªÙ’ ØªÙØ¬Ø§Ø±ÙØªÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙˆÙ Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù†ÙÙˆØ§ Ù…ÙÙ‡Ù’ØªÙØ¯ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ø§Ø¹Ù’Ø±ÙÙÙ’ Ø£ÙØ´Ù’Ø¨ÙØ§Ù‡ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù‡ÙØ°ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù’Ø£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ©Ù Ø§Ù„Ù‘ÙØ°ÙÙŠÙ†Ù
