Then they will unite in another place where they will be made to speak and say: â€œBy Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheists.â€ Therefore, Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, will set a seal upon their mouths, and their hands, feet and skins will be made to speak. So they will witness every sin which they did with these parts. Then the seal from their tongues will be raised so they will say to their skins: Why have you borne witness against us? They shall say: Allah who makes everything speak has made us speak. Then they unite in another place and will be made to speak, but they will escape from one another. This is the meaning of the Word of the Mighty and High: The day on which a man shall fly from his brother, and his mother and his father, and his spouse and his son. Thus, they will seek to speak but no one shall speak except for whom the Beneficent permits and who speaks the right thing. At this point the Messengers, blessings of Allah be upon them, shall rise and bear witness, to the Word of Allah: How will it be, then, when We bring from every people a witness and bring you as a witness against these? Then they will meet in another place, where there shall be the place of Muhammad (sw) and that is the Praised Position [almuqam al-mahmud]. Thus, he (sw) will praise Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, the way no one has praised Him before him. Then he (sw) will praise each and every angel. There shall not remain any angel that he will not have praised. Then he will praise the Messengers (AS) in such way that no one has done so before him. The he (sw) will praise every believing man and believing woman starting with the strictly veracious [siddiqin], the martyrs, and the pious ones [salihin]. Then all the inhabitants of the heavens and the earth will praise him as we see in the Word of Allah: Maybe your Lord will raise you to a praised position. Hence, blessed are those who have any allotment in that Position, and woe unto those who do not have any allotment or share in that Position. Then they will unite in another place, and some of them will vie the upper hand to others. This is all before the Accountability [al-hisab]. Thus, when one is taken to accountability then everyone shall be occupied with what they have before them. We ask Allah for the blessing of that Day. The man responded, â€œYou have comforted me, O Commander of the Faithful. May Allah comfort you! You have solved my problem. May Allah increase your reward!â€ The Imam (AS) then continued, As for the Word of the Mighty and High: â€œFaces on that day shall be bright, looking to their Lord,â€ and His Word: â€œVision comprehends Him not, and He comprehends (ALL) vision;â€ and His Word: â€œand verily he saw him in another descent, at the farthest lotustree;â€ and His Word also: â€œOn that day shall not intercession avail except of him whom the Most Compassionate Allah allows and whose word He is pleased with. He knows what is before them and what is behind them, while they do not comprehend it in knowledge.â€ As for His Word: â€œFaces on that day shall be bright, looking to their Lordâ€ then Verily, that is a place where the Beloved Ones of Allah, the Mighty and High, end up in after they have finished with the accountability to the river which is named al-Hayawan. They will wash in it and drink from it so their faces will be helped to shine. Hence, every floating impurity and difficulty will vanish from them. Then they will be ordered to enter Paradise. From this position they will look at their Lord, how He rewards them and from there they will enter Paradise. That is the Word of the Mighty and High about the salutation of the angels unto them: Peace be on you, you shall be happy; therefore, enter it to abide. At that point, they will be certain of entering Paradise and looking at what their Lord had promised them. Thus, that is the Word of Allah: â€œlooking to their Lord.â€ Verily, what is meant by â€œlooking at Himâ€ here is â€œlooking at the reward of the Blessed and Exalted.â€ As for His Word: â€œVision comprehends Him not, and He comprehends visionâ€ then it is just as He said: â€œvision comprehends Him not,â€ i.e. the imaginations cannot encompass him. â€œHe comprehends visionâ€ i.e. He encompasses vision â€œand He is the Knower of subtleties, the Aware.â€ That is the praise with which our Lord, the Blessed and Exalted, has eulogized and extolled Himself, the Elevated, the High. Musa (AS) asked and the praise of Allah, the Mighty and High, flowed over his tongue: My Lord! Show me (Thyself), so that I may look upon Thee. Thus, his question was a great matter and he had asked for a body matter and, hence, was inflicted. So Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, said: you will not see me in this world until you die, then you will see Me in the Hereafter. However, if you intend to see me in this world then look at the mountain, if it remains firm in its place, then will you see Me; therefore, Allah, glory be Him, expressed some of His signs and our Lord manifested to the mountain, the mountain had crumbled and had become dust and Musa fell down in a swoon; i.e. he had died. Thus, his infliction was the death, and then he was brought back to life by Allah and he recovered, he returned and said: Glory be to Thee, I turn to Thee, and I am the first of the Believers, i.e. the first who believed in You and who never say You. As for His Word: And verily he saw him in another descent, at the farthest lotus-tree; i.e. Muhammad (sw) was at the farthest lotus-tree, as no creation from the creation of Allah crosses that position. And Allahâ€™s Word a the end of the verse: The eye did not turn aside, nor did it exceed the limit, certainly he saw of the greatest signs of his Lord. He (sw) saw Jibraâ€™il (AS) in his true form twice, at this time, and at another time. Jibraâ€™il is enormous. He is one of the holy ones [rawhaniyin] whose creation and description cannot be perceived except by Allah, the Lord of the Universe. As for His Word: On that Day shall no intercession avail except of him whom the Most Compassionate Allah allows and whose word He is pleased with. He knows what is before them and what is behind them, while they do no comprehend it in knowledge. The creations cannot comprehend Allah, the Mighty and High, in knowledge, as He is the Blessed and Exalted. He has placed over the vision of the hearts a veil. Thus, no understanding reaches Him in form. Nor any heat proves Him with limits. Therefore, no one attributes Him except with what He has attributed Himself. There is nothing whatsoever like unto Him and He is the All-Hearing, All-Seeing, the First, the Last, the Manifest, the Hidden, the Creator, the Maker, the Imager. He created all things; none of the things are like Him, the blessed and Exalted. The man said: â€œYou have comforted me. May Allah comfort you! You have solved a problem. May Allah increase your reward, O Commander of the Faithful! The Imam (AS) then added, As for His Word: And it is not for any man that Allah should speak to him save by revelation or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger (angel) and to reveal by His Permission what He wills, and His Word: And to Musa, Allah addressed His Words, speaking (to him), and also His Word: And their Lord called out to them, and His Word: O Adam! Dwell you and your wife in the garden! As for His Word: â€œAnd it is not for any man that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a veilâ€ for verily it is a must for humankind that Allah may only speak to him through revelation and that is not possible except from behind a veil, or by sending an angel to reveal by His permission what He wills. That is what Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, has said, the Elevated and high. The Messenger was revealed unto from the angels of heaven, thus, the angels of heave delivered to the angels of the earth. The speech between the angels of the earth and the Messenger did not happen without their speech with the angels of heaven. Hence, the Messenger of Allah (sw) said: â€œO Jibraâ€™il, have you seen your Lord?â€ He replied, `Verily, my Lord cannot be seen.â€ Consequently, the Messenger of Allah (sw) asked, â€œThen where do you take the revelation from?â€ He answered, â€œI take it from Israfil.â€ He (sw) enquired, â€œAnd where does Israfil take it form?â€ He replied, â€œHe takes it from another angel above him from the divine ones.â€ The Messenger (sw) asked, â€œAnd where does that angel take it from?â€ He explained,â€ It is thrown upon his heart.â€ This is revelation and that is the word of Allah, the Mighty and High, and the word of Allah is not (revealed) in one method; among them is what Allah spoke to the Messengers, among them is what He threw upon their hearts, among them is what the Messengers see in their dreams, among them is inspiration and revelation which is read and delivered. That is the word of Allah. Thus, I will suffice with what I have described for you of Allahâ€™s speech. Verily, the meaning of Allahâ€™s Word is not one. Among them is certainly what the angels of heaven deliver to the angels of the earth. The man said: â€œYou have comforted me. May Allah comfort you! You have solved a problem. May Allah increase your reward, O Commander of the Faithful!â€ The Imam (AS) then added, As for His Word: Do you know anyone else named with the same name? Verily, the interpretation of that is â€œdo you know anyone else with the name Allah, other than Allah, the Blessed and Exalted.â€ Be careful not to explain the Qurâ€™an by your personal views unless you deeply understand it from the learned. For verily, there is revelation many a times resembling the word of man, but it is the word of Allah. So its interpretation does not resemble the word of man, like nothing from His Creation resembles Him. Likewise, none of His Actions, the Blessed and Exalted, resemble the actions of man and his Word does not resemble the word of man. Thus, the Word of Allah, the Blessed and Exalted is His Attribute, and the words of man are their actions. Therefore, do not compare the Word of Allah with the word of man for it you do then you shall perish and go astray. The man responded, â€œYou have comforted me. May Allah comfort you! You have solve a problem. May Allah increase your reward, O Commander of the Faithful!â€ Then the Imam (AS) continued, As for His Word: And there does not lie concealed from your Lord the weight of an atom in the earth or in heaven, that is how our Lord is, nothing lies concealed from Him and how could it, He who created the things would not know what He created, while He is the Creator, the All-Knowing. And as for His Word: nor will he look upon them on the Day of Resurrection, He is informing that He will not bestow upon them good. The Arabs say: â€œBy Allah, so and so does not look upon us.â€ Verily, what they mean by it is that â€œhe does not bestow us good.â€ Thus, that is the â€œlook from Allah, the Exalted, to His Creation here. So His Look upon them is His Mercy for them. And for His Word: Nay! Most surely they shall on that day be veiled from their Lord. Verily, what He means by this is â€œon the Day of Resurrection, they shall be veiled from the reward of their Lord.â€ The man responded, â€œYou have comforted me. May Allah comfort you! You have solved a problem. May Allah increase your reward!â€ The Imam (AS) then said: As for His Word: Are you secure of those in heaven that He should not make the earth to swallow you up? And His Word: And He is Allah in heavens and in the Earth; and His Word: The Most Compassionate Allah is firm on the Empyrean, and also His Word: He is with you wherever you may be, and also His Word: We are nearer to him than his jugular vein. Such is Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, the Most Praised, the Most Holy. Exalted is He from what befalls the creations. He is the Subtle, the All-Informed, and far beyond being compared to His Creation. His Knowledge is firm on the Empyrean. He is the Witness to every whisper. He is the Custodian over Everything, the Creator of Everything, and the Director of Everything. Far Exalted is Allah, Elevated and High, from being on His Empyrean! Thus, the Imam (AS) continued, And as for His Word: And you Lord comes and (also) the angels in ranks, and His Word: Verily, you have come to Us alone as We created you at first, and also His Word: They do not wait aught but that Allah should come to them in the shadows of the clouds along with the angels, and also His Word: They do not wait aught but that the angels should come to them, or that your Lord should come, or that some of the signs of your Lord should come. Verily, this is all truth as Allah, the Mighty and High has said. He does not have a coming like the coming of the creation. I have already taught you that there is something from the Book of Allah, interpretation of which is other than its revelation and it does not resemble the word of man. I will shortly notify you to one of its dimensions and that should suffice you, if Allah willing. From that is the word of Ibrahim (AS): Surely I am going to my Lord; He will guide me. Therefore, his going to His Lord is attention towards Him in service, effort and closeness to Allah, High and Mighty. Do you not see that its interpretation is other than its revelation? He has also said: We sent down the iron, wherein is latent mighty power, i.e. the weapons etc. They do not wait aught but that the angels should come to them, He is informing Muhammad (sw) about the infidels and the hypocrites who did not respond to Allah and the Messenger. So He said: They do not wait aught but that the angels should come to them. As they did not respond to Allah and His Messenger, â€œor that your Lord should come, or that some of the signs of your Lord should come.â€ What He means by this is that the punishment should come to them in this world like He punished the earlier ages. Thus, this is information about them He is giving to the Prophet (sw). Then He says: On the day when some of the signs of your Lord shall come, its faith shall not profit a soul which did not believe before, or earn good through its faith. That is, before this sing comes, this sign is rising of the sun from the west; Verily, it would suffice the ones with intellect, brain and understanding to know that if he removes the veil they will see what they have been promised. He has said in another verse: But Allah came to them whence they did not expect, i.e. He sent unto them a punishment. And like is His Coming to their building as Allah, the Mighty and High, has said: Then Allah came (and demolished) their building from the foundations. Thus, His coming to their buildings from their foundations means sending the punishment over them. Similar is what He has described for the affair of the Hereafter, Blessed and Exalted be His Name, Elevated High. Verily, He will set running His affairs in that Day, which is fifty thousand years long, like He set running His affairs in this world. He does not disappear, nor does He pass with the transitory. Thus, I will suffice with what I have described for you from that which is wandering in your mind of what Allah, the Mighty and High has described in His Book. Do not make His Words like the word of humankind. He is Greater, Mightier, More Generous and Higher, Blessed and Exalted from that which the attributers may attribute. Except with what He attributes Himself in His Word, the Mighty and High: There is nothing whatsoever like unto Him and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. The man said: â€œYou have comforted me, O Commander of the Faithful! May Allah comfort you! You have soled a problem. May Allah increase your reward! The Imam (AS) then said: As for His Word: Nay! They are unbelievers in the meeting of their Lord, and when He mentioned the Believer: Who know that they shall meet their Lord, and His Word for other than the Believers: Till the day when they shall meet Him because they failed to perform towards Allah what they had promised with Him, and also His Word: Therefore, whoever hopes to meet his Lord, he should do good deeds. As for His Word: Nay! They are unbelievers in the meeting of their Lord, i.e. the raising from death [al-ba`th] so Allah, the Mighty and High, has named it His Meeting. Likewise, He has mentioned the Believers: Who know that they shall meet their Lord, i.e. they are certain that they will be raised, gathered, accounted and paid with the reward or punishment. Therefore, the word zann (strong belief) in this context specifically is â€œcertainty.â€ Like is His Word: Therefore, whoever hopes to meet his Lord, he should do good deeds. And His Word: Whoever hopes to meet Allah, then meeting Him is forthcoming, i.e. whoever believes that he will be raised from death, then verily Allahâ€™s promise about the reward and punishment is forthcoming. Hence, here â€œthe meetingâ€ is not â€œthe viewing.â€ In fact, it is the raising from death. So understand this that verily all of â€œHis Meetingâ€ in the Book of Allah is meant to be â€œthe raising from death.â€ And similar is His Word: their greetings on the Day when they meet Him shall be: â€œPeace,â€ i.e. that â€œthe faith will not decline from their hearts the Day when they are raised again.â€ The man said: â€œYou have comforted me, O Commander of the Faithful! May Allah comfort you! You have solved a problem. May Allah increase your reward!â€ At that time the Imam (AS) said: As for His Word: And the guilty shall see the fire, then they shall think that they are going to fall into it, i.e. they will be certain that they are going to enter it. Similar is His Word: Surely I knew that I shall meet my account, He is saying that I am certain that I will be raised and then accounted for. Similar is His Word: On that Day Allah will pay back to them in full their just reward, and they shall know that Allah is the Evident Truth. And as for His Word about the hypocrites: â€œYou began to think diverse thought of Allah,â€ then this zann is doubt and not certainty. Zann is of two types: doubt and surety. Therefore, that which is a matter of the Hereafter, then that is â€œthe certaintyâ€ and that which is of a worldly matter is â€œthe doubt.â€ Pay attention to what I have explained for you. The man said: â€œYou have comfort me, O Commander of the Faithful! May Allah comfort you!â€ The Imam (AS) explained, And so for His Word, the Blessed and Exalted: And We will set up a just balance on the Day of Resurrection, so no soul shall be dealt with unjustly in the least; that is the balance of justice, all the creations will be taken to it on the Day of Judgment. Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, will grant credit to some of the creation from others with the balances. The compiler of this book says: In another tradition â€œthe balanceâ€ stands for the Prophets and their Successors (sw) (this one sentence is by the Compiler. The passages after it are the continuation of the tradition.) And as for His Word, the Mighty and High: Therefore, We will not set up a balance for them on the Day of Resurrection, verily this is specifically. And as for His Word: These shall enter the garden, in which they shall be given sustenance without measure. Verily, the Messenger of Allah (sw) has said: Allah, the Mighty and High, says: â€œThose who observe Me and love one another for My Glory, deserve My love,â€ or he said, â€œMy honor. Verily, on the Day of Judgment their faces will be of the light on the pulpits of light, over which shall be green cloths.â€ It was asked; â€œWho are they, O Messenger of Allah?â€ He replied: â€œA group of people who are neither Prophets, not martyrs, but they are ones who loved one another for the Glory of Allah. They will enter Paradise without any accountability.â€ We ask Allah, the Mighty and High, to make us of them for His Mercy. As for His Word: then as for him whose measure (of good deeds) is heavyâ€¦and as for him, whose measure (of good deeds) is light, i.e. verily, it means the accountability. The good deeds and the bad deeds will be weighed. The good deeds cause the balance to be weighty and the bad deeds cause the balance to be light. Then the Imam (AS) continued, As for His Word: Say: The Angels of Death who is given charges of you takes your souls, then to your Lord you shall be brought back, and His Word: Allah takes the souls at the time of their death, and also His Word: Our messengers (angels) take his soul away, and they are not remiss, and also His Word: Those whom the angels take away their souls while they are unjust to themselves. And His Word: â€œthose whom the angels take away their souls in a good state, that Peace be on you.â€ Verily, Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, directs all affairs as He wills and He assigns from His Creation whoever He wills and whatever He Wills. As for the Angels of Death, verily, Allah assigns him specifically whoever He will from His Creation and he assigns His Messengers from the angels specifically with whoever He wills of His Creation. The angels which Allah, Mighty be His remembrance, has named and assigned them specifically for whoever He wills from His Creation. Verily, He, the Blessed and Exalted, directs the affairs however He pleases. Not all knowledge makes capable a learned person of explaining to all the people, because there are strong and weak (in understanding) among them. Also, because of them are those who have the strength to bear it and of them are ones who cannot bear it, except for whoever Allah eases the bearing and helps him over it from His beloved ones specifically. Verily, it suffices you to know that Allah is the Reviver and the One who makes to dies. And verily He it is that takes the souls away through whoever He wills of His Creation from the His angels and other than angels. The man said: â€œYou have comforted me, O Commander of the Faithful! May Allah comfort you! And may Allah benefit all the Muslims by you!â€ `Ali (AS) said to the man, â€œIf Allah has expanded your chest for you with what I have explained for you then you are, by the Splitter of Grain Seed and the Maker of Humanity, from the true Believers.â€ The man asked, â€œO Commander of Faithful, how is it possible for me to find out that I am of the true Believers?â€ He (AS) replied: No one knows that except for he who Allah has taught him with the tongue of His Prophet (sw), and the Messenger of Allah (sw) has bore witness for him with Paradise. Or he who Allah has expanded his chest to know what is in the Books which Allah, the Mighty and High, has revealed over His Messengers and Prophets. The man enquired, â€œO Commander of the Faithful, who has the strength for that?â€ He (AS) explained, â€œWhoever Allah expands his chest and directs him to Himself. It is up to you to serve Allah openly and secretly, for nothing equals worship.â€ The Compiler of this book says: The proof that the Producer is One and not more than that is that if there were two then the matter is not free from being one of the two; that each one of them is All-Powerful over prohibiting his associate form whatever He intends, or that they are not All-Powerful. If it is so then it is possible for both of them to be prevented, and whatever can be prevented has been brought into being. If they are not All-Powerful, they are incapable and deficient, and only things with beginnings can be as such. Therefore, it is correct that he One without Beginning One. The second proof is that each one of them is not powerful enough to hide from the other. Hence, if it is so, the one from whom one can hide, has a beginning. If he is not All-Powerful then he is incapable, and anything which is incapable has beginning as we have already explained earlier. This statement can be used to nullify the concept of two eternal beings. What Mani and Ibn Daysan have professed is nothing but their own superstition. The same nonsense which the Zoroastrians [majus] have professed regarding the Devil [Ahriman] is equally invalid according to this argument. This argument also applies to them. Thus, I have shortened my statement about both of them and did not individually deal with what they asked him (AS).", "arabicText": "5 - Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø·Ø§Ù† Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† ÙŠØ­ÙŠÙ‰ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø¨ÙƒØ± Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ù† Ø­Ø¨ÙŠØ¨ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† ÙŠØ¹Ù‚ÙˆØ¨ Ø¨Ù† Ù…Ø·Ø± (Ù¡) Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù† Ø§Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø²ÙŠØ² Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø­Ø¯Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø¯ Ø¨Ù†ÙŠØ³Ø§Ø¨ÙˆØ±ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ¬Ø¯Øª ÙÙŠ ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ Ø¨Ø®Ø·Ù‡: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø·Ù„Ø­Ø© Ø¨Ù† ÙŠØ²ÙŠØ¯ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø¹Ø¨ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ø¨ÙŠØ¯ (Ù¢) Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ Ù…Ø¹Ù…Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø¹Ø¯Ø§Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ù† Ø±Ø¬Ù„Ø§ Ø£ØªÙ‰ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ Ø·Ø§Ù„Ø¨ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† Ø¥Ù†ÙŠ Ù‚Ø¯ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠ ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø²Ù„ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: Ø«ÙƒÙ„ØªÙƒ Ø£Ù…Ùƒ ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠ ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø²Ù„ØŸ! Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù„Ø£Ù†ÙŠ ÙˆØ¬Ø¯Øª Ø§Ù„ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ ÙŠÙƒØ°Ø¨ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ø§ ÙÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ‡. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ Ø·Ø§Ù„Ø¨ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: Ø¥Ù† ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù„ÙŠØµØ¯Ù‚ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ø§ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠÙƒØ°Ø¨ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ†Ùƒ Ù„Ù… ØªØ±Ø²Ù‚ Ø¹Ù‚Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ†ØªÙØ¹ Ø¨Ù‡ØŒ ÙÙ‡Ø§Øª Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù† ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¬Ù„: Ø¥Ù†ÙŠ ÙˆØ¬Ø¯Øª Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙØ§Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ù†Ù†Ø³ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ù†Ø³ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ù‡Ù… Ù‡Ø°Ø§ï´¾ (Ù£) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø£ÙŠØ¶Ø§: ï´¿Ù†Ø³ÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙ†Ø³ÙŠÙ‡Ù…ï´¾ (Ù¤) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ù†Ø³ÙŠØ§ï´¾ (Ù¥) ÙÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù†Ù‡ ÙŠÙ†Ø³Ù‰ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø³Ù‰ØŒ ÙØ£Ù†ÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ†. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ø£ÙŠØ¶Ø§ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: (ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø±ÙˆØ­ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© ØµÙØ§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØªÙƒÙ„Ù…ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø°Ù† Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ ØµÙˆØ§Ø¨Ø§) (Ù¦) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ ÙˆØ§Ø³ØªÙ†Ø·Ù‚ÙˆØ§ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ§ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø§ ÙƒÙ†Ø§ Ù…Ø´Ø±ÙƒÙŠÙ†. (Ù§) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠÙ…Ø© ÙŠÙƒÙØ± Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ÙƒÙ… Ø¨Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ ÙˆÙŠÙ„Ø¹Ù† Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ÙƒÙ… Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ø§ï´¾ (Ù¨) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿Ø¥Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù„Ø­Ù‚ ØªØ®Ø§ØµÙ… Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø±ï´¾ (Ù©) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿Ù„Ø§ ØªØ®ØªØµÙ…ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ø¯ÙŠ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ù‚Ø¯Ù…Øª Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙƒÙ… Ø¨Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ¹ÙŠØ¯ï´¾ ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: (Ù†Ø®ØªÙ… Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£ÙÙˆØ§Ù‡Ù‡Ù… ÙˆØªÙƒÙ„Ù…Ù†Ø§ Ø£ÙŠØ¯ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙˆØªØ´Ù‡Ø¯ Ø£Ø±Ø¬Ù„Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù†ÙˆØ§ ÙŠÙƒØ³Ø¨ÙˆÙ†) (Ù¡) ÙÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙŠØªÙƒÙ„Ù…ÙˆÙ† ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØªÙƒÙ„Ù…ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø°Ù† Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ ØµÙˆØ§Ø¨Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø·Ù‚ÙˆÙ† ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø¹Ù† Ù…Ù‚Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‡Ù… (ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø§ ÙƒÙ†Ø§ Ù…Ø´Ø±ÙƒÙŠÙ†) ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙŠØ®ØªØµÙ…ÙˆÙ†ØŒ ÙØ£Ù†ÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª ÙˆÙŠØ­Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙˆØ¬ÙˆÙ‡ ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ù†Ø§Ø¶Ø±Ø© * Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ Ù†Ø§Ø¸Ø±Ø©ï´¾ ï´¿Ù¢) ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: Ù„Ø§ ØªØ¯Ø±ÙƒÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ ÙŠØ¯Ø±Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ø·ÙŠÙ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø¨ÙŠØ±ï´¾ (Ù£) ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ„Ù‚Ø¯ Ø±Ø¢Ù‡ Ù†Ø²Ù„Ø© Ø£Ø®Ø±Ù‰ * Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ Ø³Ø¯Ø±Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†ØªÙ‡Ù‰ï´¾ (Ù¤) ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ†ÙØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ø´ÙØ§Ø¹Ø© Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø°Ù† Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† ÙˆØ±Ø¶ÙŠ Ù„Ù‡ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ø§ * ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ù…Ø§ Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ø£ÙŠØ¯ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø®Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù… ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ­ÙŠØ·ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§ï´¾ (Ù¥) ÙˆÙ…Ù† Ø£Ø¯Ø±ÙƒÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± ÙÙ‚Ø¯ Ø£Ø­Ø§Ø· Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù…ØŒ ÙØ£Ù†ÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª Ø£ÙŠØ¶Ø§ ÙˆÙŠØ­Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø± Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙ„Ù…Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ ÙˆØ­ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ùˆ Ù…Ù† ÙˆØ±Ø§Ø¡ Ø­Ø¬Ø§Ø¨ Ø£Ùˆ ÙŠØ±Ø³Ù„ Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙÙŠÙˆØ­ÙŠ Ø¨Ø¥Ø°Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ï´¾ (Ù¦) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙˆÙƒÙ„Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù…ÙˆØ³Ù‰ ØªÙƒÙ„ÙŠÙ…Ø§ï´¾ (Ù§) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ†Ø§Ø¯Ø§Ù‡Ù…Ø§ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù…Ø§ï´¾ (Ù¨) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙŠØ§ Ø£ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¨ÙŠ Ù‚Ù„ Ù„Ø£Ø²ÙˆØ§Ø¬Ùƒ ÙˆØ¨Ù†Ø§ØªÙƒï´¾ (Ù©) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: (ï´¿ÙŠØ§ Ø£ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø¨Ù„Øº Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ù†Ø²Ù„ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙƒ Ù…Ù† Ø±Ø¨Ùƒï´¾ (Ù¡Ù ) ÙØ£Ù†ÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª ÙˆÙŠØ­Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¬Ù„ Ø«Ù†Ø§Ø¤ï¿½ï¿½ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿Ù‡Ù„ ØªØ¹Ù„Ù… Ù„Ù‡ Ø³Ù…ÙŠØ§ï´¾ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ ÙŠØ³Ù…ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ù†Ø³Ø§Ù† Ø³Ù…ÙŠØ¹Ø§ Ø¨ØµÙŠØ±Ø§ ÙˆÙ…Ù„ÙƒØ§ ÙˆØ±Ø¨Ø§ØŒ ÙÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø¨Ø£Ù† Ù„Ù‡ Ø£Ø³Ø§Ù…ÙŠ ÙƒØ«ÙŠØ±Ø© Ù…Ø´ØªØ±ÙƒØ©ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: (Ù‡Ù„ ØªØ¹Ù„Ù… Ù„Ù‡ Ø³Ù…ÙŠØ§) ÙØ£Ù†ÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª ÙˆÙŠØ­Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ¬Ø¯Øª Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ…Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ø²Ø¨ Ø¹Ù† Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø«Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø°Ø±Ø© ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ï´¾ (Ù¡). ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø± Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠÙ…Ø© ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ²ÙƒÙŠÙ‡Ù…ï´¾ (Ù¢). ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙƒÙ„Ø§ Ø¥Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø¹Ù† Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ù„Ù…Ø­Ø¬ÙˆØ¨ÙˆÙ†ï´¾ (Ù£). ÙƒÙŠÙ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø± Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ­Ø¬Ø¨ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡Ù… (Ù¤) ÙˆØ£Ù†Ù‰ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª Ø£ÙŠØ¶Ø§ ÙˆÙŠØ­Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿Ø£Ø£Ù…Ù†ØªÙ… Ù…Ù† ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ®Ø³Ù Ø¨ÙƒÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ ÙØ¥Ø°Ø§ Ù‡ÙŠ ØªÙ…ÙˆØ±ï´¾ (Ù¥) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø±Ø´ Ø§Ø³ØªÙˆÙ‰ï´¾ (Ù¦) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§ÙˆØ§Øª ÙˆÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ø³Ø±ÙƒÙ… ÙˆØ¬Ù‡Ø±ÙƒÙ…ï´¾ (Ù§) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¸Ø§Ù‡Ø± ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¨Ø§Ø·Ù†)ï´¾ (Ù¨) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ù…Ø¹ÙƒÙ… Ø£ÙŠÙ† Ù…Ø§ ÙƒÙ†ØªÙ…ï´¾ (Ù©) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ†Ø­Ù† Ø£Ù‚Ø±Ø¨ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù† Ø­Ø¨Ù„ Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ±ÙŠØ¯ï´¾ (Ù¡Ù ) ÙØ£Ù†Ù‰ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ù‡Ø§Øª Ø£ÙŠØ¶Ø§ ÙˆÙŠØ­Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¬Ù„ Ø«Ù†Ø§Ø¤Ù‡ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙˆØ¬Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ùƒ ØµÙØ§ ØµÙØ§ï´¾ (Ù¡Ù¡) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ„Ù‚Ø¯ Ø¬Ø¦ØªÙ…ÙˆÙ†Ø§ ÙØ±Ø§Ø¯Ù‰ ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù†Ø§ ÙƒÙ… Ø£ÙˆÙ„ Ù…Ø±Ø©ï´¾ (Ù¡Ù¢) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿Ù‡Ù„ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø¸Ù„Ù„ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„ØºÙ…Ø§Ù… ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ©ï´¾ ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ù„ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ù† ØªØ£ØªÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø£Ùˆ ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠ Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø¢ÙŠØ§Øª Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø¢ÙŠØ§Øª Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†ÙØ¹ Ù†ÙØ³Ø§ Ø¥ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†Ù‡Ø§ Ù„Ù… ØªÙƒÙ† Ø¢Ù…Ù†Øª Ù…Ù† Ù‚Ø¨Ù„ Ø£Ùˆ ÙƒØ³Ø¨Øª ÙÙŠ Ø¥ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†Ù‡Ø§ Ø®ÙŠØ±Ø§) (Ù¡) ÙÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ÙŠÙˆÙ… (ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠ Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ) ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ (ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø¢ÙŠØ§Øª Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ) ÙØ£Ù†Ù‰ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª ÙˆÙŠØ­Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¬Ù„ Ø¬Ù„Ø§Ù„Ù‡ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿Ø¨Ù„ Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… ÙƒØ§ÙØ±ÙˆÙ†ï´¾ (Ù¢) ÙˆØ°ÙƒØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† ÙŠØ¸Ù†ÙˆÙ† Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù„Ø§Ù‚ÙˆØ§ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… Ùˆ Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø±Ø§Ø¬Ø¹ÙˆÙ†ï´¾ (Ù£) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ØªØ­ÙŠØªÙ‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠÙ„Ù‚ÙˆÙ†Ù‡ Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…ï´¾ (Ù¤) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿Ù…Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† ÙŠØ±Ø¬ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙØ¥Ù† Ø£Ø¬Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù„Ø¢Øªï´¾ (Ù¥) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙÙ…Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† ÙŠØ±Ø¬ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡ ÙÙ„ÙŠØ¹Ù…Ù„ Ø¹Ù…Ù„Ø§ ØµØ§Ù„Ø­Ø§ï´¾ (Ù¦) ÙÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙŠÙ„Ù‚ÙˆÙ†Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ØªØ¯Ø±ÙƒÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ ÙŠØ¯Ø±Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø±ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: (ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ­ÙŠØ·ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø¹ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§) ÙØ£Ù†Ù‰ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª ÙˆÙŠØ­Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙˆØ±Ø£Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¬Ø±Ù…ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø± ÙØ¸Ù†ÙˆØ§ Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ù…ÙˆØ§Ù‚Ø¹ÙˆÙ‡Ø§ï´¾ (Ù§). ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° ÙŠÙˆÙÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¯ÙŠÙ†Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ ÙˆÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù…ÙˆÙ† Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¨ÙŠÙ†ï´¾ (Ù¨) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙˆØªØ¸Ù†ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø¸Ù†ÙˆÙ†Ø§ï´¾ (Ù©) ÙÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙŠØ¸Ù†ÙˆÙ† ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù…ÙˆÙ†ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¸Ù† Ø´Ùƒ ÙØ£Ù†Ù‰ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙˆÙ†Ø¶Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø²ÙŠÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø³Ø· Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠÙ…Ø© ÙÙ„Ø§ ØªØ¸Ù„Ù… Ù†ÙØ³ Ø´ÙŠØ¦Ø§ï´¾ (Ù¡Ù ) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ÙÙ„Ø§ Ù†Ù‚ÙŠÙ… Ù„Ù‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠÙ…Ø© ÙˆØ²Ù†Ø§ï´¾ ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: (ÙØ£ÙˆÙ„Ø¦Ùƒ ÙŠØ¯Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø© ÙŠØ±Ø²Ù‚ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø¨ØºÙŠØ± Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: (ÙˆØ§Ù„ÙˆØ²Ù† ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ ÙÙ…Ù† Ø«Ù‚Ù„Øª Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø²ÙŠÙ†Ù‡ ÙØ£ÙˆÙ„Ø¦Ùƒ Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙÙ„Ø­ÙˆÙ† * ÙˆÙ…Ù† Ø®ÙØª Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø²ÙŠÙ†Ù‡ ÙØ£ÙˆÙ„Ø¦Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† Ø®Ø³Ø±ÙˆØ§ Ø£Ù†ÙØ³Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù†ÙˆØ§ Ø¨Ø¢ÙŠØ§ØªÙ†Ø§ ÙŠØ¸Ù„Ù…ÙˆÙ†) (Ù¡) ÙØ£Ù†Ù‰ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø§Øª ÙˆÙŠØ­Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿Ù‚Ù„ ÙŠØªÙˆÙØ§ÙƒÙ… Ù…Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØª Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ ÙˆÙƒÙ„ Ø¨ÙƒÙ… Ø«Ù… Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨ÙƒÙ… ØªØ±Ø¬Ø¹ÙˆÙ†ï´¾ (Ù¢) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙŠØªÙˆÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù†ÙØ³ Ø­ÙŠÙ† Ù…ÙˆØªÙ‡Ø§ï´¾ (Ù£) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿ØªÙˆÙØªÙ‡ Ø±Ø³Ù„Ù†Ø§ ÙˆÙ‡Ù… Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙØ±Ø·ÙˆÙ†ï´¾ (Ù¤) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† ØªØªÙˆÙØ§Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø·ÙŠØ¨ÙŠÙ†ï´¾ (Ù¥) ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ï´¿Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† ØªØªÙˆÙØ§Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø¸Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙŠ Ø£Ù†ÙØ³Ù‡Ù…ï´¾ ÙØ£Ù†Ù‰ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ ØªØ³Ù…Ø¹ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ù‡Ù„ÙƒØª Ø¥Ù† Ù„Ù… ØªØ±Ø­Ù…Ù†ÙŠ ÙˆØªØ´Ø±Ø­ Ù„ÙŠ ØµØ¯Ø±ÙŠ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ Ø¹Ø³Ù‰ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ¬Ø±ÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠØ¯ÙŠÙƒØŒ ÙØ¥Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¨ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø­Ù‚Ø§ ÙˆØ§Ù„ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ Ø­Ù‚Ø§ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø­Ù‚Ø§ ÙÙ‚Ø¯ Ù‡Ù„ÙƒØª ÙˆØ®Ø³Ø±ØªØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ù† ØªÙƒÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø¨Ø§Ø·Ù„Ø§ ÙÙ…Ø§ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ø£Ø³ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ù†Ø¬ÙˆØª. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: Ù‚Ø¯ÙˆØ³ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ù‚Ø¯ÙˆØ³ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ¨ÙŠØ±Ø§ØŒ Ù†Ø´Ù‡Ø¯ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ø§Ø¦Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ²ÙˆÙ„ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ù†Ø´Ùƒ ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ³ ÙƒÙ…Ø«Ù„Ù‡ Ø´Ø¦ ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ø¨ØµÙŠØ±ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù† Ø§Ù„ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ Ø­Ù‚ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø­Ù‚ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø«ÙˆØ§Ø¨ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ù‚Ø§Ø¨ Ø­Ù‚ØŒ ÙØ¥Ù† Ø±Ø²Ù‚Øª Ø²ÙŠØ§Ø¯Ø© Ø¥ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù† Ø£Ùˆ Ø­Ø±Ù…ØªÙ‡ ÙØ¥Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø¨ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ Ø¥Ù† Ø´Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø²Ù‚Ùƒ ÙˆØ¥Ù† Ø´Ø§Ø¡ Ø­Ø±Ù…Ùƒ Ø°Ù„ÙƒØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ† Ø³Ø£Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ Ø´ÙƒÙƒØª ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆØ© Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙØ¥Ù† Ø£Ø±Ø§Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ùƒ Ø®ÙŠØ±Ø§ Ø£Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ùƒ Ø¨Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ Ùˆ Ø«Ø¨ØªÙƒØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙ† Ø´Ø±Ø§ Ø¶Ù„Ù„Øª ÙˆÙ‡Ù„ÙƒØª. Ø£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù†Ø³ÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙ†Ø³ÙŠÙ‡Ù…) Ø¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ù†Ø³ÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø¯Ø§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ØŒ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§ Ø¨Ø·Ø§Ø¹ØªÙ‡ ÙÙ†Ø³ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ø®Ø±Ø© Ø£ÙŠ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ¬Ø¹Ù„ Ù„Ù‡Ù… ÙÙŠ Ø«ÙˆØ§Ø¨Ù‡ Ø´ÙŠØ¦Ø§ ÙØµØ§Ø±ÙˆØ§ Ù…Ù†Ø³Ø³ÙŠÙŠÙ† Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø®ÙŠØ± ÙˆÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ ØªÙØ³ÙŠØ± Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: (ÙØ§Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ù†Ù†Ø³ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ù†Ø³ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ù‡Ù… Ù‡Ø°Ø§) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø³ÙŠØ§Ù† Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ«Ø¨Ù‡Ù… ÙƒÙ…Ø§ ÙŠØ«ÙŠØ¨ Ø£ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ§Ø¡Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† ÙƒØ§Ù†ÙˆØ§ ÙÙŠ Ø¯Ø§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ Ù…Ø·ÙŠØ¹ÙŠÙ† Ø°Ø§ÙƒØ±ÙŠÙ† Ø­ÙŠÙ† Ø¢Ù…Ù†ÙˆØ§ Ø¨Ù‡ ÙˆØ¨Ø±Ø³Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ®Ø§ÙÙˆÙ‡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙ…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ù†Ø³ÙŠØ§) ÙØ¥Ù† Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ¨ÙŠØ±Ø§ Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ ÙŠÙ†Ø³Ù‰ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØºÙÙ„ Ø¨Ù„ Ù‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙÙŠØ¸ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ…ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø±Ø¨ ÙÙŠ Ø¨Ø§Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø³ÙŠØ§Ù†: Ù‚Ø¯ Ù†Ø³ÙŠÙ†Ø§ ÙÙ„Ø§Ù† ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ°ÙƒØ±Ù†Ø§ Ø£ÙŠ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ£Ù…Ø± Ù„Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø®ÙŠØ± ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ°ÙƒØ±Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ù‡ØŒ ÙÙ‡Ù„ ÙÙ‡Ù…Øª Ù…Ø§ Ø°ÙƒØ± Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù†Ø¹Ù…ØŒ ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ùƒ ÙˆØ­Ù„Ù„Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù‚Ø¯Ø© ÙØ¹Ø¸Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø£Ø¬Ø±Ùƒ. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø±ÙˆØ­ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© ØµÙØ§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØªÙƒÙ„Ù…ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø°Ù† Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ ØµÙˆØ§Ø¨Ø§) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø§ ÙƒÙ†Ø§ Ù…Ø´Ø±ÙƒÙŠÙ†) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠÙ…Ø© ÙŠÙƒÙØ± Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ÙƒÙ… Ø¨Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ ÙˆÙŠÙ„Ø¹Ù† Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ÙƒÙ… Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ø§) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø¥Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù„Ø­Ù‚ ØªØ®Ø§ØµÙ… Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø±) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù„Ø§ ØªØ®ØªØµÙ…ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ø¯ÙŠ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ù‚Ø¯Ù…Øª Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙƒÙ… Ø¨Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ¹ÙŠØ¯) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ù†Ø®ØªÙ… Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£ÙÙˆØ§Ù‡Ù‡Ù… ÙˆØªÙƒÙ„Ù…Ù†Ø§ Ø£ÙŠØ¯ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙˆØªØ´Ù‡Ø¯ Ø£Ø±Ø¬Ù„Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù†ÙˆØ§ ÙŠÙƒØ³Ø¨ÙˆÙ†) ÙØ¥Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø·Ù† ØºÙŠØ± ÙˆØ§Ø­Ø¯ Ù…Ù† Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø·Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù…Ù‚Ø¯Ø§Ø±Ù‡ Ø®Ù…Ø³ÙŠÙ† Ø£Ù„Ù Ø³Ù†Ø©ØŒ ÙŠØ¬Ù…Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ø§Ø¦Ù‚ ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø·Ù† ÙŠØªÙØ±Ù‚ÙˆÙ†ØŒ ÙˆÙŠÙƒÙ„Ù… Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ø§ ÙˆÙŠØ³ØªØºÙØ± Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ù… Ù„Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø£ÙˆÙ„Ø¦Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø·Ø§Ø¹Ø© ÙÙŠ Ø¯Ø§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ Ù„Ù„Ø±Ø¤Ø³Ø§Ø¡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§ØªØ¨Ø§Ø¹ (Ù¡) ÙˆÙŠÙ„Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¹Ø§ØµÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† Ø¨Ø¯Øª Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¨ØºØ¶Ø§Ø¡ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§ÙˆÙ†ÙˆØ§ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¸Ù„Ù… ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ø¯ÙˆØ§Ù† ÙÙŠ Ø¯Ø§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³ØªÙƒØ¨Ø±ÙŠÙ† ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ø³ØªØ¶Ø¹ÙÙŠÙ† ÙŠÙƒÙØ± Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ ÙˆÙŠÙ„Ø¹Ù† Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ø§ (Ù¢) ÙˆØ§Ù„ÙƒÙØ± ÙÙŠ Ù‡Ø°Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø¢ÙŠØ© Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ø¡Ø©ØŒ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ÙŠØ¨Ø±Ø¡ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ØŒ ÙˆÙ†Ø¸ÙŠØ±Ù‡Ø§ ÙÙŠ Ø³ÙˆØ±Ø© Ø¥Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù‡ÙŠÙ… Ù‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø´ÙŠØ·Ø§Ù† (Ø¥Ù†ÙŠ ÙƒÙØ±Øª Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ø´Ø±ÙƒØªÙ…ÙˆÙ† Ù…Ù† Ù‚Ø¨Ù„) (Ù£) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø¥Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù‡ÙŠÙ… Ø®Ù„ÙŠÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù†: ï´¿ÙƒÙØ±Ù†Ø§ Ø¨ÙƒÙ…ï´¾ ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ ØªØ¨Ø±Ø£Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ù†ÙƒÙ…ØŒ Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ¬ØªÙ…Ø¹ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙˆØ·Ù† Ø¢Ø®Ø± ÙŠØ¨ÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡ ÙÙ„Ùˆ Ø£Ù† ØªÙ„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø£ØµÙˆØ§Øª Ø¨Ø¯Øª Ù„Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ Ù„Ø£Ø°Ù‡Ù„Øª Ø¬Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø¹Ù† Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ø¦Ø´Ù‡Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ØªØµØ¯Ø¹Øª Ù‚Ù„ÙˆØ¨Ù‡Ù… Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ø§ Ø´Ø§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ²Ø§Ù„ÙˆÙ† ÙŠØ¨ÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù…ØŒ Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ¬ØªÙ…Ø¹ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙˆØ·Ù† Ø¢Ø®Ø± ÙÙŠØ³ØªÙ†Ø·Ù‚ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡ ÙÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ÙˆÙ†: (ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø§ ÙƒÙ†Ø§ Ù…Ø´Ø±ÙƒÙŠÙ†) ÙÙŠØ®ØªÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£ÙÙˆØ§Ù‡Ù‡Ù… Ùˆ ÙŠØ³ØªÙ†Ø·Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙŠØ¯ÙŠ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¬Ù„ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¬Ù„ÙˆØ¯ ÙØªØ´Ù‡Ø¯ Ø¨ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ø¹ØµÙŠØ© ÙƒØ§Ù†Øª Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù…ØŒ Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ±ÙØ¹ Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ù„Ø³Ù†ØªÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø®ØªÙ… ÙÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ÙˆÙ† Ù„Ø¬Ù„ÙˆØ¯Ù‡Ù…: ï´¿Ù„Ù… Ø´Ù‡Ø¯ØªÙ… Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ†Ø§ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ§ Ø£Ù†Ø·Ù‚Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ø£Ù†Ø·Ù‚ ÙƒÙ„ Ø´Ø¦ï´¾ (Ù¡) Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ¬ØªÙ…Ø¹ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙˆØ·Ù† Ø¢Ø®Ø± ÙÙŠØ³ØªÙ†Ø·Ù‚ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙØ± Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ØŒ ÙØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: ï´¿ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠÙØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø±Ø¡ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø®ÙŠÙ‡ * ÙˆØ£Ù…Ù‡ ÙˆØ£Ø¨ÙŠÙ‡ * ÙˆØµØ§Ø­Ø¨ØªÙ‡ ÙˆØ¨Ù†ÙŠÙ‡ï´¾ (Ù¢) ÙÙŠØ³ØªÙ†Ø·Ù‚ÙˆÙ† ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØªÙƒÙ„Ù…ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù† Ø£Ø°Ù† Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ ØµÙˆØ§Ø¨Ø§ØŒ ÙÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ù„ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙÙŠØ´Ù‡Ø¯ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠ Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ·Ù† ÙØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ ï´¿ÙÙƒÙŠÙ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ Ø¬Ø¦Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ù† ÙƒÙ„ Ø£Ù…Ø© Ø¨Ø´Ù‡ÙŠØ¯ ÙˆØ¬Ø¦Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ùƒ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù‡Ø¤Ù„Ø§Ø¡ Ø´Ù‡ÙŠØ¯Ø§ï´¾ (Ù£) Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ¬ØªÙ…Ø¹ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙˆØ·Ù† Ø¢Ø®Ø± ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù‚Ø§Ù… Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù… ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‚Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­Ù…ÙˆØ¯ØŒ ÙÙŠØ«Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ«Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø£Ø­Ø¯ Ù‚Ø¨Ù„Ù‡ Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ«Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© ÙƒÙ„Ù‡Ù… ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ¨Ù‚Ù‰ Ù…Ù„Ùƒ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ø«Ù†Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù…ØŒ Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ«Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ«Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø£Ø­Ø¯ Ù‚Ø¨Ù„Ù‡ØŒ Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ«Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù† ÙˆÙ…Ø¤Ù…Ù†Ø© ÙŠØ¨Ø¯Ø¡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„ØµØ¯ÙŠÙ‚ÙŠÙ† ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø´Ù‡Ø¯Ø§Ø¡ Ø«Ù… Ø¨Ø§Ù„ØµØ§Ù„Ø­ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙÙŠØ­Ù…Ø¯Ù‡ Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§ÙˆØ§Øª ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ØŒ ÙØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: ï´¿Ø¹Ø³Ù‰ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ¨Ø¹Ø«Ùƒ Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ù…Ù‚Ø§Ù…Ø§ Ù…Ø­Ù…ÙˆØ¯Ø§ï´¾ ÙØ·ÙˆØ¨Ù‰ Ù„Ù…Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‚Ø§Ù… Ø­Ø¸ØŒ ÙˆÙˆÙŠÙ„ Ù„Ù…Ù† Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙƒÙ† Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‚Ø§Ù… Ø­Ø¸ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ù†ØµÙŠØ¨ØŒ Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ¬ØªÙ…Ø¹ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙˆØ·Ù† Ø¢Ø®Ø± ÙˆÙŠØ¯Ø§Ù„ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ ÙˆÙ‡Ø°Ø§ ÙƒÙ„Ù‡ Ù‚Ø¨Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ØŒ ÙØ¥Ø°Ø§ Ø£Ø®Ø° ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ Ø´ØºÙ„ ÙƒÙ„ Ø¥Ù†Ø³Ø§Ù† Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ø¯ÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ù†Ø³Ø£Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ø±ÙƒØ© Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ…ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆØ­Ù„Ù„Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù‚Ø¯Ø© ÙØ¹Ø¸Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø£Ø¬Ø±Ùƒ. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: (ÙˆØ¬ÙˆÙ‡ ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ù†Ø§Ø¶Ø±Ø© Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ Ù†Ø§Ø¸Ø±Ø©) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù„Ø§ ØªØ¯Ø±ÙƒÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ ÙŠØ¯Ø±Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø±) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙ„Ù‚Ø¯ Ø±Ø¢Ù‡ Ù†Ø²Ù„Ø© Ø£Ø®Ø±Ù‰ Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ Ø³Ø¯Ø±Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†ØªÙ‡Ù‰) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ (ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ†ÙØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ø´ÙØ§Ø¹Ø© Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø°Ù† Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† ÙˆØ±Ø¶ÙŠ Ù„Ù‡ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ù…Ø§ Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ø£ÙŠØ¯ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø®Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù… ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ­ÙŠØ·ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§) ÙØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆØ¬ÙˆÙ‡ ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ù†Ø§Ø¶Ø±Ø© Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ Ù†Ø§Ø¸Ø±Ø©) ÙØ¥Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙˆØ¶Ø¹ ÙŠÙ†ØªÙ‡ÙŠ ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ø£ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙØ±Øº Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù†Ù‡Ø± ÙŠØ³Ù…Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙŠÙˆØ§Ù† ÙÙŠØºØªØ³Ù„ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆÙŠØ´Ø±Ø¨ÙˆÙ† Ù…Ù†Ù‡ ÙØªÙ†Ø¶Ø± ÙˆØ¬ÙˆÙ‡Ù‡Ù… Ø¥Ø´Ø±Ø§Ù‚Ø§ (Ù¡) ÙÙŠØ°Ù‡Ø¨ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙƒÙ„ Ù‚Ø°Ù‰ ÙˆÙˆØ¹Ø«ØŒ Ø«Ù… ÙŠØ¤Ù…Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø¯Ø®ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø©ØŒ ÙÙ…Ù† Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‚Ø§Ù… ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… ÙƒÙŠÙ ÙŠØ«ÙŠØ¨Ù‡Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ù†Ù‡ ÙŠØ¯Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø©ØŒ ÙØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ù…Ù† ØªØ³Ù„ÙŠÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù…: ï´¿Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙƒÙ… Ø·Ø¨ØªÙ… ÙØ§Ø¯Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ‡Ø§ Ø®Ø§Ù„Ø¯ÙŠÙ†ï´¾ (Ù¢) ÙØ¹Ù†Ø¯ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø£ÙŠÙ‚Ù†ÙˆØ§ Ø¨Ø¯Ø®ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø© ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù†Ø¸Ø± Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø§ ÙˆØ¹Ø¯Ù‡Ù… Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… ÙØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ Ù†Ø§Ø¸Ø±Ø©) ÙˆØ¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¸Ø± Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¸Ø± Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø«ÙˆØ§Ø¨Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰. ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù„Ø§ ØªØ¯Ø±ÙƒÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ ÙŠØ¯Ø±Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø±) ÙÙ‡Ùˆ ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: (Ù„Ø§ ØªØ¯Ø±ÙƒÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø±) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ù„Ø§ ØªØ­ÙŠØ· Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙˆÙ‡Ø§Ù… (ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ ÙŠØ¯Ø±Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø±) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙŠØ­ÙŠØ· Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ø·ÙŠÙ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø¨ÙŠØ±ØŒ ÙˆØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù…Ø¯Ø­ Ø§Ù…ØªØ¯Ø­ Ø¨Ù‡ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ù†ÙØ³Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ ÙˆØªÙ‚Ø¯Ø³ Ø¹Ù„ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ¨ÙŠØ±Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ø³Ø£Ù„ Ù…ÙˆØ³Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… ÙˆØ¬Ø±Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù„Ø³Ø§Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ï´¿Ø±Ø¨ Ø£Ø±Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ù†Ø¸Ø± Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙƒï´¾ ÙÙƒØ§Ù†Øª Ù…Ø³Ø£Ù„ØªÙ‡ ØªÙ„Ùƒ Ø£Ù…Ø±Ø§ Ø¹Ø¸ÙŠÙ…Ø§ ÙˆØ³Ø£Ù„ Ø£Ù…Ø±Ø§ Ø¬Ø³ÙŠÙ…Ø§ ÙØ¹ÙˆÙ‚Ø¨ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰: Ù„Ù† ØªØ±Ø§Ù†ÙŠ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ Ø­ØªÙ‰ ØªÙ…ÙˆØª ÙØªØ±Ø§Ù†ÙŠ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ø®Ø±Ø© ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ† Ø¥Ù† Ø£Ø±Ø¯Øª Ø£Ù† ØªØ±Ø§Ù†ÙŠ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ ÙØ§Ù†Ø¸Ø± (Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø¨Ù„ ÙØ¥Ù† Ø§Ø³ØªÙ‚Ø± Ù…ÙƒØ§Ù†Ù‡ ÙØ³ÙˆÙ ØªØ±Ø§Ù†ÙŠ) ÙØ£Ø¨Ø¯Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø³Ø¨Ø­Ø§Ù† Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø¢ÙŠØ§ØªÙ‡ ÙˆØªØ¬Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ù„Ù„Ø¬Ø¨Ù„ ÙØªÙ‚Ø·Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø¨Ù„ ÙØµØ§Ø± Ø±Ù…ÙŠÙ…Ø§ ÙˆØ®Ø± Ù…ÙˆØ³Ù‰ ØµØ¹Ù‚Ø§ØŒ ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ù…ÙŠØªØ§ ÙÙƒØ§Ù† Ø¹Ù‚ÙˆØ¨ØªÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØª Ø«Ù… Ø£Ø­ÙŠØ§Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ¨Ø¹Ø«Ù‡ ÙˆØªØ§Ø¨ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„: (Ø³Ø¨Ø­Ø§Ù†Ùƒ ØªØ¨Øª Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙƒ ÙˆØ£Ù†Ø§ Ø£ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ†) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø£ÙˆÙ„ Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù† Ø¢Ù…Ù† Ø¨Ùƒ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ù† ÙŠØ±Ø§ÙƒØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙ„Ù‚Ø¯ Ø±Ø¢Ù‡ Ù†Ø²Ù„Ø© Ø£Ø®Ø±Ù‰ Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ Ø³Ø¯Ø±Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†ØªÙ‡Ù‰) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯Ø§ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù… ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø¹Ù†Ø¯ Ø³Ø¯Ø±Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†ØªÙ‡Ù‰ Ø­ÙŠØ« Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØªØ¬Ø§ÙˆØ²Ù‡Ø§ Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ù…Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø¢Ø®Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø¢ÙŠØ©: (Ù…Ø§ Ø²Ø§Øº Ø§Ù„Ø¨ØµØ± ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø·ØºÙ‰ Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ Ø±Ø£Ù‰ Ù…Ù† Ø¢ÙŠØ§Øª Ø±Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„ÙƒØ¨Ø±Ù‰) Ø±Ø£Ù‰ Ø¬Ø¨Ø±Ø¦ÙŠÙ„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… ÙÙŠ ØµÙˆØ±ØªÙ‡ Ù…Ø±ØªÙŠÙ† Ù‡Ø°Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø±Ø© ÙˆÙ…Ø±Ø© Ø£Ø®Ø±Ù‰ ÙˆØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ø£Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø¬Ø¨Ø±Ø¦ÙŠÙ„ Ø¹Ø¸ÙŠÙ… ÙÙ‡Ùˆ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø±ÙˆØ­Ø§Ù†ÙŠÙŠÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ¯Ø±Ùƒ Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡Ù… ÙˆØµÙØªÙ‡Ù… Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø±Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙŠÙ† . ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ†ÙØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ø´ÙØ§Ø¹Ø© Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø°Ù† Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† ÙˆØ±Ø¶ÙŠ Ù„Ù‡ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ù…Ø§ Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ø£ÙŠØ¯ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø®Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù… ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ­ÙŠØ·ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§) Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ­ÙŠØ· Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ø§Ø¦Ù‚ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§ Ø¥Ø° Ù‡Ùˆ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¬Ø¹Ù„ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ù„ÙˆØ¨ Ø§Ù„ØºØ·Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙÙ‡Ù… ÙŠÙ†Ø§Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙŠÙØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ù‚Ù„Ø¨ ÙŠØ«Ø¨ØªÙ‡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø¯ÙˆØ¯ØŒ ÙÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØµÙÙ‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ ÙƒÙ…Ø§ ÙˆØµÙ Ù†ÙØ³Ù‡ Ù„ÙŠØ³ ÙƒÙ…Ø«Ù„Ù‡ Ø´Ø¦ ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ø¨ØµÙŠØ±ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙˆÙ„ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¢Ø®Ø± ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¸Ø§Ù‡Ø± ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¨Ø§Ø·Ù†ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø§Ù„Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø§Ø±Ø¦ Ø§Ù„Ù…ØµÙˆØ±ØŒ Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø´ÙŠØ§Ø¡ ÙÙ„ÙŠØ³ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø´ÙŠØ§Ø¡ Ø´Ø¦ Ù…Ø«Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†ÙƒØŒ ÙˆØ­Ù„Ù„Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù‚Ø¯Ø© ÙØ£Ø¹Ø¸Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø£Ø¬Ø±Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ†. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙ…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø± Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙ„Ù…Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ ÙˆØ­ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ùˆ Ù…Ù† ÙˆØ±Ø§Ø¡ Ø­Ø¬Ø§Ø¨ Ø£Ùˆ ÙŠØ±Ø³Ù„ Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙÙŠÙˆØ­ÙŠ Ø¨Ø¥Ø°Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙƒÙ„Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù…ÙˆØ³Ù‰ ØªÙƒÙ„ÙŠÙ…Ø§) Ùˆ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: ((ÙˆÙ†Ø§Ø¯Ø§Ù‡Ù…Ø§ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù…Ø§) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙŠØ§ Ø¢Ø¯Ù… Ø§Ø³ÙƒÙ† Ø£Ù†Øª ÙˆØ²ÙˆØ¬Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø©) ÙØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ (Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø± Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙ„Ù…Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ ÙˆØ­ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ùˆ Ù…Ù† ÙˆØ±Ø§Ø¡ Ø­Ø¬Ø§Ø¨) ÙØ¥Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø¨ØºÙŠ Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø± Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙ„Ù…Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ ÙˆØ­ÙŠØ§ ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ³ Ø¨ÙƒØ§Ø¦Ù† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† ÙˆØ±Ø§Ø¡ Ø­Ø¬Ø§Ø¨ØŒ Ø£Ùˆ ÙŠØ±Ø³Ù„ Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙÙŠÙˆØ­ÙŠ Ø¨Ø¥Ø°Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ¨ÙŠØ±Ø§ØŒ Ù‚Ø¯ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ ÙŠÙˆØ­Ù‰ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù† Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ ÙÙŠØ¨Ù„Øº Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ ÙˆØ¨ÙŠÙ†Ù‡ Ù…Ù† ØºÙŠØ± Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ±Ø³Ù„ Ø¨Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ù…Ø¹ Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù…: ÙŠØ§ Ø¬Ø¨Ø±Ø¦ÙŠÙ„ Ù‡Ù„ Ø±Ø£ÙŠØª Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¬Ø¨Ø±Ø¦ÙŠÙ„: Ø¥Ù† Ø±Ø¨ÙŠ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ±Ù‰ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù…: ÙÙ…Ù† Ø£ÙŠÙ† ØªØ£Ø®Ø° Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ­ÙŠØŸ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„: Ø¢Ø®Ø°Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø¥Ø³Ø±Ø§ÙÙŠÙ„ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆÙ…Ù† Ø£ÙŠÙ† ÙŠØ£Ø®Ø°Ù‡ Ø¥Ø³Ø±Ø§ÙÙŠÙ„ØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙŠØ£Ø®Ø°Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ù„Ùƒ ÙÙˆÙ‚Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø±ÙˆØ­Ø§Ù†ÙŠÙŠÙ†ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙÙ…Ù† Ø£ÙŠÙ† ÙŠØ£Ø®Ø°Ù‡ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„ÙƒØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙŠÙ‚Ø°Ù ÙÙŠ Ù‚Ù„Ø¨Ù‡ Ù‚Ø°ÙØ§ØŒ ÙÙ‡Ø°Ø§ ÙˆØ­ÙŠØŒ ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ØŒ ÙˆÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ø¨Ù†Ø­Ùˆ ÙˆØ§Ø­Ø¯ØŒ Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙƒÙ„Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ù„ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ Ù‚Ø°ÙÙ‡ ÙÙŠ Ù‚Ù„ÙˆØ¨Ù‡Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ù†Ù‡ Ø±Ø¤ÙŠØ§ ÙŠØ±ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ù„ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ù†Ù‡ ÙˆØ­ÙŠ ÙˆØªÙ†Ø²ÙŠÙ„ ÙŠØªÙ„Ù‰ ÙˆÙŠÙ‚Ø±Ø£ØŒ ÙÙ‡Ùˆ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙØ§ÙƒØªÙ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙˆØµÙØª Ù„Ùƒ Ù…Ù† ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙØ¥Ù† Ù…Ø¹Ù†Ù‰ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ø¨Ù†Ø­Ùˆ ÙˆØ§Ø­Ø¯ ÙØ¥Ù† Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ¨Ù„Øº Ø¨Ù‡ Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ùƒ Ùˆ Ø­Ù„Ù„Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù‚Ø¯Ø© ÙØ¹Ø¸Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø£Ø¬Ø±Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ†. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù‡Ù„ ØªØ¹Ù„Ù… Ù„Ù‡ Ø³Ù…ÙŠØ§) ÙØ¥Ù† ØªØ£ÙˆÙŠÙ„Ù‡ Ù‡Ù„ ØªØ¹Ù„Ù… Ø£Ø­Ø¯Ø§ Ø§Ø³Ù…Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØºÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ØŒ ÙØ¥ÙŠØ§Ùƒ Ø£Ù† ØªÙØ³Ø± Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø±Ø¢Ù† Ø¨Ø±Ø£ÙŠÙƒ Ø­ØªÙ‰ ØªÙÙ‚Ù‡Ù‡ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙØ¥Ù†Ù‡ Ø±Ø¨ ØªÙ†Ø²ÙŠÙ„ ÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø± ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØªØ£ÙˆÙŠÙ„Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… - Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø±ØŒ ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ø´Ø¦ Ù…Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ ÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡Ù‡ØŒ ÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡ ÙØ¹Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø´ÙŠØ¦Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£ÙØ¹Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø±ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡ Ø´Ø¦ Ù…Ù† ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù…Ù‡ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø±ØŒ ÙÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ ØµÙØªÙ‡ ÙˆÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø± Ø£ÙØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‡Ù…ØŒ ÙÙ„Ø§ ØªØ´Ø¨Ù‡ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø± ÙØªÙ‡Ù„Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¶Ù„ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†ÙƒØŒ ÙˆØ­Ù„Ù„Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù‚Ø¯Ø© ÙØ¹Ø¸Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø£Ø¬Ø±Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ†. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙ…Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ø²Ø¨ Ø¹Ù† Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø«Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø°Ø±Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ø²Ø¨ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡ Ø´Ø¦ØŒ ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ù…Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø´ÙŠØ§Ø¡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ù…Ø§ Ø®Ù„Ù‚ ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ø§Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ…. ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø± Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠÙ…Ø©) ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØµÙŠØ¨Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ø®ÙŠØ±ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ ØªÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø±Ø¨: ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø± Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ†Ø§ ÙÙ„Ø§Ù†ØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØµÙŠØ¨Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ø¨Ø®ÙŠØ±ØŒ ÙØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¸Ø± Ù‡Ù‡Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ØŒ ÙÙ†Ø¸Ø±Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø±Ø­Ù…Ø© Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ù‡Ù…ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙƒÙ„Ø§ Ø¥Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø¹Ù† Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ù„Ù…Ø­Ø¬ÙˆØ¨ÙˆÙ†) ÙØ¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¨Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠØ§Ù…Ø© Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø¹Ù† Ø«ÙˆØ§Ø¨ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ø­Ø¬ÙˆØ¨ÙˆÙ† Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†ÙƒØŒ ÙˆØ­Ù„Ù„Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù‚Ø¯Ø© ÙØ¹Ø¸Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø£Ø¬Ø±Ùƒ. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø£Ø£Ù…Ù†ØªÙ… Ù…Ù† ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ®Ø³Ù Ø¨ÙƒÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ ÙØ¥Ø°Ø§ Ù‡ÙŠ ØªÙ…ÙˆØ±) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§ÙˆØ§Øª ÙˆÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø±Ø´ Ø§Ø³ØªÙˆÙ‰) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ù…Ø¹ÙƒÙ… Ø£ÙŠÙ†Ù…Ø§ ÙƒÙ†ØªÙ…) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙ†Ø­Ù† Ø£Ù‚Ø±Ø¨ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù† Ø­Ø¨Ù„ Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ±ÙŠØ¯) ÙÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø³Ø¨ÙˆØ­Ø§ Ù‚Ø¯ÙˆØ³Ø§ØŒ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ¬Ø±ÙŠ Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ¬Ø±ÙŠ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ‚ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ø·ÙŠÙ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø¨ÙŠØ±ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ù„ ÙˆØ£ÙƒØ¨Ø± Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙ†Ø²Ù„ Ø¨Ù‡ Ø´Ø¦ Ù…Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø²Ù„ Ø¨Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø±Ø´ Ø§Ø³ØªÙˆÙ‰ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ØŒ Ø´Ø§Ù‡Ø¯ Ù„ÙƒÙ„ Ù†Ø¬ÙˆÙ‰ØŒ ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„ÙˆÙƒÙŠÙ„ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ÙƒÙ„ Ø´Ø¦ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…ÙŠØ³Ø± Ù„ÙƒÙ„ Ø´Ø¦ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ø¯Ø¨Ø± Ù„Ù„Ø£Ø´ÙŠØ§Ø¡ ÙƒÙ„Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø¹Ø±Ø´Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ¨ÙŠØ±Ø§. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆØ¬Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ùƒ ØµÙØ§ ØµÙØ§) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆÙ„Ù‚Ø¯ Ø¬Ø¦ØªÙ…ÙˆÙ†Ø§ ÙØ±Ø§Ø¯Ù‰ ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù†Ø§ÙƒÙ… Ø£ÙˆÙ„ Ù…Ø±Ø©)ØŒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù‡Ù„ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø¸Ù„Ù„ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„ØºÙ…Ø§Ù… ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ©) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù‡Ù„ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ù† ØªØ£ØªÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø£Ùˆ ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠ Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ø£Ùˆ ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø¢ÙŠØ§Øª Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ) ÙØ¥Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø­Ù‚ ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ØŒ Ùˆ Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ù„Ù‡ Ø¬ÙŠØ¦Ø© ÙƒØ¬ÙŠØ¦Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ø£Ø¹Ù„Ù…ØªÙƒ Ø£Ù† Ø±Ø¨ Ø´Ø¦ Ù…Ù† ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ£ÙˆÙŠÙ„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ØºÙŠØ± ØªÙ†Ø²ÙŠÙ„Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø±ØŒ ÙˆØ³Ø£Ù†Ø¨Ø¦Ùƒ Ø¨Ø·Ø±Ù Ù…Ù†Ù‡ ÙØªÙƒØªÙÙŠ Ø¥Ù† Ø´Ø§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ Ù…Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø¥Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù‡ÙŠÙ… Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ï´¿Ø¥Ù†ÙŠ Ø°Ø§Ù‡Ø¨ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨ÙŠ Ø³ÙŠÙ‡Ø¯ÙŠÙ†ï´¾ (Ù¡) ÙØ°Ù‡Ø§Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡ ØªÙˆØ¬Ù‡Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø¯Ø© ÙˆØ§Ø¬ØªÙ‡Ø§Ø¯Ø§ ÙˆÙ‚Ø±Ø¨Ø© Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ØŒ Ø£Ù„Ø§ ØªØ±Ù‰ Ø£Ù† ØªØ£ÙˆÙŠÙ„Ù‡ ØºÙŠØ± ØªÙ†Ø²ÙŠÙ„Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ ï´¿ÙˆØ£Ù†Ø²Ù„Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø¯ÙŠØ¯ ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ø¨Ø£Ø³ Ø´Ø¯ÙŠØ¯ï´¾ (Ù¢) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ø­ ÙˆØºÙŠØ± Ø°Ù„ÙƒØŒ ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù‡Ù„ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ù† ØªØ£ØªÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ©) ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯Ø§ (Ù£) ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù… Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø´Ø±ÙƒÙŠÙ† ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø§ÙÙ‚ÙŠÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ³ØªØ¬ÙŠØ¨ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„Ù„Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„: (Ù‡Ù„ ÙŠÙ†Ø¸Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ù† ØªØ£ØªÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ©) Ø­ÙŠØ« Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ³ØªØ¬ÙŠØ¨ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ (Ø£Ùˆ ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠ Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ø£Ùˆ ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø¢ÙŠØ§Øª Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¨Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø°Ø§Ø¨ ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠÙ‡Ù… ÙÙŠ Ø¯Ø§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ø¹Ø°Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙˆÙ„Ù‰ØŒ ÙÙ‡Ø°Ø§ Ø®Ø¨Ø± ÙŠØ®Ø¨Ø± Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¨ÙŠ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù… Ø¹Ù†Ù‡Ù…ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ù‚Ø§Ù„: (ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠØ£ØªÙŠ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø¢ÙŠØ§Øª Ø±Ø¨Ùƒ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†ÙØ¹ Ù†ÙØ³Ø§ Ø¥ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†Ù‡Ø§ Ù„Ù… ØªÙƒÙ† Ø¢Ù…Ù†Øª Ù…Ù† Ù‚Ø¨Ù„ Ø£Ùˆ ÙƒØ³Ø¨Øª ÙÙŠ Ø¥ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†Ù‡Ø§ Ø®ÙŠØ±Ø§) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ù…Ù† Ù‚Ø¨Ù„ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ¬ÙŠØ¦ Ù‡Ø°Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø¢ÙŠØ©ØŒ ÙˆÙ‡Ø°Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø¢ÙŠØ© Ø·Ù„ÙˆØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù…Ø³ Ù…Ù† Ù…ØºØ±Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙƒØªÙÙŠ Ø£ÙˆÙ„ÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù„Ø¨Ø§Ø¨ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø­Ø¬Ù‰ ÙˆØ£ÙˆÙ„ÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ù‡Ù‰ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ø¥Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù†ÙƒØ´Ù Ø§Ù„ØºØ·Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø£ÙˆØ§ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙˆØ¹Ø¯ÙˆÙ†ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: ÙÙŠ Ø¢ÙŠØ© Ø£Ø®Ø±Ù‰: ï´¿ÙØ£ØªØ§Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø­ÙŠØ« Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ­ØªØ³Ø¨ÙˆØ§ï´¾ (Ù¤) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø¹Ø°Ø§Ø¨Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ø¥ØªÙŠØ§Ù†Ù‡ Ø¨Ù†ÙŠØ§Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: ï´¿ÙØ£ØªÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ù†ÙŠØ§Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙˆØ§Ø¹Ø¯ï´¾ ÙØ¥ØªÙŠØ§Ù†Ù‡ Ø¨Ù†ÙŠØ§Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙˆØ§Ø¹Ø¯ Ø¥Ø±Ø³Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø°Ø§Ø¨ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù…Ø§ ÙˆØµÙ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù…Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ø®Ø±Ø© ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ Ø§Ø³Ù…Ù‡ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø¹Ù„ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ¨ÙŠØ±Ø§ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ ÙŠØ¬Ø±ÙŠ Ø£Ù…ÙˆØ±Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù…Ù‚Ø¯Ø§Ø±Ù‡ Ø®Ù…Ø³ÙŠÙ† Ø£Ù„Ù Ø³Ù†Ø© ÙƒÙ…Ø§ ÙŠØ¬Ø±ÙŠ Ø£Ù…ÙˆØ±Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØºÙŠØ¨ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ£ÙÙ„ Ù…Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ø¢ÙÙ„ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙØ§ÙƒØªÙ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙˆØµÙØª Ù„Ùƒ Ù…Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù…Ù…Ø§ Ø¬Ø§Ù„ ÙÙŠ ØµØ¯Ø±Ùƒ Ù…Ù…Ø§ ÙˆØµÙ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙÙŠ ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ØªØ¬Ø¹Ù„ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù…Ù‡ ÙƒÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø±ØŒ Ù‡Ùˆ Ø£Ø¹Ø¸Ù… ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ù„ ÙˆØ£ÙƒØ±Ù… ÙˆØ£Ø¹Ø² ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù† ÙŠØµÙÙ‡ Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ§ØµÙÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙˆØµÙ Ø¨Ù‡ Ù†ÙØ³Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: ï´¿Ù„ÙŠØ³ ÙƒÙ…Ø«Ù„Ù‡ Ø´Ø¦ ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ø¨ØµÙŠØ±ï´¾ (Ù¡) Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†ÙƒØŒ ÙˆØ­Ù„Ù„Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù‚Ø¯Ø©. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø¨Ù„ Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… ÙƒØ§ÙØ±ÙˆÙ†) ÙˆØ°ÙƒØ± Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† (Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† ÙŠØ¸Ù†ÙˆÙ† Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù„Ø§Ù‚ÙˆØ§ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù…)) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ Ù„ØºÙŠØ±Ù‡Ù…: ï´¿Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠÙ„Ù‚ÙˆÙ†Ù‡ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ø®Ù„ÙÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙˆØ¹Ø¯ÙˆÙ‡ï´¾ ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙÙ…Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† ÙŠØ±Ø¬ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡ ÙÙ„ÙŠØ¹Ù…Ù„ Ø¹Ù…Ù„Ø§ ØµØ§Ù„Ø­Ø§) ÙØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø¨Ù„ Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù… ÙƒØ§ÙØ±ÙˆÙ†) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø¹Ø« ÙØ³Ù…Ø§Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ø°ÙƒØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† (Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† ÙŠØ¸Ù†ÙˆÙ† Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù„Ø§Ù‚ÙˆØ§ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡Ù…) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙŠÙˆÙ‚Ù†ÙˆÙ† Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙŠØ¨Ø¹Ø«ÙˆÙ† Ùˆ ÙŠØ­Ø´Ø±ÙˆÙ† ÙˆÙŠØ­Ø§Ø³Ø¨ÙˆÙ† ÙˆÙŠØ¬Ø²ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø«ÙˆØ§Ø¨ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ù‚Ø§Ø¨ØŒ ÙØ§Ù„Ø¸Ù† Ù‡Ù‡Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙ‚ÙŠÙ† Ø®Ø§ØµØ©ØŒ Ùˆ ÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙÙ…Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† ÙŠØ±Ø¬ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ø±Ø¨Ù‡ ÙÙ„ÙŠØ¹Ù…Ù„ Ø¹Ù…Ù„Ø§ ØµØ§Ù„Ø­Ø§) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù…Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† ÙŠØ±Ø¬ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙØ¥Ù† Ø£Ø¬Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù„Ø¢Øª) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ: Ù…Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† ÙŠØ¤Ù…Ù† Ø¨Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø¨Ø¹ÙˆØ« ÙØ¥Ù† ÙˆØ¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù„Ø¢Øª Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø«ÙˆØ§Ø¨ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ù‚Ø§Ø¨ØŒ ÙØ§Ù„Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ù‡Ù‡Ù†Ø§ Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¤ÙŠØ©ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¡ Ù‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø¹Ø«ØŒ ÙØ§ÙÙ‡Ù… Ø¬Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ù…Ø§ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨ Ù…Ù† Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¦Ù‡ ÙØ¥Ù†Ù‡ ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¨Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø¹Ø«ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ØªØ­ÙŠØªÙ‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠÙ„Ù‚ÙˆÙ†Ù‡ Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ²ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø¥ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù† Ø¹Ù† Ù‚Ù„ÙˆØ¨Ù‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ… ÙŠØ¨Ø¹Ø«ÙˆÙ†ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†ÙƒØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø¯ Ø­Ù„Ù„Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù‚Ø¯Ø©. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙˆØ±Ø£Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¬Ø±Ù…ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø± ÙØ¸Ù†ÙˆØ§ Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ù…ÙˆØ§Ù‚Ø¹ÙˆÙ‡Ø§) ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø£ÙŠÙ‚Ù†ÙˆØ§ Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø¯Ø§Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø¥Ù†ÙŠ Ø¸Ù†Ù†Øª Ø£Ù†ÙŠ Ù…Ù„Ø§Ù‚ Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ÙŠÙ‡) ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ Ø¥Ù†ÙŠ Ø£ÙŠÙ‚Ù†Øª Ø£Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ø¨Ø¹Ø« ÙØ£Ø­Ø§Ø³Ø¨ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° ÙŠÙˆÙÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¯ÙŠÙ†Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ ÙˆÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù…ÙˆÙ† Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¨ÙŠÙ†) ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ Ù„Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø§ÙÙ‚ÙŠÙ†: (ÙˆØªØ¸Ù†ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø¸Ù†ÙˆÙ†Ø§) ÙÙ‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø¸Ù† Ø¸Ù† Ø´Ùƒ ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ³ Ø¸Ù† ÙŠÙ‚ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¸Ù† Ø¸Ù†Ø§Ù†: Ø¸Ù† Ø´Ùƒ ÙˆØ¸Ù† ÙŠÙ‚ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙÙ…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù…Ø± Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ø¯ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¸Ù† ÙÙ‡Ùˆ Ø¸Ù† ÙŠÙ‚ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù…Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ ÙÙ‡Ùˆ Ø¸Ù† Ø´Ùƒ ÙØ§ÙÙ‡Ù… Ù…Ø§ ÙØ³Ø±Øª Ù„ÙƒØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ùƒ. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰: (ÙˆÙ†Ø¶Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø²ÙŠÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø³Ø· Ù„ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠÙ…Ø© ÙÙ„Ø§ ØªØ¸Ù„Ù… Ù†ÙØ³ Ø´ÙŠØ¦Ø§) ÙÙ‡Ùˆ Ù…ÙŠØ²Ø§Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¯Ù„ ÙŠØ¤Ø®Ø° Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ø§Ø¦Ù‚ ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠØ§Ù…Ø©ØŒ ÙŠØ¯ÙŠÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ Ùˆ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø²ÙŠÙ†. ÙˆÙÙŠ ØºÙŠØ± Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø¯ÙŠØ« Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø²ÙŠÙ† Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù†Ø¨ÙŠØ§Ø¡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø£ÙˆØµÙŠØ§Ø¡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… . ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: (ÙÙ„Ø§ Ù†Ù‚ÙŠÙ… Ù„Ù‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠÙ…Ø© ÙˆØ²Ù†Ø§) ÙØ¥Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø®Ø§ØµÙ‡. ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ÙØ£ÙˆÙ„Ø¦Ùƒ ÙŠØ¯Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø© ÙŠØ±Ø²Ù‚ÙˆÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø¨ØºÙŠØ± Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨) ÙØ¥Ù† Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù… Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„: Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ Ø­Ù‚Øª ÙƒØ±Ø§Ù…ØªÙŠ - Ø£Ùˆ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù…ÙˆØ¯ØªÙŠ - Ù„Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ±Ø§Ù‚Ø¨Ù†ÙŠ ÙˆÙŠØªØ­Ø§Ø¨ Ø¨Ø¬Ù„Ø§Ù„ÙŠ Ø¥Ù† ÙˆØ¬ÙˆÙ‡Ù‡Ù… ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙŠØ§Ù…Ø© Ù…Ù† Ù†ÙˆØ± Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ù†Ø§Ø¨Ø± Ù…Ù† Ù†ÙˆØ± Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø«ÙŠØ§Ø¨ Ø®Ø¶Ø±ØŒ Ù‚ÙŠÙ„: Ù…Ù† Ù‡Ù… ÙŠØ§ Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‚ÙˆÙ… Ù„ÙŠØ³ÙˆØ§ Ø¨Ø£Ù†Ø¨ÙŠØ§Ø¡ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ø´Ù‡Ø¯Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ†Ù‡Ù… ØªØ­Ø§Ø¨ÙˆØ§ Ø¨Ø¬Ù„Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙŠØ¯Ø®Ù„ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø© Ø¨ØºÙŠØ± Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ØŒ Ù†Ø³Ø£Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ¬Ø¹Ù„Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ø±Ø­Ù…ØªÙ‡. ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: ÙÙ…Ù† Ø«Ù‚Ù„Øª Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø²ÙŠÙ†Ù‡ ÙˆØ®ÙØª Ù…ÙˆØ§Ø²ÙŠÙ†Ù‡ ÙØ¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ØŒ ØªÙˆØ²Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù†Ø§Øª ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø³ÙŠØ¦Ø§ØªØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù†Ø§Øª Ø«Ù‚Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙŠØ²Ø§Ù† ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø³ÙŠØ¦Ø§Øª Ø®ÙØ© Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙŠØ²Ø§Ù†. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: ÙˆØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ù‚Ù„ ÙŠØªÙˆÙØ§ÙƒÙ… Ù…Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØª Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ ÙˆÙƒÙ„ Ø¨ÙƒÙ… Ø«Ù… Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø¨ÙƒÙ… ØªØ±Ø¬Ø¹ÙˆÙ†) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙŠØªÙˆÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù†ÙØ³ Ø­ÙŠÙ† Ù…ÙˆØªÙ‡Ø§) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (ØªÙˆÙØªÙ‡ Ø±Ø³Ù„Ù†Ø§ ÙˆÙ‡Ù… Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙØ±Ø·ÙˆÙ†) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: (Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† ØªØªÙˆÙØ§Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø¸Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙŠ Ø£Ù†ÙØ³Ù‡Ù…) ÙˆÙ‚ÙˆÙ„Ù‡: ØªØªÙˆÙØ§Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø·ÙŠØ¨ÙŠÙ† ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„ÙˆÙ† Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙƒÙ…) ÙØ¥Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠØ¯Ø¨Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù…ÙˆØ± ÙƒÙŠÙ ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙˆÙŠÙˆÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡. Ø£Ù…Ø§ Ù…Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØª ÙØ¥Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙŠÙˆÙƒÙ„Ù‡ Ø¨Ø®Ø§ØµØ© Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ Ù…Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙŠÙˆÙƒÙ„ Ø±Ø³Ù„Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø®Ø§ØµØ© Ø¨Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ Ù…Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØ© Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† Ø³Ù…Ø§Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² Ø°ÙƒØ±Ù‡ ÙˆÙƒÙ„Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ø®Ø§ØµØ© Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ Ù…Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ØŒ Ø¥Ù†Ù‡ ØªØ¨Ø§Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠØ¯Ø¨Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù…ÙˆØ± ÙƒÙŠÙ ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ³ ÙƒÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ³ØªØ·ÙŠØ¹ ØµØ§Ø­Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙØ³Ø±Ù‡ Ù„ÙƒÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø³ Ù„Ø£Ù† Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙˆÙŠ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¶Ø¹ÙŠÙØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø£Ù† Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ·Ø§Ù‚ Ø­Ù…Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙ…Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ·Ø§Ù‚ Ø­Ù…Ù„Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ³Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù„Ù‡ Ø­Ù…Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ£Ø¹Ø§Ù†Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ù† Ø®Ø§ØµØ© Ø£ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ§Ø¦Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙƒÙÙŠÙƒ Ø£Ù† ØªØ¹Ù„Ù… Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù‡Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­ÙŠÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù…ÙŠØª ÙˆØ£Ù†Ù‡ ÙŠØªÙˆÙÙ‰ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù†ÙØ³ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠØ¯ÙŠ Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ Ù…Ù† Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ù„Ø§Ø¦ÙƒØªÙ‡ ÙˆØºÙŠØ±Ù‡Ù…ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø¬Øª Ø¹Ù†ÙŠ ÙØ±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ùƒ ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙ†ÙØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³Ù„Ù…ÙŠÙ† Ø¨Ùƒ . ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ù„Ù„Ø±Ø¬Ù„: Ø¥Ù† ÙƒÙ†Øª Ù‚Ø¯ Ø´Ø±Ø­ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØµØ¯Ø±Ùƒ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ Ù‚Ø¯ ØªØ¨ÙŠÙ†Øª Ù„Ùƒ ÙØ£Ù†Øª ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ ÙÙ„Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø¨Ø© ÙˆØ¨Ø±Ø£ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø³Ù…Ø© Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† Ø­Ù‚Ø§ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¬Ù„: ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙƒÙŠÙ Ù„ÙŠ Ø£Ù† Ø£Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø¨Ø£Ù†ÙŠ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† Ø­Ù‚Ø§ØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù„Ø³Ø§Ù† Ù†Ø¨ÙŠÙ‡ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ´Ù‡Ø¯ Ù„Ù‡ Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù†Ø© Ø£Ùˆ Ø´Ø±Ø­ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØµØ¯Ø±Ù‡ Ù„ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ù…Ø§ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„ÙƒØªØ¨ Ø§Ù„ØªÙŠ Ø£Ù†Ø²Ù„Ù‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø³Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ£Ù†Ø¨ÙŠØ§Ø¦Ù‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆÙ…Ù† ÙŠØ·ÙŠÙ‚ Ø°Ù„ÙƒØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù…Ù† Ø´Ø±Ø­ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØµØ¯Ø±Ù‡ ÙˆÙˆÙÙ‚Ù‡ Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙØ¹Ù„ÙŠÙƒ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù…Ù„ Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø³Ø± Ø£Ù…Ø±Ùƒ ÙˆØ¹Ù„Ø§Ù†ÙŠØªÙƒ ÙÙ„Ø§ Ø´Ø¦ ÙŠØ¹Ø¯Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù…Ù„. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ù…ØµÙ†Ù Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨: Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù„ÙŠÙ„ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„ØµØ§Ù†Ø¹ ÙˆØ§Ø­Ø¯ Ù„Ø§ Ø£ÙƒØ«Ø± Ù…Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ùˆ ÙƒØ§Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ø«Ù†ÙŠÙ† Ù„Ù… ÙŠØ®Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù…Ø± ÙÙŠÙ‡Ù…Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙƒÙ„ ÙˆØ§Ø­Ø¯ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù…Ø§ Ù‚Ø§Ø¯Ø±Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ù†Ø¹ ØµØ§Ø­Ø¨Ù‡ Ù…Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ±ÙŠØ¯ Ø£Ùˆ ØºÙŠØ± Ù‚Ø§Ø¯Ø±ØŒ ÙØ¥Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† ÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ ÙÙ‚Ø¯ Ø¬Ø§Ø² Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù…Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø¹ ÙˆÙ…Ù† Ø¬Ø§Ø² Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙÙ…Ø­Ø¯Ø« ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…ØµÙ†ÙˆØ¹ Ù…Ø­Ø¯Ø«ØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ù† Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ†Ø§ Ù‚Ø§Ø¯Ø±ÙŠÙ† Ù„Ø²Ù…Ù‡Ù…Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¬Ø² Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ù‚Øµ ÙˆÙ‡Ù…Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø¯Ù„Ø§Ù„Ø§Øª Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø¯Ø«ØŒ ÙØµØ­ Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠÙ… ÙˆØ§Ø­Ø¯. ÙˆØ¯Ù„ÙŠÙ„ Ø¢Ø®Ø± ÙˆÙ‡Ùˆ Ø£Ù† ÙƒÙ„ ÙˆØ§Ø­Ø¯ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ®Ù„ÙˆØ§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ù‚Ø§Ø¯Ø±Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù† ÙŠÙƒØªÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ø®Ø± Ø´ÙŠØ¦Ø§ØŒ ÙØ¥Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† ÙƒØ°Ù„Ùƒ ÙØ§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ø¬Ø§Ø² Ø§Ù„ÙƒØªÙ…Ø§Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø­Ø§Ø¯Ø«ØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ù† Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙƒÙ† Ù‚Ø§Ø¯Ø±Ø§ ÙÙ‡Ùˆ Ø¹Ø§Ø¬Ø² ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ø¬Ø² Ø­Ø§Ø¯Ø« Ù„Ù…Ø§ Ø¨ÙŠÙ†Ø§Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… ÙŠØ­ØªØ¬ Ø¨Ù‡ ÙÙŠ Ø¥Ø¨Ø·Ø§Ù„ Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠÙ…ÙŠÙ† ØµÙØ© ÙƒÙ„ ÙˆØ§Ø­Ø¯ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù…Ø§ ØµÙØ© Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ø£Ø«Ø¨ØªÙ†Ø§Ù‡ØŒ ÙØ£Ù…Ø§ Ù…Ø§ Ø°Ù‡Ø¨ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ù…Ø§Ù†ÙŠ ÙˆØ§Ø¨Ù† Ø¯ÙŠØµØ§Ù† Ù…Ù† Ø®Ø±Ø§ÙØ§ØªÙ‡Ù…Ø§ ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù…ØªØ²Ø§Ø¬ ÙˆØ¯Ø§Ù†Øª Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¬ÙˆØ³ Ù…Ù† Ø­Ù…Ø§Ù‚Ø§ØªÙ‡Ø§ ÙÙŠ Ø£Ù‡Ø±Ù…Ù† ÙÙØ§Ø³Ø¯ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙØ³Ø¯ Ø¨Ù‡ Ù‚Ø¯Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¬Ø³Ø§Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø¯Ø®ÙˆÙ„Ù‡Ù…Ø§ ÙÙŠ ØªÙ„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ù…Ù„Ø© Ø§Ù‚ØªØµØ±Øª Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… ÙÙŠÙ‡Ù…Ø§ ÙˆÙ„Ù… Ø£ÙØ±Ø¯ ÙƒÙ„Ø§ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù…Ø§ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ³Ø£Ù„ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡ Ù…Ù†Ù‡. ", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/14/2/36/5", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 36, "thaqalaynSanad": "5. Ahmad ibn al-Hasan al-Qittan said: Ahmad ibn Yahya said, on the authority of Bakr ibn `Abd Allah ibn Hubayb that Ahmad ibn Ya`qub ibn Matar related to me that Muhammad ibn alHasan bin `Abd al-`Aziz al-Ahdab al-Jund said in Naysabur that I found in my fatherâ€™s book in his writing: Talhah ibn Yazid said, on the authority of `Ubayd Allah ibn `Ubayd, on the authority of Abu Ma`mar al-Sa`dani that ", "thaqalaynMatn": "A man came to the Commander of the Faithful `Ali ibn Abu Talib (AS) and said: â€œO Commander of the Faithful! Verily, I have doubted the Revealed Book of Allah.â€ The Imam (AS) replied to him, â€œMay your mother be bereaved of you! How did you come to doubt the Revealed Book of Allah?â€ He said: â€œBecause I find some parts of the Book belie some other parts then how should I not doubt in it.?â€ Consequently, `Ali ibn Abu Talib (AS) replied, â€œVerily, when it comes to the Book of Allah, some parts of it verify other parts. However, you have not been given the sustenance of wisdom to benefit form it. Bring me what you doubt in the Book of Allah, the Mighty and High.â€ The man explained to him (AS), â€œI found Allah saying that So today We forget them, as they forgot the meeting of this day of theirs, also: They have forgotten Allah, so He has forgotten them, and said: And your Lord is not forgetful. Thus, once He informs that He does forget and in another place He says that He does not forget. O Commander of the Faithful, what is that?â€ Imam `Ali (AS) said: â€œBring me what you doubt in.â€ He said: I have found Allah saying that The Day on which the spirit and the angels shall stand in ranks; they shall not speak except he whom the Most Compassionate God permits and who speaks the right thing, He says: (they will speak) They would say: By Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheist, He says: On the Resurrection Day some of you shall deny others, and some of you shall curse others, then He says: That most surely is the truth: the contending one with another of the inmates of the fire, He says: Do not quarrel in My Presence, and indeed I gave you the threatening beforehand, and He says: We will set a seal upon their mouths, and their hands shall speak to Us, and their feet shall bear witness of what t hey earned. Therefore, on one occasion He says that they will speak, and on another occasion He says: â€œthey will not speak except he whom the Most Compassionate permits and who speaks the right thing.â€ In one place He informs that the creation will not speak and describes their statement: â€œBy Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheist.â€ In another place He says that they will quarrel. O Commander of the Faithful, why is that? And how shall I not doubt in what you hear (from me)? The Imam said: â€œWoe unto you! Bring me what you doubt in.â€ He responded, I also find Allah, the Mighty and High saying that Faces on that day shall be bright, looking to their Lord, and he says: Vision comprehends Him not, and He comprehends (all) vision; and He is the Knower of Subtleties, the Aware, He says: And certainly he saw him in another descent, a the farthest lotus-tree; He also says: On that day shall no intercession avail except of him whom the Beneficent Allah allows and whose word He is pleased with. He knows what is before them and what is behind them, while they do not comprehend it in knowledge. Whoever the eyes have perceived is encompassed in knowledge. O Commander of Faithful, why is that? And how shall I not doubt in what you hear? The Imam (AS) said: â€œWoe unto you! Bring me what you doubt in.â€ The man uttered, I also find Allah, the Blessed, the Exalted, that And it is not for any man that Allah should speak to him save by revelation or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger (angel) and to reveal by His permission what He wills, He also says: And to Musa, Allah addressed His Word, speaking (to him), and He says: And their Lord called out to them, and He says, O Prophet! Say to your wives and your daughters and He also says: O Messenger! Deliver what has been revealed to you from your Lord. Why is that O Commander of the Faithful? And how shall I not doubt in what you hear? The Imam said: â€œWoe unto you! Bring me what you doubt in.â€ The man further said: I find Allah, High be His Praise, saying that Do you know anyone else named with the same names? He names the human as hearing [sami`], seeing [basir`], sovereign [malik], lord [rabb]. Therefore, at times He says that He has many common names, and at other times He says: â€œdo you know anyone else named with the same name?â€ Why is that O Commander of the Faithful? And ho shall I not doubt in what you hear?â€ The Imam said: â€œWoe unto you! Bring me what you doubt in.â€ He said: I found Allah, the Blessed and Exalted saying, that And there does not lie concealed from your Lord the weight of an atom in the earth or in heaven, and that nor will He look upon them on the Day of Resurrection nor will He purify them, and also that Nay! Most surely they shall on that day be veiled from their Lord. How does He look at them when they are veiled? And why is that O Commander of the Faithful? And how shall I not doubt in what you hear? The Imam (AS) replied, â€œWoe unto you! Bring me what you doubt in.â€ He continued, And I find Allah, the Might and High, saying that Are you secure of those in heaven and He should not make the earth to swallow you up, and that The Most Compassionate Allah is firm on the Empyrean, and also that And He is Allah in heavens and in the earth; He knows your secrets and your disclosures, and that The Manifested and the Hidden, and that He is with you wherever you may be, and also that We are nearer to him than his jugular vein. Then why is that O Commander of the Faithful? And ho shall I not doubt in what you hear? The Imam (AS) said: â€œWoe unto you! Bring me more what you doubt in.â€ The man further said: I find Allah, High be His praise, saying that And your Lord comes and (also) the angels in ranks, and he said: Verily, you have come to Us alone as We created you at first, and said: They do not wait aught but that Allah should come to them in the shadows of the clouds along with the angels, and also said: They do not wait aught but that the angels should come to them, or that your Lord should come, or that some of the signs of your Lord should come. On the day when some of the Signs of your Lord shall come, its faith shall not profit a soul which did no believe before, or earn good through its faith. Thus, in one place He says: â€œOn the Day your Lord should comeâ€ and in another place He says: â€œon the Day some of the Signs of your Lord should come.â€ Then why is that O Commander of the Faithful? And how shall I not doubt in what you hear? The Imam (AS) said: â€œWoe unto you! Bring me what you doubt in.â€ The man continued, And I find Allah, the Mighty and High, saying that Nay! They are unbelievers in the meeting of their Lord, and when He mentioned the Believer, He said: Who know that they shall meet their Lord and that they shall return to Him, and said: Their greetings on the Day when they meet Him shall be: â€œPeace,â€ and He also said: Whoever hopes to meet Allah, then meeting Him is forthcoming, and said: Therefore, whoever hope to meet his Lord, he should do good deeds. Thus, in one occasion, He says that they will meet Him, and on other occasion, He says that vision cannot perceive Him, and that He perceives all vision. And at another time He says: â€œThey cannot encompass Him with knowledge.â€ Then why is that O Commander of the Faithful? And how shall I not doubt in what you hear The Imam (AS) said: â€œWoe unto you! Bring me what you doubt in.â€ The man said: I found Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, that And the guilty shall see the fire, then they shall think that they are going to fall into it, and He said: On that day Allah will pay back to them in full their just reward, and they shall know that Allah is the evident Truth, and He also said: You began to think diverse thoughts of Allah. So in one place He says that â€œthey think,â€ and in another place He says that â€œthey know.â€ Thinking [zann] is doubt. Then why is that O Commander of the Faithful? And how shall I not doubt in what you heard? The Imam (AS) said: â€œBring me what you doubt in.â€ The man said: I find Allah, the Exalted, saying that And We will set up a just balance on the Day of Resurrection, so no soul shall be dealt with unjustly in the least; and He said: Therefore, We will not set up a balance for them on the Day of Resurrection, and He also said: These shall enter the garden, in which they shall be given sustenance without measure, and He also said: And the measuring out on the that day will be just; then as for him whose measure (of good deeds) is heavy, those are they who shall be successful; and as for him whose measure (of good deeds) is light those are they who have made their souls suffer loss because they were unjust towards Our signs. Then why is that O Commander of the Faithful? And how shall I not doubt in what you hear? The Imam (AS) replied, â€œWoe unto you! Bring me what you doubt in.â€ The man said: I found Allah, the Exalted, saying that Say: The Angel of Death who is given charge of you takes your souls, then to your Lord you shall be brought back, and He said: Allah takes the souls at the time of their death, and He also said: Our Messengers (angels) take his soul away, and they are not remiss, and also said: Thos whom the angels take away their souls in a good state, and He also said: Those whom the angels take away their souls while they are unjust to themselves. Then why is that O Commander of the Faithful? And how shall I not doubt in what you hear? Thus, I shall perish if you do not have mercy on me, and expand my chest for me in what might happen by my hands. For if the Lord, the Blessed and Exalted is truth, the book is truth, and the Messengers are truth, then I have perished and am in loss. However, if the Messengers are false then it does not matter, and I am saved. Consequently, `Ali (AS) said: Our Lord, the Most Holy, Blessed and Exalted be He, is Elevated, and Great. We bear witness that He is the Ever-Lasting who does not decline. We do not doubt in Him, and there is nothing whatsoever like Him, and He is All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. And we bear witness that the Book is truth, the Messengers are truth, and that the reward of Allah and the wrath of Allah are true. Thus, if you are given faith, or faith is taken away from you, then that is Allahâ€™s prerogative. If He wishes to bless you, He will and if He does not wish to, He will not. Nonetheless, I will clarify the issues in which you doubt. There is no strength or power but Allah. If Allah intends good for you, He will grant you guidance through His Knowledge and keep you firm in faith. However, if He wishes evil for you, then certainly you have gone astray and you have perished. As for His Statement: â€œThey forgot Allah so He has forgotten them,â€ Verily, that means â€œthey forgot Allah in this world.â€ Since they do not obey Him in this world, He has forgotten them in the Hereafter. In other words, He will not reward them. As such, they have been excluded from good. Similar is the explanation of His Word, the Mighty and High â€œSo today We forget them, as they forgot the meeting of this day of theirs.â€ What He means by â€œthe forgettingâ€ is that He will not reward them like He rewards His Beloved Ones who were obedient to Him in this world, and who remembered Him by professing faith in Him and in His Messengers, and who feared Him in secret. As for His word: â€œAnd you Lord id not forgetfulâ€ it means that our Lord, the Blessed and Exalted, the Elevated, and the Great, is not forgetful or neglectful, rather, He is the Protecting, the All-Knowing. The Arabs say about forgetfulness: â€œSo and so has forgotten us,â€ i.e. he does not wish good for us not does he remember us with goodness. As a result, have you understood what Allah, the Mighty and High, has mentioned? The man replied, â€œVerily, you have comforted me. May Allah comfort you! You have resolved my problem. May Allah increase your reward! The Imam (AS) continued, As for His Word: â€œThe Day on which the spirit and the angels shall stand in ranks; they shall not speak except he whom the Most Compassionate God permits and who speaks the right thing,â€ and His Word: â€œBy Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheists,â€ and His Word: â€œOn the Resurrection Day some of you shall deny others, and some of you shall curse others,â€ and His Word: â€œThat most surely is the truth: the contending one with another of the inmates of the fire,â€ and His Word: â€œDo not quarrel in My Presence, and indeed I gave you the threatening beforehand.â€ And he says: â€œWe will set a seal upon their mouths, and their hand shall speak to Us, and their feet shall bear witness of what they earned.â€ Verily, these events take place at different times and at different places on the Day that will last fifty thousand years. Allah, the Mighty and High, will bring forth all the creations that Day in different places. Some will speak to others, and some of whom will seek forgiveness for others. They are the obedient ones, and followers of the (righteous) leaders in this world. The disobedient ones will curse. They are the ones who incited hatred, and engaged in oppression and aggression on worldly abode. The empowered ones and the weak ones will deny each other and curse each other. The denial [kufr] in this verse refers to immunity. He is that â€œsome of them shall grant immunity to others.â€ It is like the statement of Satan in surah â€œAbraham: â€Verily, I disbelievers in your associating me with Allah before; and the statement of Ibrahim (AS) the Friend of Allah: We renounce you, i.e. we disassociate ourselves for you. Then they will unite in another place where they will cry. If those screams arise for the people of this world, they would certainly startle all of the creation from their livelihood, and their hearts would crack except what Allah wills. Hence, they shall continue to weep bold. Then they will unite in another place where they will be made to speak and say: â€œBy Allah, our Lord, we were not polytheists.â€ Therefore, Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, will set a seal upon their mouths, and their hands, feet and skins will be made to speak. So they will witness every sin which they did with these parts. Then the seal from their tongues will be raised so they will say to their skins: Why have you borne witness against us? They shall say: Allah who makes everything speak has made us speak. Then they unite in another place and will be made to speak, but they will escape from one another. This is the meaning of the Word of the Mighty and High: The day on which a man shall fly from his brother, and his mother and his father, and his spouse and his son. Thus, they will seek to speak but no one shall speak except for whom the Beneficent permits and who speaks the right thing. At this point the Messengers, blessings of Allah be upon them, shall rise and bear witness, to the Word of Allah: How will it be, then, when We bring from every people a witness and bring you as a witness against these? Then they will meet in another place, where there shall be the place of Muhammad (sw) and that is the Praised Position [almuqam al-mahmud]. Thus, he (sw) will praise Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, the way no one has praised Him before him. Then he (sw) will praise each and every angel. There shall not remain any angel that he will not have praised. Then he will praise the Messengers (AS) in such way that no one has done so before him. The he (sw) will praise every believing man and believing woman starting with the strictly veracious [siddiqin], the martyrs, and the pious ones [salihin]. Then all the inhabitants of the heavens and the earth will praise him as we see in the Word of Allah: Maybe your Lord will raise you to a praised position. Hence, blessed are those who have any allotment in that Position, and woe unto those who do not have any allotment or share in that Position. Then they will unite in another place, and some of them will vie the upper hand to others. This is all before the Accountability [al-hisab]. Thus, when one is taken to accountability then everyone shall be occupied with what they have before them. We ask Allah for the blessing of that Day. The man responded, â€œYou have comforted me, O Commander of the Faithful. May Allah comfort you! You have solved my problem. May Allah increase your reward!â€ The Imam (AS) then continued, As for the Word of the Mighty and High: â€œFaces on that day shall be bright, looking to their Lord,â€ and His Word: â€œVision comprehends Him not, and He comprehends (ALL) vision;â€ and His Word: â€œand verily he saw him in another descent, at the farthest lotustree;â€ and His Word also: â€œOn that day shall not intercession avail except of him whom the Most Compassionate Allah allows and whose word He is pleased with. He knows what is before them and what is behind them, while they do not comprehend it in knowledge.â€ As for His Word: â€œFaces on that day shall be bright, looking to their Lordâ€ then Verily, that is a place where the Beloved Ones of Allah, the Mighty and High, end up in after they have finished with the accountability to the river which is named al-Hayawan. They will wash in it and drink from it so their faces will be helped to shine. Hence, every floating impurity and difficulty will vanish from them. Then they will be ordered to enter Paradise. From this position they will look at their Lord, how He rewards them and from there they will enter Paradise. That is the Word of the Mighty and High about the salutation of the angels unto them: Peace be on you, you shall be happy; therefore, enter it to abide. At that point, they will be certain of entering Paradise and looking at what their Lord had promised them. Thus, that is the Word of Allah: â€œlooking to their Lord.â€ Verily, what is meant by â€œlooking at Himâ€ here is â€œlooking at the reward of the Blessed and Exalted.â€ As for His Word: â€œVision comprehends Him not, and He comprehends visionâ€ then it is just as He said: â€œvision comprehends Him not,â€ i.e. the imaginations cannot encompass him. â€œHe comprehends visionâ€ i.e. He encompasses vision â€œand He is the Knower of subtleties, the Aware.â€ That is the praise with which our Lord, the Blessed and Exalted, has eulogized and extolled Himself, the Elevated, the High. Musa (AS) asked and the praise of Allah, the Mighty and High, flowed over his tongue: My Lord! Show me (Thyself), so that I may look upon Thee. Thus, his question was a great matter and he had asked for a body matter and, hence, was inflicted. So Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, said: you will not see me in this world until you die, then you will see Me in the Hereafter. However, if you intend to see me in this world then look at the mountain, if it remains firm in its place, then will you see Me; therefore, Allah, glory be Him, expressed some of His signs and our Lord manifested to the mountain, the mountain had crumbled and had become dust and Musa fell down in a swoon; i.e. he had died. Thus, his infliction was the death, and then he was brought back to life by Allah and he recovered, he returned and said: Glory be to Thee, I turn to Thee, and I am the first of the Believers, i.e. the first who believed in You and who never say You. As for His Word: And verily he saw him in another descent, at the farthest lotus-tree; i.e. Muhammad (sw) was at the farthest lotus-tree, as no creation from the creation of Allah crosses that position. And Allahâ€™s Word a the end of the verse: The eye did not turn aside, nor did it exceed the limit, certainly he saw of the greatest signs of his Lord. He (sw) saw Jibraâ€™il (AS) in his true form twice, at this time, and at another time. Jibraâ€™il is enormous. He is one of the holy ones [rawhaniyin] whose creation and description cannot be perceived except by Allah, the Lord of the Universe. As for His Word: On that Day shall no intercession avail except of him whom the Most Compassionate Allah allows and whose word He is pleased with. He knows what is before them and what is behind them, while they do no comprehend it in knowledge.
