The days change, but the people are as Adam.", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 566, "bookId": "Al-Amali-Saduq", "book": "Al-AmÄlÄ«", "category": "Content", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "The Fifty-Sixth Assembly, the Assembly of Tuesday, the 8th of the Month of Rabi` al-Akhir, 368 AH.", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Bilal Muhammad", "englishText": "Ahmad b. `Ali b. Ibrahim (ra) narrated to us. He said: My father narrated to me from his father Ibrahim b. Hashim from Muhammad b. Abi `Umayr from Hisham b. al-Hakam. Abu Shakir al-Disani visited Abi `Abdillah al-Sadiq (as) and said to him: You are one of the shining stars, your forefathers were brilliant full moons, your foremothers were great intellectuals, and your origins are the most noble of origins. When the scholars are mentioned, you surpass the ranks. So, inform me, O riffling ocean, what is the proof that the world was created? So, al-Sadiq (as) said to him: The nearest of things proves this. He said: And what is it? He said: So, al-Sadiq (as) called for an egg and placed it on his palm. Then, he said: This is a well-protected fortress. Inside it is a thin shell, within which flows liquid silver and liquid gold. Then, it splits open in the form of a peacock. Did anything enter it? He said: No. He said: So, this is a proof for the creation of the world. He said: You have informed me succinctly, and you have told me beautifully. I have learned that we only accept what our visions comprehend, what our ears hear, what our hands feel, what our noses smell, what our mouths taste, or what our hearts imagine or perceive with certainty. So, al-Sadiq (as): You mentioned the five senses, and they do not help anything without a proof, just as the darkness is not cut off without a sunrise.", "arabicText": "5 - Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ø¥Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù‡ÙŠÙ… (Ø±Ø¶ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù†Ù‡)ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ø¨ÙŠØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠÙ‡ Ø¥Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù‡ÙŠÙ… Ø¨Ù† Ù‡Ø§Ø´Ù…ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ Ø¹Ù…ÙŠØ±ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ù‡Ø´Ø§Ù… Ø¨Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙƒÙ…ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø¯Ø®Ù„ Ø£Ø¨Ùˆ Ø´Ø§ÙƒØ± Ø§Ù„Ø¯ÙŠØµØ§Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„ØµØ§Ø¯Ù‚ (Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…)ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ù„Ù‡: Ø¥Ù†Ùƒ Ø£Ø­Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¬ÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø²ÙˆØ§Ù‡Ø±ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ§Ù† Ø¢Ø¨Ø§Ø¤Ùƒ Ø¨Ø¯ÙˆØ±Ø§ Ø¨ÙˆØ§Ù‡Ø±ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù…Ù‡Ø§ØªÙƒ Ø¹Ù‚ÙŠÙ„Ø§Øª Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ù‡Ø± (4)ØŒ ÙˆØ¹Ù†ØµØ±Ùƒ Ù…Ù† Ø£ÙƒØ±Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù†Ø§ØµØ±ØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ø°Ø§ Ø°ÙƒØ± Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§Ø¡ ÙØ¨Ùƒ ØªØ«Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù†Ø§ØµØ±ØŒ ÙØ®Ø¨Ø±Ù†ÙŠ Ø£ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø­Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø¶Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø²Ø§Ø®Ø±ØŒ Ù…Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù„ÙŠÙ„ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø­Ø¯Ø« Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ù„Ù…ØŸ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„ØµØ§Ø¯Ù‚ (Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…): ÙŠØ³ØªØ¯Ù„ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø¨Ø£Ù‚Ø±Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø´ÙŠØ§Ø¡ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ù‡ÙˆØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ¯Ø¹Ø§ Ø§Ù„ØµØ§Ø¯Ù‚ (Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…) Ø¨Ø¨ÙŠØ¶Ø©ØŒ ÙÙˆØ¶Ø¹Ù‡Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø§Ø­ØªÙ‡ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø­ØµÙ† Ù…Ù„Ù…ÙˆÙ…ØŒ Ø¯Ø§Ø®Ù„Ù‡ ØºØ±Ù‚Ø¦ (1) Ø±Ù‚ÙŠÙ‚ØŒ ØªØ·ÙŠÙ Ø¨Ù‡ ÙØ¶Ø© Ø³Ø§Ø¦Ù„Ø©ØŒ ÙˆØ°Ù‡Ø¨Ø© Ù…Ø§Ø¦Ø¹Ø©ØŒ Ø«Ù… ØªÙ†ÙÙ„Ù‚ Ø¹Ù† Ù…Ø«Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø·Ø§ÙˆØ³ØŒ Ø£Ø¯Ø®Ù„Ù‡Ø§ Ø´Ø¦ØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ù„Ø§. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙÙ‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù„ÙŠÙ„ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø­Ø¯Ø« Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ù„Ù…. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø£Ø®Ø¨Ø±Øª ÙØ£ÙˆØ¬Ø²ØªØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ù„Øª ÙØ£Ø­Ø³Ù†ØªØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø¯ Ø¹Ù„Ù…Øª Ø£Ù†Ø§ Ù„Ø§ Ù†Ù‚Ø¨Ù„ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ø¯Ø±ÙƒÙ†Ø§Ù‡ Ø¨Ø£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø±Ù†Ø§ØŒ Ø£Ùˆ Ø³Ù…Ø¹Ù†Ø§Ù‡ Ø¨Ø¢Ø°Ø§Ù†Ù†Ø§ØŒ Ø£Ùˆ Ù„Ù…Ø³Ù†Ø§Ù‡ Ø¨Ø£ÙƒÙÙ†Ø§ØŒ Ø£Ùˆ Ø´Ù…Ù…Ù†Ø§Ù‡ Ø¨Ù…Ù†Ø§Ø®Ø±Ù†Ø§ØŒ Ø£Ùˆ Ø°Ù‚Ù†Ø§Ù‡ Ø¨Ø£ÙÙˆØ§Ù‡Ù†Ø§ØŒ Ø£Ùˆ ØªØµÙˆØ± ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ù„ÙˆØ¨ Ø¨ÙŠØ§Ù†Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ø³ØªÙ†Ø¨Ø·ØªÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±ÙˆØ§ÙŠØ§Øª Ø¥ÙŠÙ‚Ø§Ù†Ø§. ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„ØµØ§Ø¯Ù‚ (Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…): Ø°ÙƒØ±Øª Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙˆØ§Ø³ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù…Ø³ØŒ ÙˆÙ‡ÙŠ Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ†ÙØ¹ Ø´ÙŠØ¦Ø§ Ø¨ØºÙŠØ± Ø¯Ù„ÙŠÙ„ØŒ ÙƒÙ…Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ‚Ø·Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ø¸Ù„Ù…Ø© Ø¨ØºÙŠØ± Ù…ØµØ¨Ø§Ø­ (2).", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/29/1/56/4", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 56, "thaqalaynSanad": "Ahmad b. `Ali b. Ibrahim (ra) narrated to us. He said: My father narrated to me from his father Ibrahim b. Hashim from Muhammad b. Abi `Umayr from Hisham b. al-Hakam.", "thaqalaynMatn": " Abu Shakir al-Disani visited Abi `Abdillah al-Sadiq (as) and said to him: You are one of the shining stars, your forefathers were brilliant full moons, your foremothers were great intellectuals, and your origins are the most noble of origins. When the scholars are mentioned, you surpass the ranks. So, inform me, O riffling ocean, what is the proof that the world was created? So, al-Sadiq (as) said to him: The nearest of things proves this. He said: And what is it? He said: So, al-Sadiq (as) called for an egg and placed it on his palm. Then, he said: This is a well-protected fortress. Inside it is a thin shell, within which flows liquid silver and liquid gold. Then, it splits open in the form of a peacock. Did anything enter it? He said: No. He said: So, this is a proof for the creation of the world. He said: You have informed me succinctly, and you have told me beautifully. I have learned that we only accept what our visions comprehend, what our ears hear, what our hands feel, what our noses smell, what our mouths taste, or what our hearts imagine or perceive with certainty. So, al-Sadiq (as): You mentioned the five senses, and they do not help anything without a proof, just as the darkness is not cut off without a sunrise.", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 390, "bookId": "Al-Amali-Saduq", "book": "Al-AmÄlÄ«", "category": "Content", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "The Forty-Fifth Assembly, the Assembly of Friday, Two Nights Remaining from Safar, 368 AH.", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Bilal Muhammad", "englishText": "Ahmad b. al-Hasan b. al-Qattan narrated to us. He said: Abuâ€™l `Abbas Ahmad b. Yahya b. Zakariyya narrated to us. He said: Muhammad b. Isma`il narrated to us. He said: `Abdullah b. Muhammad narrated to us. He said: My father narrated to us from Sa`id b. Muslim the servant of Bani Makhzum from Sa`id b. Abi Salih from his father from Ibn `Abbas. He said: I heard my father al-`Abbas narrate, saying: When `Abdullah was born to `Abd al-Muttalib, we saw an illuminating light in his face, like the light of the Sun. So, my father said: This boy will have an exalted matter. He said: So, I saw in my dream that a white bird emerged from his nose, flew, and reached the East and the West. Then, it returned and perched on the roof of the Ka`ba. Then, all the people of Quraysh prostrated towards it and began to gaze at it in amazement. There was a light between heaven and Earth, and it stretched until it reached the East and the West. \u003Cbr\u003EWhen I regained consciousness, I asked a soothsayer from Bani Makhzum [about it]. She said: O `Abbas! If you are telling the truth, then a child from his loins will be followed by the people of the East and the West. My father said: So, I was worried about the matter of `Abdullah until he married Amina. She was of the most beautiful women of Quraysh, and the most perfect of them in character. When `Abdullah died and Amina gave birth to the Messenger of Allah (sw), I went to him. I saw a light illuminating from his forehead. I held him and studied his facial features. I found the fragrance of musk coming from him. It was as though I was a bag of musk due to the intensity of the fragrance left on me. \u003Cbr\u003EAmina said to me: When I went into labour, I heard noises and words that did not resemble the words of humans. I saw a brocade flag on a ruby pole that filled that which was between heaven and Earth. I saw a light dazzling from his head that reached the sky. It was as though I saw the palaces of the Levant engulfed in light. I saw great birds spreading their wings around me. I saw a houri passing by and saying: â€œAmina! You did not find oracles nor idols with your son!â€ I saw a young man who was the tallest of the people, the fairest of them, and the most beautiful of them in clothing. I thought it was `Abd al-Muttalib. He approached me and held the newborn. He suckled him with his tongue. He had a tray of gold with him which was studded with emeralds and a comb of gold. He cut open his belly and took out his heart. Then, he cut it open and took out a dark spot and threw it out. Then, he took a green silk bag and opened it. He took what looked like a white powder from it. Then, he filled up the heart with this powder and placed the heart back into its place. Then he stroked the childâ€™s stomach and spoke to him. The infant spoke [back]. \u003Cbr\u003EI did not understand anything except that he said: â€œ[Farewell] in the safety, protection, and security of Allah. I have filled your heart with faith, knowledge, forbearance, certainty, intellect, and valour. You are the best of humans. Blessed are those who follow you, and woe to those who turn away from you.â€ Then, he took out another bag which was made of white brocade. From that, he removed a seal and imprinted it between his shoulders. Then, he said: â€œMy Lord has commanded me to breathe from the Holy Spirit into you.â€ So, he breathed into him, and gowned him in a shirt, and said: â€œThis is your protection from the troubles of this world.â€ This is what I saw, `Abbas, with my eyes. So, al-`Abbas said: That day, I was reading. I took off his robe, and I saw the Seal of Prophecy between his shoulders. I kept his matter a secret. I forgot this and did not remember it until the day I accepted Islam and the Messenger of Allah (sw) reminded me of it.", "arabicText": "2 - Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø·Ø§Ù†ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ø¨Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø³ Ø£Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† ÙŠØ­ÙŠÙ‰ Ø¨Ù† Ø²ÙƒØ±ÙŠØ§ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø¥Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¹ÙŠÙ„ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ù† Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ø¨ÙŠØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø³Ø¹ÙŠØ¯ Ø¨Ù† Ù…Ø³Ù„Ù… Ù…ÙˆÙ„Ù‰ Ù„Ø¨Ù†ÙŠ Ù…Ø®Ø²ÙˆÙ…ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø³Ø¹ÙŠØ¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ ØµØ§Ù„Ø­ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø³ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø³Ù…Ø¹Øª Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø³ ÙŠØ­Ø¯Ø«ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙˆÙ„Ø¯ Ù„Ø§Ø¨ÙŠ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø·Ù„Ø¨ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙØ±Ø£ÙŠÙ†Ø§ ÙÙŠ ÙˆØ¬Ù‡Ù‡ Ù†ÙˆØ±Ø§ ÙŠØ²Ù‡Ø± (3) ÙƒÙ†ÙˆØ± Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù…Ø³ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ: Ø¥Ù† Ù„Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„ØºÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø´Ø£Ù†Ø§ Ø¹Ø¸ÙŠÙ…Ø§. Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙØ±Ø£ÙŠØª ÙÙŠ Ù…Ù†Ø§Ù…ÙŠ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ø®Ø±Ø¬ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ù†Ø®Ø±Ù‡ Ø·Ø§Ø¦Ø± Ø£Ø¨ÙŠØ¶ØŒ ÙØ·Ø§Ø± ÙØ¨Ù„Øº Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø´Ø±Ù‚ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…ØºØ±Ø¨ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ø±Ø¬Ø¹ Ø±Ø§Ø¬Ø¹Ø§ Ø­ØªÙ‰ Ø³Ù‚Ø· Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø¨ÙŠØª Ø§Ù„ÙƒØ¹Ø¨Ø©ØŒ ÙØ³Ø¬Ø¯Øª Ù„Ù‡ Ù‚Ø±ÙŠØ´ ÙƒÙ„Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ÙØ¨ÙŠÙ†Ù…Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø³ ÙŠØªØ£Ù…Ù„ÙˆÙ†Ù‡ Ø¥Ø° ØµØ§Ø± Ù†ÙˆØ±Ø§ Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§Ø±Ø¶ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù…ØªØ¯ Ø­ØªÙ‰ Ø¨Ù„Øº Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø´Ø±Ù‚ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…ØºØ±Ø¨. ÙÙ„Ù…Ø§ Ø§Ù†ØªØ¨Ù‡Øª Ø³Ø£Ù„Øª ÙƒØ§Ù‡Ù†Ø© Ø¨Ù†ÙŠ Ù…Ø®Ø²ÙˆÙ… ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù„Øª: ÙŠØ§ Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø³ØŒ Ù„Ø¦Ù† ØµØ¯Ù‚Øª Ø±Ø¤ÙŠØ§Ùƒ Ù„ÙŠØ®Ø±Ø¬Ù† Ù…Ù† ØµÙ„Ø¨Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„Ø¯ ÙŠØµÙŠØ± Ø£Ù‡Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø´Ø±Ù‚ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…ØºØ±Ø¨ ØªØ¨Ø¹Ø§ Ù„Ù‡. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ: ÙÙ‡Ù…Ù†ÙŠ Ø£Ù…Ø± Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù† ØªØ²ÙˆØ¬ Ø¨Ø¢Ù…Ù†Ø©ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ§Ù†Øª Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø¬Ù…Ù„ Ù†Ø³Ø§Ø¡ Ù‚Ø±ÙŠØ´ØŒ ÙˆØ£ØªÙ…Ù‡Ø§ Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ø§ØŒ ÙÙ„Ù…Ø§ Ù…Ø§Øª Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆÙˆÙ„Ø¯Øª Ø¢Ù…Ù†Ø© Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ (ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡) Ø£ØªÙŠØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙØ±Ø£ÙŠØª Ø§Ù„Ù†ÙˆØ± Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ø¹ÙŠÙ†ÙŠÙ‡ ÙŠØ²Ù‡Ø±ØŒ ÙØ­Ù…Ù„ØªÙ‡ ÙˆØªÙØ±Ø³Øª ÙÙŠ ÙˆØ¬Ù‡Ù‡ØŒ ÙÙˆØ¬Ø¯Øª Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ø±ÙŠØ­ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³ÙƒØŒ ÙˆØµØ±Øª ÙƒØ£Ù†ÙŠ Ù‚Ø·Ø¹Ø© Ù…Ø³Ùƒ Ù…Ù† Ø´Ø¯Ø© Ø±ÙŠØ­ÙŠØŒ ÙØ­Ø¯Ø«ØªÙ†ÙŠ Ø¢Ù…Ù†Ø© ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„Øª Ù„ÙŠ: Ø¥Ù†Ù‡ Ù„Ù…Ø§ Ø£Ø®Ø°Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø·Ù„Ù‚ ÙˆØ§Ø´ØªØ¯ Ø¨ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù…Ø±ØŒ Ø³Ù…Ø¹Øª Ø¬Ù„Ø¨Ø© (1) ÙˆÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø¨Ù‡ ÙƒÙ„Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ø¯Ù…ÙŠÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆØ±Ø£ÙŠØª Ø¹Ù„Ù…Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø³Ù†Ø¯Ø³ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù‚Ø¶ÙŠØ¨ Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ§Ù‚ÙˆØª Ù‚Ø¯ Ø¶Ø±Ø¨ Ø¨ÙŠÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§Ø±Ø¶ØŒ ÙˆØ±Ø£ÙŠØª Ù†ÙˆØ±Ø§ ÙŠØ³Ø·Ø¹ Ù…Ù† Ø±Ø£Ø³Ù‡ Ø­ØªÙ‰ Ø¨Ù„Øº Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙˆØ±Ø£ÙŠØª Ù‚ØµÙˆØ± Ø§Ù„Ø´Ø§Ù…Ø§Øª ÙƒØ£Ù†Ù‡Ø§ Ø´Ø¹Ù„Ø© Ù†Ø§Ø± Ù†ÙˆØ±Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ±Ø£ÙŠØª Ø­ÙˆÙ„ÙŠ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø·Ø§Ø© Ø£Ù…Ø±Ø§ Ø¹Ø¸ÙŠÙ…Ø§ØŒ Ù‚Ø¯ Ù†Ø´Ø±Øª Ø£Ø¬Ù†Ø­ØªÙ‡Ø§ Ø­ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØŒ ÙˆØ±Ø£ÙŠØª Ø´Ø¹ÙŠØ±Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø³Ø¯ÙŠØ© Ù‚Ø¯ Ù…Ø±Øª ÙˆÙ‡ÙŠ ØªÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: Ø¢Ù…Ù†Ø©ØŒ Ù…Ø§ Ù„Ù‚ÙŠØª Ø§Ù„ÙƒÙ‡Ø§Ù† ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§ØµÙ†Ø§Ù… Ù…Ù† ÙˆÙ„Ø¯Ùƒ! ÙˆØ±Ø£ÙŠØª Ø±Ø¬Ù„Ø§ Ø´Ø§Ø¨Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£ØªÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø³ Ø·ÙˆÙ„Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ø´Ø¯Ù‡Ù… Ø¨ÙŠØ§Ø¶Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ø­Ø³Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø«ÙŠØ§Ø¨Ø§ØŒ Ù…Ø§ Ø¸Ù†Ù†ØªÙ‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø·Ù„Ø¨ØŒ Ù‚Ø¯ Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ù†ÙŠ ÙØ£Ø®Ø° Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆÙ„ÙˆØ¯ØŒ ÙØªÙÙ„ ÙÙŠ ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø¹Ù‡ Ø·Ø³Øª Ù…Ù† Ø°Ù‡Ø¨ Ù…Ø¶Ø±ÙˆØ¨ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø²Ù…Ø±Ø¯ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø´Ø· Ù…Ù† Ø°Ù‡Ø¨ØŒ ÙØ´Ù‚ Ø¨Ø·Ù†Ù‡ Ø´Ù‚Ø§ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ø£Ø®Ø±Ø¬ Ù‚Ù„Ø¨Ù‡ ÙØ´Ù‚Ù‡ØŒ ÙØ£Ø®Ø±Ø¬ Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ù†ÙƒØªØ© Ø³ÙˆØ¯Ø§Ø¡ ÙØ±Ù…Ù‰ Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ø£Ø®Ø±Ø¬ ØµØ±Ø© Ù…Ù† Ø­Ø±ÙŠØ±Ø© Ø®Ø¶Ø±Ø§Ø¡ ÙÙØªØ­Ù‡Ø§ØŒ ÙØ¥Ø°Ø§ ÙÙŠÙ‡Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù„Ø°Ø±ÙŠØ±Ø© (2) Ø§Ù„Ø¨ÙŠØ¶Ø§Ø¡ ÙØ­Ø´Ø§Ù‡ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ø±Ø¯Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù†ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø³Ø­ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø¨Ø·Ù†Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ø³ØªÙ†Ø·Ù‚Ù‡ ÙÙ†Ø·Ù‚ØŒ ÙÙ„Ù… Ø£ÙÙ‡Ù… Ù…Ø§ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ØŒ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙÙŠ Ø£Ù…Ø§Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ­ÙØ¸Ù‡ ÙˆÙƒÙ„Ø§Ø¡ØªÙ‡ØŒ Ù‚Ø¯ Ø­Ø´ÙˆØª Ù‚Ù„Ø¨Ùƒ Ø¥ÙŠÙ…Ø§Ù†Ø§ ÙˆØ¹Ù„Ù…Ø§ ÙˆØ­Ù„Ù…Ø§ ÙˆÙŠÙ‚ÙŠÙ†Ø§ ÙˆØ¹Ù‚Ù„Ø§ ÙˆØ´Ø¬Ø§Ø¹Ø©ØŒ Ø£Ù†Øª Ø®ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø´Ø±ØŒ Ø·ÙˆØ¨Ù‰ Ù„Ù…Ù† Ø§ØªØ¨Ø¹ÙƒØŒ ÙˆÙˆÙŠÙ„ Ù„Ù…Ù† ØªØ®Ù„Ù Ø¹Ù†Ùƒ. Ø«Ù… Ø£Ø®Ø±Ø¬ ØµØ±Ø© Ø£Ø®Ø±Ù‰ Ù…Ù† Ø­Ø±ÙŠØ±Ø© Ø¨ÙŠØ¶Ø§Ø¡ ÙÙØªØ­Ù‡Ø§ ÙØ¥Ø°Ø§ ÙÙŠÙ‡Ø§ Ø®Ø§ØªÙ…ØŒ ÙØ¶Ø±Ø¨ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ÙƒØªÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø£Ù…Ø±Ù†ÙŠ Ø±Ø¨ÙŠ Ø£Ù† Ø£Ù†ÙØ® ÙÙŠÙƒ Ù…Ù† Ø±ÙˆØ­ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯Ø³. ÙÙ†ÙØ® ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù„Ø¨Ø³Ù‡ Ù‚Ù…ÙŠØµØ§ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„: Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø£Ù…Ø§Ù†Ùƒ Ù…Ù† Ø¢ÙØ§Øª Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§. ÙÙ‡Ø°Ø§ Ù…Ø§ Ø±Ø£ÙŠØª - ÙŠØ§ Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø³ - Ø¨Ø¹ÙŠÙ†ÙŠ. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø³: ÙˆØ£Ù†Ø§ ÙŠÙˆÙ…Ø¦Ø° Ø£Ù‚Ø±Ø£ØŒ ÙÙƒØ´ÙØª Ø¹Ù† Ø«ÙˆØ¨Ù‡ØŒ ÙØ¥Ø°Ø§ Ø®Ø§ØªÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¨ÙˆØ© Ø¨ÙŠÙ† ÙƒØªÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ ÙÙ„Ù… Ø£Ø²Ù„ Ø£ÙƒØªÙ… Ø´Ø£Ù†Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù†Ø³ÙŠØª Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø¯ÙŠØ« ÙÙ„Ù… Ø£Ø°ÙƒØ±Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ ÙŠÙˆÙ… Ø¥Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…ÙŠ Ø­ØªÙ‰ Ø°ÙƒØ±Ù†ÙŠ Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ (ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡) (1).", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/29/1/45/2", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 45, "thaqalaynSanad": "Ahmad b. al-Hasan b. al-Qattan narrated to us. He said: Abuâ€™l `Abbas Ahmad b. Yahya b. Zakariyya narrated to us. He said: Muhammad b. Isma`il narrated to us. He said: `Abdullah b. Muhammad narrated to us. He said: I heard my father al-`Abbas narrate, saying:", "thaqalaynMatn": " When `Abdullah was born to `Abd al-Muttalib, we saw an illuminating light in his face, like the light of the Sun. So, my father said: This boy will have an exalted matter. He said: So, I saw in my dream that a white bird emerged from his nose, flew, and reached the East and the West. Then, it returned and perched on the roof of the Ka`ba. Then, all the people of Quraysh prostrated towards it and began to gaze at it in amazement. There was a light between heaven and Earth, and it stretched until it reached the East and the West. \u003Cbr\u003EWhen I regained consciousness, I asked a soothsayer from Bani Makhzum [about it]. She said: O `Abbas! If you are telling the truth, then a child from his loins will be followed by the people of the East and the West. My father said: So, I was worried about the matter of `Abdullah until he married Amina. She was of the most beautiful women of Quraysh, and the most perfect of them in character. When `Abdullah died and Amina gave birth to the Messenger of Allah (sw), I went to him. I saw a light illuminating from his forehead. I held him and studied his facial features. I found the fragrance of musk coming from him. It was as though I was a bag of musk due to the intensity of the fragrance left on me. \u003Cbr\u003EAmina said to me: When I went into labour, I heard noises and words that did not resemble the words of humans. I saw a brocade flag on a ruby pole that filled that which was between heaven and Earth. I saw a light dazzling from his head that reached the sky. It was as though I saw the palaces of the Levant engulfed in light. I saw great birds spreading their wings around me. I saw a houri passing by and saying: â€œAmina! You did not find oracles nor idols with your son!â€ I saw a young man who was the tallest of the people, the fairest of them, and the most beautiful of them in clothing. I thought it was `Abd al-Muttalib. He approached me and held the newborn. He suckled him with his tongue. He had a tray of gold with him which was studded with emeralds and a comb of gold. He cut open his belly and took out his heart. Then, he cut it open and took out a dark spot and threw it out. Then, he took a green silk bag and opened it. He took what looked like a white powder from it. Then, he filled up the heart with this powder and placed the heart back into its place. Then he stroked the childâ€™s stomach and spoke to him. The infant spoke [back]. \u003Cbr\u003EI did not understand anything except that he said: â€œ[Farewell] in the safety, protection, and security of Allah. I have filled your heart with faith, knowledge, forbearance, certainty, intellect, and valour. You are the best of humans. Blessed are those who follow you, and woe to those who turn away from you.â€ Then, he took out another bag which was made of white brocade. From that, he removed a seal and imprinted it between his shoulders. Then, he said: â€œMy Lord has commanded me to breathe from the Holy Spirit into you.â€ So, he breathed into him, and gowned him in a shirt, and said: â€œThis is your protection from the troubles of this world.â€ This is what I saw, `Abbas, with my eyes. So, al-`Abbas said: That day, I was reading. I took off his robe, and I saw the Seal of Prophecy between his shoulders. I kept his matter a secret. I forgot this and did not remember it until the day I accepted Islam and the Messenger of Allah (sw) reminded me of it.", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 455, "bookId": "Al-Amali-Saduq", "book": "Al-AmÄlÄ«", "category": "Content", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "The Forty-Eighth Assembly, the Assembly of Tuesday, the Ninth of the Month of Rabi` al-Awwal, 368 AH.", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Bilal Muhammad", "englishText": "Al-Husayn b. Ahmad b. Idris (rh) narrated to us. He said: My father (rh) narrated to us from Ibrahim b. Hashim from Isma`il b. Marrar from Yunus b. `Abd al-Rahman from `Abdullah b. Sinan from al-Sadiq Ja`far b. Muhammad (as). He said: There are five things without which one will not find much satisfaction. It was said: What are they, O son of the Messenger of Allah? He said: (1) religion, (2) intellect, (3) modesty, (4) beautiful character, and (5) beautiful manners. There are also five things without which one will not find livelihood: (1) health, (2) security, (3) needlessness, (4) contentment, and (5) amiable correspondence.", "arabicText": "15 - Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³ÙŠÙ† Ø¨Ù† Ø£Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø¥Ø¯Ø±ÙŠØ³ (Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡)ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ø¨ÙŠØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø¥Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù‡ÙŠÙ… Ø¨Ù† Ù‡Ø§Ø´Ù…ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø¥Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¹ÙŠÙ„ Ø¨Ù† Ù…Ø±Ø§Ø±ØŒ Ø¹Ù† ÙŠÙˆÙ†Ø³ Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù†ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¨Ù† Ø³Ù†Ø§Ù†ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„ØµØ§Ø¯Ù‚ Ø¬Ø¹ÙØ± Ø¨Ù† Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ (Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…)ØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø®Ù…Ø³ Ù…Ù† Ù„Ù… ØªÙƒÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙƒÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡ ÙƒØ«ÙŠØ± Ù…Ø³ØªÙ…ØªØ¹. Ù‚ÙŠÙ„: ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ù‡Ù†ØŒ ÙŠØ§ Ø¨Ù† Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø§Ù„Ø¯ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ù‚Ù„ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø­ÙŠØ§Ø¡ØŒ ÙˆØ­Ø³Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ØŒ ÙˆØ­Ø³Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø¯Ø¨. ÙˆØ®Ù…Ø³ Ù…Ù† Ù„Ù… ØªÙƒÙ† ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ù„Ù… ÙŠØªÙ‡Ù† Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¹ÙŠØ´: Ø§Ù„ØµØ­Ø©ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§Ù…Ù†ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„ØºÙ†Ù‰ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù‚Ù†Ø§Ø¹Ø©ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§Ù†ÙŠØ³ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§ÙÙ‚ (2).", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/29/1/48/14", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 48, "thaqalaynSanad": "Al-Husayn b. Ahmad b. Idris (rh) narrated to us. He said: My father (rh) narrated to us from Ibrahim b. Hashim from Isma`il b. Marrar from Yunus b. `Abd al-Rahman from `Abdullah b. Sinan from al-Sadiq Ja`far b. Muhammad (as). He said: ", "thaqalaynMatn": "There are five things without which one will not find much satisfaction. It was said: What are they, O son of the Messenger of Allah? He said: (1) religion, (2) intellect, (3) modesty, (4) beautiful character, and (5) beautiful manners. There are also five things without which one will not find livelihood: (1) health, (2) security, (3) needlessness, (4) contentment, and (5) amiable correspondence.", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 401, "bookId": "Al-Amali-Saduq", "book": "Al-AmÄlÄ«", "category": "Content", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "The Forty-Fifth Assembly, the Assembly of Friday, Two Nights Remaining from Safar, 368 AH.", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Bilal Muhammad", "englishText": "Al-Husayn b. Ahmad b. Idris (rh) narrated to us. He said: My father narrated to us from Ahmad b. Ja`far from his forefathers (as). He said: The Messenger of Allah (s) entered the mosque and found a group [sitting] around a man. So, he said: What is this? So, they said: An intellectual (`allamah). He said: What is an intellectual? They said: He is the most knowledgeable of the people in the lineages and anecdotes of the Arabs, the days of Jahiliyya, the poems, and Arabic (or rhetoric). Rizvi", "englishText": "H 128 - It is narrated from Saad bin Abdullah from Abu Muhammad Husain bin Isa Alawi from his father, Isa bin Muhammad from his father, Muhammad bin Ali bin Jaâ€™far from his father, Ali bin Jaâ€™far from his brother, Musa bin Jaâ€™far that he said: My father [Imam Jaâ€™far Sadiq (a.s)] said: â€œMy son, when the fifth descendant of the seventh Imam disappears, then by Allah, by Allah, be cautious about your faith, because definitely there such is a occultation for this Patron until many who believe in this matter turn away from their beliefs. ÙŠØ§ Ø¨Ù†ÙŠØŒØ¥Ù†Ù…Ø§ Ù‡ÙŠ Ù…Ø­Ù†Ø© Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù…ØªØ­Ù† Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ Ù„Ùˆ Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø¢Ø¨Ø§Ø¤ÙƒÙ… ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø¯Ø§Ø¯ÙƒÙ… Ø¯ÙŠÙ†Ø§ Ø£ØµØ­ Ù…Ù† Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø¯ÙŠÙ† Ù„Ø§ØªØ¨Ø¹ÙˆÙ‡. Ù‚Ø§Ù„ Ø£Ø¨Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ù†: ÙÙ‚Ù„Øª Ù„Ù‡: ÙŠØ§ Ø³ÙŠØ¯ÙŠØŒ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø§Ù…Ø³ Ù…Ù† ÙˆÙ„Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø§Ø¨Ø¹ØŸ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ÙŠØ§ Ø¨Ù†ÙŠØŒ Ø¹Ù‚ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ… ØªØµØºØ± Ø¹Ù† Ù‡Ø°Ø§ ÙˆØ£Ø­Ù„Ø§Ù…ÙƒÙ… ØªØ¶ÙŠÙ‚ Ø¹Ù† Ø­Ù…Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ† Ø¥Ù† ØªØ¹ÙŠØ´ÙˆØ§ ØªØ¯Ø±ÙƒÙˆÙ‡.", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/27/1/27/16", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 27, "thaqalaynSanad": "H 128 - It is narrated from Saad bin Abdullah from Abu Muhammad Husain bin Isa Alawi from his father, Isa bin Muhammad from his father, Muhammad bin Ali bin Jaâ€™far from his father, Ali bin Jaâ€™far from his brother, Musa bin Jaâ€™far that he said:", "thaqalaynMatn": " My father [Imam Jaâ€™far Sadiq (a.s)] said: â€œMy son, when the fifth descendant of the seventh Imam disappears, then by Allah, by Allah, be cautious about your faith, because definitely there such is a occultation for this Patron until many who believe in this matter turn away from their beliefs. If your fathers and grandfathers knew a creed better than this, they would have followed it.â€ Ali bin Jaâ€™far said: Abul Hasan [Imam Musa Kadhim (a.s)] asked: â€œMy master, who is the fifth descendant of the seventh?â€ He said: â€œMy son, your intellects are deficient to understand him and you cannot bear it, but if you live, you will see that matter.â€", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 460, "bookId": "Kitab-al-Ghayba-Tusi", "book": "KitÄb al-Ghayba", "category": "Content", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "Epistles issued from Imam Mahdi (a.s)", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. al-á¸¤asan al-á¹¬Å«sÄ«", "translator": "Sayyid Athar Husain S. H. Rizvi", "englishText": "H 245 - Informed me a group of scholars from Abu Muhammad Talakbari from Ahmad bin Ali Raazi from Husain bin Ali Qummi that he said: Narrated to me Muhammad bin Ali bin Banan Talhi Aabi from Ali bin Muhammad bin Abduh Nishapuri: Narrated to me Ali bin Ibrahim Raazi that he said: A reliable Shaykh said in Baghdad that: Ibn Abi Ghanim Qazwini along with some Shia people had a difference of opinion regarding the successorship of His Eminence, Imam Hasan Askari (a.s). So much so that Qazwini denied the existence of His Eminence, the Awaited Imam (a.s). However, others stressed that the successor of His Eminence was present and he is His Eminence, Imam Mahdi (a.s). They wrote a letter to the Awaited Imam and related their discussion with Qazwini. His Eminence replied as follows: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful. May the Almighty Allah keep you and us safe from the mischiefs and may He bestow you and us with certainty and may He also protect you and us from bad consequences. Information regarding doubt and denial of a group from you in religion and matter of guardianship (Wilayat) has reached us. Our sorrow and anger is for you and not for our own selves, as the Almighty Allah is with us, therefore except for Him, we are not needful of anyone else and the truth is with us. Therefore, I am not afraid if someone turns away from us. And we are the first creations of our Lord and (other) creatures and people were created afterwards. And you, O people! Why have you fallen into doubt and bewilderment? Have you not heard the statement of Almighty Allah: â€œO you who believe! Obey Allah and obey the Apostle and those in authority from among youâ€¦â€ (4:59) Donâ€™t you know that it has come in traditional reports that unforeseen events had befallen the past and would befall the remaining Imams? Have you not seen how in all the times, the Almighty Allah had made a refuge for you to seek protection in? He appointed torches of guidance from the time of Adam (a.s) till Imam Hasan Askari (a.s) that you may obtain guidance and direction, in such a way that whenever a guide went away, another one took up his place and torch. When the Almighty Allah took away Imam Hasan Askari (a.s), do you think He has rendered His religion invalid and severed His relation with the creatures? Never! Till the Day of Judgment and the time of the issue of Allahâ€™s command, which is not in favor of the people, it cannot be thus. Indeed, His Eminence, Imam Hasan Askari (a.s) passed away with success and good fortune like his respected forefathers and in such a condition that his knowledge and will is present with us. And his successor would perform his functions. And except for an unjust criminal, no one has any dispute with us in this matter. And except for a denier disbeliever, no one claims this divine position of ours. And if it would not have rendered the command of Allah to be subverted and His secret had not been exposed, our right upon you would have become so clear that your intellects would have been amazed and your doubts and uncertainties would have disappeared. However, what Allah has willed, predestined and written would surely happen and nothing except that. Then fear Allah and submit to our affair, and leave this matter with us. And do not persist in seeking that which Allah has concealed and donâ€™t get deviated to the left and right. And make our right and illuminated path as the aim. Indeed, I wish for your well-being and Allah is witness upon you and me. If I had no affection for you and had not desired mercy and goodness for you, I would not have said anything to you. It is by way of trial and divine test for us that a misguided oppressor, without any right has become a prisoner of his selfish desires and usurped the right of others. Like the daughter of the Messenger of Allah, it is obligatory that I should be patient and in the end the ignorant and tyrant would see the consequences of his deeds. May Allah Almighty protect you and us from perditions, calamities and evils. And Allah is having authority and power on them and blessings and mercy of Allah be upon all the successors, saints and believers. And may Allah bless Muhammad, the Prophet, and his progeny and peace be upon them.", "arabicText": "245- Ø£Ø®Ø¨Ø±Ù†ÙŠ Ø¬Ù…Ø§Ø¹Ø©ØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØªÙ„Ø¹ÙƒØ¨Ø±ÙŠØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø£Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø§Ø²ÙŠØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³ÙŠÙ† Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ù…ÙŠØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ø¨Ù†Ø§Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø·Ù„Ø­ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ø¨ÙŠØŒ Ø¹Ù† Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¨Ù† Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù†ÙŠØ³Ø§Ø¨ÙˆØ±ÙŠØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ Ø¨Ù† Ø¥Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù‡ÙŠÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø§Ø²ÙŠØŒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„: Ø­Ø¯Ø«Ù†ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø´ÙŠØ® Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ«ÙˆÙ‚ Ø¨Ù‡ Ø¨Ù…Ø¯ÙŠÙ†Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ù‚Ø§Ù„: ØªØ´Ø§Ø¬Ø± Ø§Ø¨Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ ØºØ§Ù†Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø²ÙˆÙŠÙ†ÙŠ ÙˆØ¬Ù…Ø§Ø¹Ø© Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø´ÙŠØ¹Ø© ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„ÙØŒ ÙØ°ÙƒØ± Ø§Ø¨Ù† Ø£Ø¨ÙŠ ØºØ§Ù†Ù… Ø£Ù† Ø£Ø¨Ø§ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ù…Ø¶Ù‰ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ø®Ù„Ù Ù„Ù‡ØŒ Ø«Ù… Ø¥Ù†Ù‡Ù… ÙƒØªØ¨ÙˆØ§ ÙÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨Ø§ ÙˆØ£Ù†ÙØ°ÙˆÙ‡ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø­ÙŠØ©ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ø¹Ù„Ù…ÙˆÙ‡ Ø¨Ù…Ø§ ØªØ´Ø§Ø¬Ø±ÙˆØ§ ÙÙŠÙ‡ØŒ ÙÙˆØ±Ø¯ Ø¬ÙˆØ§Ø¨ ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨Ù‡Ù… Ø¨Ø®Ø·Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø¢Ø¨Ø§Ø¦Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…: Ø¨Ø³Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­ÙŠÙ…. Ø¹Ø§ÙØ§Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ¥ÙŠØ§ÙƒÙ… Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¶Ù„Ø§Ù„Ø© ÙˆØ§Ù„ÙØªÙ†ØŒ ÙˆÙˆÙ‡Ø¨ Ù„Ù†Ø§ ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ… Ø±ÙˆØ­ Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙ‚ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ø¬Ø§Ø±Ù†Ø§ ÙˆØ¥ÙŠØ§ÙƒÙ… Ù…Ù† Ø³ÙˆØ¡ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ù‚Ù„Ø¨ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ Ø£Ù†Ù‡ÙŠ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠ Ø§Ø±ØªÙŠØ§Ø¨ Ø¬Ù…Ø§Ø¹Ø© Ù…Ù†ÙƒÙ… ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¯ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø¯Ø®Ù„Ù‡Ù… Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø´Ùƒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø­ÙŠØ±Ø© ÙÙŠ ÙˆÙ„Ø§Ø© Ø£Ù…ÙˆØ±Ù‡Ù…ØŒ ÙØºÙ…Ù†Ø§ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù„ÙƒÙ… Ù„Ø§ Ù„Ù†Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ³Ø§Ø¡â€ŒÙ†Ø§ ÙÙŠÙƒÙ… Ù„Ø§ ÙÙŠÙ†Ø§ØŒ Ù„Ø§Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù…Ø¹Ù†Ø§ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙØ§Ù‚Ø© Ø¨Ù†Ø§ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ ØºÙŠØ±Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ Ù…Ø¹Ù†Ø§ ÙÙ„Ù† ÙŠÙˆØ­Ø´Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ù‚Ø¹Ø¯ Ø¹Ù†Ø§ØŒ ÙˆÙ†Ø­Ù† ØµÙ†Ø§Ø¦Ø¹ Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ ØµÙ†Ø§Ø¦Ø¹Ù†Ø§. ÙŠØ§ Ù‡Ø¤Ù„Ø§Ø¡! Ù…Ø§ Ù„ÙƒÙ… ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø±ÙŠØ¨ ØªØªØ±Ø¯Ø¯ÙˆÙ†ØŒ ÙˆÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙŠØ±Ø© ØªÙ†Ø¹ÙƒØ³ÙˆÙ†ØŸ Ø£Ùˆ Ù…Ø§ Ø³Ù…Ø¹ØªÙ… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ø² ÙˆØ¬Ù„ ÙŠÙ‚ÙˆÙ„: ï´¿ÙŠÙØ§ Ø£ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù‘ÙØ°ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø¢Ù…ÙÙ†ÙÙˆØ§ Ø£ÙØ·ÙÙŠØ¹ÙÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙØ£ÙØ·ÙÙŠØ¹ÙÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ³ÙÙˆÙ„Ù ÙˆÙØ£ÙÙˆÙ„ÙÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ÙƒÙÙ…Ù’ï´¾ØŸ Ø£ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù…ØªÙ… Ù…Ø§ Ø¬Ø§Ø¡â€ŒØª Ø¨Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ø«Ø§Ø± Ù…Ù…Ø§ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† ÙˆÙŠØ­Ø¯Ø« ÙÙŠ Ø£Ø¦Ù…ØªÙƒÙ… Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø§Ø¶ÙŠÙ† ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¨Ø§Ù‚ÙŠÙ† Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…ØŸ Ø£ÙˆÙ…Ø§ Ø±Ø£ÙŠØªÙ… ÙƒÙŠÙ Ø¬Ø¹Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ù„ÙƒÙ… Ù…Ø¹Ø§Ù‚Ù„ ØªØ£ÙˆÙˆÙ† Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ø¹Ù„Ø§Ù…Ø§ ØªÙ‡ØªØ¯ÙˆÙ† Ø¨Ù‡Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ù„Ø¯Ù† Ø¢Ø¯Ù… Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù† Ø¸Ù‡Ø± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø§Ø¶ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù…ØŒ ÙƒÙ„Ù…Ø§ ØºØ§Ø¨ Ø¹Ù„Ù… Ø¨Ø¯Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù…ØŒ ÙˆØ¥Ø°Ø§ Ø£ÙÙ„ Ù†Ø¬Ù… Ø·Ù„Ø¹ Ù†Ø¬Ù…ØŸ ÙÙ„Ù…Ø§ Ù‚Ø¨Ø¶Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø¸Ù†Ù†ØªÙ… Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ø¨Ø·Ù„ Ø¯ÙŠÙ†Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ‚Ø·Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø¨Ø¨ Ø¨ÙŠÙ†Ù‡ ÙˆØ¨ÙŠÙ† Ø®Ù„Ù‚Ù‡ØŒ ÙƒÙ„Ø§ Ù…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠÙƒÙˆÙ† Ø­ØªÙ‰ ØªÙ‚ÙˆÙ… Ø§Ù„Ø³Ø§Ø¹Ø©ØŒ ÙˆÙŠØ¸Ù‡Ø± Ø£Ù…Ø± Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø³Ø¨Ø­Ø§Ù†Ù‡ ÙˆÙ‡Ù… ÙƒØ§Ø±Ù‡ÙˆÙ†. ÙˆØ¥Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø§Ø¶ÙŠ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ù…Ø¶Ù‰ Ø³Ø¹ÙŠØ¯Ø§ ÙÙ‚ÙŠØ¯Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ø§Ø¬ Ø¢Ø¨Ø§Ø¦Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ø­Ø°Ùˆ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¹Ù„ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø¹Ù„ØŒ ÙˆÙÙŠÙ†Ø§ ÙˆØµÙŠØªÙ‡ ÙˆØ¹Ù„Ù…Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆÙ…Ù† Ù‡Ùˆ Ø®Ù„ÙÙ‡ ÙˆÙ…Ù† Ù‡Ùˆ ÙŠØ³Ø¯ Ù…Ø³Ø¯Ù‡ØŒ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ†Ø§Ø²Ø¹Ù†Ø§ Ù…ÙˆØ¶Ø¹Ù‡ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø¸Ø§Ù„Ù… Ø¢Ø«Ù…ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ¯Ø¹ÙŠÙ‡ Ø¯ÙˆÙ†Ù†Ø§ Ø¥Ù„Ø§ Ø¬Ø§Ø­Ø¯ ÙƒØ§ÙØ±ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ø£Ù† Ø£Ù…Ø± Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØºÙ„Ø¨ØŒ ÙˆØ³Ø±Ù‡ Ù„Ø§ ÙŠØ¸Ù‡Ø± ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù†ØŒ Ù„Ø¸Ù‡Ø± Ù„ÙƒÙ… Ù…Ù† Ø­Ù‚Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø§ ØªØ¨ÙŠÙ† Ù…Ù†Ù‡ Ø¹Ù‚ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ…ØŒ ÙˆÙŠØ²ÙŠÙ„ Ø´ÙƒÙˆÙƒÙƒÙ…ØŒ Ù„ÙƒÙ†Ù‡ Ù…Ø§ Ø´Ø§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙƒØ§Ù†ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ„ Ø£Ø¬Ù„ ÙƒØªØ§Ø¨. ÙØ§ØªÙ‚ÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ§ Ù„Ù†Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ±Ø¯ÙˆØ§ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù…Ø± Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ†Ø§ØŒ ÙØ¹Ù„ÙŠÙ†Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø§ØµØ¯Ø§Ø± ÙƒÙ…Ø§ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù…Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø§ÙŠØ±Ø§Ø¯ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ØªØ­Ø§ÙˆÙ„ÙˆØ§ ÙƒØ´Ù Ù…Ø§ ØºØ·ÙŠ Ø¹Ù†ÙƒÙ… ÙˆÙ„Ø§ ØªÙ…ÙŠÙ„ÙˆØ§ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙ…ÙŠÙ†ØŒ ÙˆØªØ¹Ø¯Ù„ÙˆØ§ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù…Ø§Ù„ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ø¬Ø¹Ù„ÙˆØ§ Ù‚ØµØ¯ÙƒÙ… Ø¥Ù„ÙŠÙ†Ø§ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ¯Ø© Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù†Ø© Ø§Ù„ÙˆØ§Ø¶Ø­Ø©ØŒ ÙÙ‚Ø¯ Ù†ØµØ­Øª Ù„ÙƒÙ…ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø´Ø§Ù‡Ø¯ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠ ÙˆØ¹Ù„ÙŠÙƒÙ…ØŒ ÙˆÙ„ÙˆÙ„Ø§ Ù…Ø§ Ø¹Ù†Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø­Ø¨Ø© ØµÙ„Ø§Ø­ÙƒÙ… ÙˆØ±Ø­Ù…ØªÙƒÙ…ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§Ø´ÙØ§Ù‚ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙƒÙ…ØŒ Ù„ÙƒÙ†Ø§ Ø¹Ù† Ù…Ø®Ø§Ø·Ø¨ØªÙƒÙ… ÙÙŠ Ø´ØºÙ„ ÙÙŠÙ…Ø§ Ù‚Ø¯ Ø§Ù…ØªØ­Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ù‡ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ù†Ø§Ø²Ø¹Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¸Ø§Ù„Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¹ØªÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø¶Ø§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù…ØªØªØ§Ø¨Ø¹ ÙÙŠ ØºÙŠÙ‡ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¶Ø§Ø¯ Ù„Ø±Ø¨Ù‡ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ø§Ø¹ÙŠ Ù…Ø§ Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ù„Ù‡ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø§Ø­Ø¯ Ø­Ù‚ Ù…Ù† Ø§ÙØªØ±Ø¶ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø·Ø§Ø¹ØªÙ‡ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ø¸Ø§Ù„Ù… Ø§Ù„ØºØ§ØµØ¨. ÙˆÙÙŠ Ø§Ø¨Ù†Ø© Ø±Ø³ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ Ù„ÙŠ Ø£Ø³ÙˆØ© Ø­Ø³Ù†Ø© ÙˆØ³ÙŠØ±Ø¯ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø§Ù‡Ù„ Ø±Ø¯Ø§Ø¡â€ŒØ© Ø¹Ù…Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ³ÙŠØ¹Ù„Ù… Ø§Ù„ÙƒØ§ÙØ± Ù„Ù…Ù† Ø¹Ù‚Ø¨Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ø§Ø±ØŒ Ø¹ØµÙ…Ù†Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ¥ÙŠØ§ÙƒÙ… Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‡Ø§Ù„Ùƒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§Ø³ÙˆØ§Ø¡ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¢ÙØ§Øª ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ù‡Ø§Øª ÙƒÙ„Ù‡Ø§ Ø¨Ø±Ø­Ù…ØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙØ¥Ù†Ù‡ ÙˆÙ„ÙŠ Ø°Ù„Ùƒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù‚Ø§Ø¯Ø± Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø§ ÙŠØ´Ø§Ø¡ØŒ ÙˆÙƒØ§Ù† Ù„Ù†Ø§ ÙˆÙ„ÙƒÙ… ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ§ ÙˆØ­Ø§ÙØ¸Ø§ØŒ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø¬Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ø§ÙˆØµÙŠØ§Ø¡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø§ÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ§Ø¡ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ø¤Ù…Ù†ÙŠÙ† ÙˆØ±Ø­Ù…Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ¨Ø±ÙƒØ§ØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆØµÙ„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø­Ù…Ø¯ ÙˆØ¢Ù„Ù‡ ÙˆØ³Ù„Ù… ØªØ³Ù„ÙŠÙ…Ø§.", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/27/1/37/1", "volume": 1, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 37, "thaqalaynSanad": "H 245 - Informed me a group of scholars from Abu Muhammad Talakbari from Ahmad bin Ali Raazi from Husain bin Ali Qummi that he said: Narrated to me Muhammad bin Ali bin Banan Talhi Aabi from Ali bin Muhammad bin Abduh Nishapuri: Narrated to me Ali bin Ibrahim Raazi that he said: A reliable Shaykh said in Baghdad that:", "thaqalaynMatn": " Ibn Abi Ghanim Qazwini along with some Shia people had a difference of opinion regarding the successorship of His Eminence, Imam Hasan Askari (a.s). So much so that Qazwini denied the existence of His Eminence, the Awaited Imam (a.s). However, others stressed that the successor of His Eminence was present and he is His Eminence, Imam Mahdi (a.s). They wrote a letter to the Awaited Imam and related their discussion with Qazwini. His Eminence replied as follows: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful. May the Almighty Allah keep you and us safe from the mischiefs and may He bestow you and us with certainty and may He also protect you and us from bad consequences. Information regarding doubt and denial of a group from you in religion and matter of guardianship (Wilayat) has reached us. Our sorrow and anger is for you and not for our own selves, as the Almighty Allah is with us, therefore except for Him, we are not needful of anyone else and the truth is with us. Therefore, I am not afraid if someone turns away from us. And we are the first creations of our Lord and (other) creatures and people were created afterwards. And you, O people! Why have you fallen into doubt and bewilderment? Have you not heard the statement of Almighty Allah: â€œO you who believe! Obey Allah and obey the Apostle and those in authority from among youâ€¦â€ (4:59) Donâ€™t you know that it has come in traditional reports that unforeseen events had befallen the past and would befall the remaining Imams? Have you not seen how in all the times, the Almighty Allah had made a refuge for you to seek protection in? He appointed torches of guidance from the time of Adam (a.s) till Imam Hasan Askari (a.s) that you may obtain guidance and direction, in such a way that whenever a guide went away, another one took up his place and torch. When the Almighty Allah took away Imam Hasan Askari (a.s), do you think He has rendered His religion invalid and severed His relation with the creatures? Never! Till the Day of Judgment and the time of the issue of Allahâ€™s command, which is not in favor of the people, it cannot be thus. Indeed, His Eminence, Imam Hasan Askari (a.s) passed away with success and good fortune like his respected forefathers and in such a condition that his knowledge and will is present with us. And his successor would perform his functions. And except for an unjust criminal, no one has any dispute with us in this matter. And except for a denier disbeliever, no one claims this divine position of ours. And if it would not have rendered the command of Allah to be subverted and His secret had not been exposed, our right upon you would have become so clear that your intellects would have been amazed and your doubts and uncertainties would have disappeared. However, what Allah has willed, predestined and written would surely happen and nothing except that. Then fear Allah and submit to our affair, and leave this matter with us. And do not persist in seeking that which Allah has concealed and donâ€™t get deviated to the left and right. And make our right and illuminated path as the aim. Indeed, I wish for your well-being and Allah is witness upon you and me. If I had no affection for you and had not desired mercy and goodness for you, I would not have said anything to you. It is by way of trial and divine test for us that a misguided oppressor, without any right has become a prisoner of his selfish desires and usurped the right of others. Like the daughter of the Messenger of Allah, it is obligatory that I should be patient and in the end the ignorant and tyrant would see the consequences of his deeds. May Allah Almighty protect you and us from perditions, calamities and evils. And Allah is having authority and power on them and blessings and mercy of Allah be upon all the successors, saints and believers. And may Allah bless Muhammad, the Prophet, and his progeny and peace be upon them.", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 35, "bookId": "Man-La-Yahduruh-al-Faqih-Volume-2-Saduq", "book": "Man LÄ Yaá¸¥á¸uruh al-FaqÄ«h", "category": "Book of Zakat", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "Chapter on Categories Upon Whom Zakat is Obligatory", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. How should I give it to them?\"\nThe Imam (as) replied: \"Give it to them based on their commitment to the faith, understanding of religion, and intellect.\"", "arabicText": "1631 - ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙØ¬Ù’Ù„Ø§ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙƒÙÙˆÙ†ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ù„ÙØ£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠ Ø¬ÙØ¹Ù’ÙÙØ±Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙ…Ù : Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙŠ Ø±ÙØ¨Ù‘ÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ù‚ÙØ³ÙÙ…Ù’ØªÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø´Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ’Ø¡Ù Ø¨ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†Ù Ø£ÙØµÙ’Ø­ÙØ§Ø¨ÙÙŠ Ø£ÙØµÙÙ„ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙƒÙÙŠÙ’ÙÙ Ø£ÙØ¹Ù’Ø·ÙÙŠÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Â«Ø£ÙØ¹Ù’Ø·ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‡ÙØ¬Ù’Ø±ÙØ©Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø¯Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ†Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙÙÙ‚Ù’Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„ÙÂ».", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/34/1/5/34", "volume": 2, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 5, "thaqalaynSanad": "Hadith.1631 - Abdullah ibn Ajlan al-Sakuni said to Abu Ja'far (Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as)):\n", "thaqalaynMatn": "\"Sometimes I distribute something among my companions to help them. Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Bab Ul Qaim Publications", "englishText": "Hadith.4375 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) passed by a group of women, stopped, and said:\n\"O assembly of women! I have not seen those who are deficient in intellect and religion more capable of taking away the reasoning of men of understanding than you. Indeed, I have observed that you will form the majority of the inhabitants of Hell on the Day of Judgment. So, seek closeness to Allah (swt), the Almighty and Glorious, as much as you can.\"\nOne of the women asked: \"O Messenger of Allah (swt), what is the deficiency in our religion and intellect?\"\nHe (sw) replied: \"As for the deficiency in your religion, it is due to the menstruation that afflicts you, during which one of you may remain for a period, as Allah (swt) wills, without praying or fasting. And as for the deficiency in your intellect, it is because the testimony of a woman is equivalent to half the testimony of a man.\"", "arabicText": "4375 - : ÙˆÙ Ù…ÙØ±Ù‘Ù Ø±ÙØ³ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ØµÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙ‰ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¢Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ù†ÙØ³Ù’ÙˆÙØ©Ù ÙÙÙˆÙÙ‚ÙÙÙ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø«ÙÙ…Ù‘Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù\n\"ÙŠÙØ§ Ù…ÙØ¹ÙØ§Ø´ÙØ±Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ³ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ø±ÙØ£ÙÙŠÙ’ØªÙ Ù†ÙÙˆÙØ§Ù‚ÙØµÙ Ø¹ÙÙ‚ÙÙˆÙ„Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¯ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø£ÙØ°Ù’Ù‡ÙØ¨Ù Ø¨ÙØ¹ÙÙ‚ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø°ÙÙˆÙÙŠ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø£ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¨ÙØ§Ø¨Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ÙƒÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙŠ Ù‚ÙØ¯Ù’ Ø±ÙØ£ÙÙŠÙ’ØªÙ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙƒÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø£ÙÙƒÙ’Ø«ÙØ±Ù Ø£ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ§Ø±Ù ØŒ ÙŠÙÙˆÙ’Ù…Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙŠÙØ§Ù…ÙØ©Ù ÙÙØªÙÙ‚ÙØ±Ù‘ÙØ¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙØ²Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¬ÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ø§ÙØ³Ù’ØªÙØ·ÙØ¹Ù’ØªÙÙ†Ù‘Ù\"\nÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„ÙØªÙ Ø§ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±ÙØ£ÙØ©ÙŒ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù ÙŠÙØ§ Ø±ÙØ³ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ù†ÙÙ‚Ù’ØµÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø¯ÙÙŠÙ†ÙÙ†ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙÙ‚ÙÙˆÙ„ÙÙ†ÙØ§ ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ø£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ù†ÙÙ‚Ù’ØµÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø¯ÙÙŠÙ†ÙÙƒÙÙ†Ù‘Ù ÙÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø­ÙÙŠÙ’Ø¶Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù‘ÙØ°ÙÙŠ ÙŠÙØµÙÙŠØ¨ÙÙƒÙÙ†Ù‘Ù ÙÙØªÙÙ…Ù’ÙƒÙØ«Ù Ø¥ÙØ­Ù’Ø¯ÙØ§ÙƒÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ù…ÙØ§ Ø´ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ù„Ø§Ù ØªÙØµÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙŠ ÙˆÙ Ù„Ø§Ù ØªÙØµÙÙˆÙ…Ù ÙˆÙ Ø£ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ù†ÙÙ‚Ù’ØµÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙÙ‚ÙÙˆÙ„ÙÙƒÙÙ†Ù‘Ù ÙÙØ´ÙÙ‡ÙØ§Ø¯ÙØªÙÙƒÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø´ÙÙ‡ÙØ§Ø¯ÙØ©Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø£ÙØ©Ù Ù†ÙØµÙ’ÙÙ Ø´ÙÙ‡ÙØ§Ø¯ÙØ©Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù\".", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/34/3/12/6", "volume": 3, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 12, "thaqalaynSanad": "Hadith.4375 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) passed by a group of women, stopped, and said:\n", "thaqalaynMatn": "\"O assembly of women! Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Bab Ul Qaim Publications", "englishText": "Hadith.4621 - Jabir narrated from Abu Ja'far Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as) that he said: \"Regarding women, do not consult them in confidential matters, and do not obey them in matters concerning relatives.\nWhen a woman grows old, the better half of her qualities departs, and the worse half remains, her beauty fades, her tongue becomes sharper, and her womb becomes barren.\nHowever, when a man grows old, the worse half of his qualities departs, and the better half remains, his intellect becomes more steadfast, his judgment more firm, and his ignorance decreases.\"", "arabicText": "4621 - ÙˆÙ Ø±ÙÙˆÙÙ‰ Ø¬ÙØ§Ø¨ÙØ±ÙŒ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠ Ø¬ÙØ¹Ù’ÙÙØ±Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙ…Ù Ø£ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù:\n\"ÙÙÙŠ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ³ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ù„Ø§Ù ØªÙØ´ÙØ§ÙˆÙØ±ÙÙˆÙ‡ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ¬Ù’ÙˆÙÙ‰ ÙˆÙ Ù„Ø§Ù ØªÙØ·ÙÙŠØ¹ÙÙˆÙ‡ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø°ÙÙŠ Ù‚ÙØ±ÙØ§Ø¨ÙØ©Ù Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø£ÙØ©Ù Ø¥ÙØ°ÙØ§ ÙƒÙØ¨ÙØ±ÙØªÙ’ Ø°ÙÙ‡ÙØ¨Ù Ø®ÙÙŠÙ’Ø±Ù Ø´ÙØ·Ù’Ø±ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ø¨ÙÙ‚ÙÙŠÙ Ø´ÙØ±Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø°ÙÙ‡ÙØ¨Ù Ø¬ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙØ­Ù’ØªÙØ¯Ù‘Ù Ù„ÙØ³ÙØ§Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙÙ‚ÙÙ…Ù Ø±ÙØ­ÙÙ…ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù Ø¥ÙØ°ÙØ§ ÙƒÙØ¨ÙØ±Ù Ø°ÙÙ‡ÙØ¨Ù Ø´ÙØ±Ù‘Ù Ø´ÙØ·Ù’Ø±ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¨ÙÙ‚ÙÙŠÙ Ø®ÙÙŠÙ’Ø±ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø«ÙØ¨ÙØªÙ Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙØ³Ù’ØªÙØ­Ù’ÙƒÙÙ…Ù Ø±ÙØ£Ù’ÙŠÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ø¬ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù\".", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/34/3/45/5", "volume": 3, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 45, "thaqalaynSanad": "Hadith.4621 - Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Bab Ul Qaim Publications", "englishText": "Hadith.4746 - The Commander of the Faithful, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:\n\"A child should be nurtured for seven years, disciplined for seven years, and then employed (given responsibility) for seven years. His physical growth reaches its peak at twenty-three years, and his intellect matures at thirty-five years. Whatever comes after that is through experiences.\"", "arabicText": "4746 - ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø£ÙÙ…ÙÙŠØ±Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ¤Ù’Ù…ÙÙ†ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙ…Ù : \"ÙŠÙØ±ÙØ¨Ù‘ÙÙ‰ Ø§ÙÙ„ØµÙ‘ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø³ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¹Ø§Ù‹ ÙˆÙ ÙŠÙØ¤ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙØ¨Ù Ø³ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¹Ø§Ù‹ ÙˆÙ ÙŠÙØ³Ù’ØªÙØ®Ù’Ø¯ÙÙ…Ù Ø³ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¹Ø§Ù‹ ÙˆÙ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ØªÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø·ÙÙˆÙ„ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø«ÙÙ„Ø§ÙØ«Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙØ´Ù’Ø±ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø³ÙÙ†ÙØ©Ù‹ ÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø®ÙÙ…Ù’Ø³Ù ÙˆÙ Ø«ÙÙ„Ø§ÙØ«ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø³ÙÙ†ÙØ©Ù‹ ÙˆÙ Ù…ÙØ§ ÙƒÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ ÙÙØ¨ÙØ§Ù„ØªÙ‘ÙØ¬ÙØ§Ø±ÙØ¨Ù\".", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/34/3/53/4", "volume": 3, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 53, "thaqalaynSanad": "Hadith.4746 - The Commander of the Faithful, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:\n", "thaqalaynMatn": "\"A child should be nurtured for seven years, disciplined for seven years, and then employed (given responsibility) for seven years. Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Bab Ul Qaim Publications", "englishText": "Hadith.4770 - Abd al-Karim ibn Ê¿Amr narrated from al-á¸¤alabi from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:\nI asked Imam (as) about the divorce of a mentally impaired person whose intellect is diminished, whether it is permissible?\nImam (as) replied: \"No.\"\nI (narrator) also asked about a woman in the same condition, whether it is permissible to sell her property or manage her dowry?\nHe replied: \"No.\"", "arabicText": "4770 - Ø±ÙÙˆÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙØ±ÙÙŠÙ…Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¹ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±ÙÙˆ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø­ÙÙ„ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠ Ø¹ÙØ¨Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙ…Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù: Ø³ÙØ£ÙÙ„Ù’ØªÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø·ÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙ‚Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ¹Ù’ØªÙÙˆÙ‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø²Ù‘ÙØ§Ø¦ÙÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù Ø£Ù ÙŠÙØ¬ÙÙˆØ²Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ù„Ø§Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø£ÙØ©Ù Ø¥ÙØ°ÙØ§ ÙƒÙØ§Ù†ÙØªÙ’ ÙƒÙØ°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ ÙŠÙØ¬ÙÙˆØ²Ù Ø¨ÙÙŠÙ’Ø¹ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ ØµÙØ¯ÙÙ‚ÙØªÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ù„Ø§Ù\".", "majlisiGrading": "", "URL": "https://thaqalayn.net/hadith/34/4/5/1", "volume": 3, "frenchText": "", "mohseniGrading": "", "behbudiGrading": "", "chapterInCategoryId": 5, "thaqalaynSanad": "Hadith.4770 - Abd al-Karim ibn Ê¿Amr narrated from al-á¸¤alabi from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:\n", "thaqalaynMatn": "I asked Imam (as) about the divorce of a mentally impaired person whose intellect is diminished, whether it is permissible?\nImam (as) replied: \"No.\"\nI (narrator) also asked about a woman in the same condition, whether it is permissible to sell her property or manage her dowry?\nHe replied: \"No.\"", "gradingsFull": [] }, { "id": 2, "bookId": "Man-La-Yahduruh-al-Faqih-Volume-4-Saduq", "book": "Man LÄ Yaá¸¥á¸uruh al-FaqÄ«h", "category": "Content", "categoryId": "1", "chapter": "Chapter on Mentioning Some of the Prohibitions of the Prophet {saws}", "author": "Shaykh Muá¸¥ammad b. Ê¿AlÄ« al-á¹¢aduq", "translator": "Bab Ul Qaim Publications", "englishText": "Hadith.4968 - Abu Ja'far Muhammad ibn Al-Husayn ibn Musa ibn Babawayh Al-Qummi, the jurist residing in Rayy and the author of this book (may Allah (swt) be pleased with him and grant him His satisfaction), narrated from Shu'ayb ibn Waqid, from Al-Husayn ibn Zayd, from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) from his father, Imam Muhammad ibn Ali Al-Baqir (as), from his forefathers, from Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as), who said:\n\"The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade eating while in a state of major ritual impurity (janabah)\" and said: \"It leads to poverty.\"\nHe (sw) also forbade trimming the nails with teeth, using the miswak (tooth-stick) in the bathhouse, and spitting in the mosques.\nHe (sw) forbade eating (drinking) the leftovers of a mouse and said: \"Do not make the mosques pathways; rather, pray two units of prayer in them before passing through.\"\nHe (sw) prohibited urinating under fruit-bearing trees or on public roads.\nHe (sw) forbade a person from eating with his left hand and from eating while reclining.\nHe (sw) forbade plastering graves and praying upon them.\nHe (sw) said: \"If one of you bathes in an open area, let him guard his private parts, and do not drink water from the handle of a container, for it is where dirt accumulates.\"\nHe (sw) prohibited urinating in stagnant water, saying, \"It causes the loss of intellect.\"\nHe (sw) forbade walking with only one shoe or putting on shoes while standing.\nHe (sw) forbade a man from urinating while his private parts are exposed to the sun or the moon.\nHe (sw) said: \"When you enter the place of relieving yourself, avoid facing the qiblah.'\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade wailing loudly (Al-rannah) during calamities and prohibited lamentation (Al-niyahah) and listening to it.\nHe (sw) forbade women from following funeral processions.\nHe (sw) prohibited wiping off anything from the Book of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, with saliva or writing with it.\nHe (sw) forbade a man from intentionally lying about his dreams and said: \"Allah (swt) will burden him on the Day of Judgment to tie a grain of barley, and he will not be able to do so.\"\nHe (sw) prohibited making images and said: \"Whoever creates an image, Allah (swt) will task him on the Day of Judgment to breathe life into it, and he will not be able to do so.\"\nHe (sw) forbade burning any living creature with fire.\nHe (sw) prohibited cursing the rooster and said: \"Indeed, it awakens for prayer.\"\nHe (sw) forbade a man from interfering in the sale of his Muslim brother.\nHe (sw) prohibited excessive talking during intimate relations and said: \"It results in a child being born mute.\"\nHe (sw) said: \"Do not leave garbage in your homes overnight. Take it out during the day, for it is the seat of Satan.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:\n\"Let none of you sleep while his hand is unwashed from grease (or impurities). If he does and something harmful happens to him from Satan, he should blame no one but himself.\"\nHe (sw) forbade a man from performing istinja (cleaning after relieving oneself) with dung or bones.\nHe (sw) forbade a woman from leaving her house without her husband's permission. If she does, every angel in the sky and everything she passes from among the jinn and humans will curse her until she returns to her home.\nHe (sw) forbade a woman from adorning herself for anyone other than her husband, saying: \"If she does so, it becomes a right upon Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, to burn her in the Fire.\"\nHe (sw) prohibited a woman from speaking to a man who is not her husband or a mahram (unmarriageable kin) more than five necessary words.\nHe (sw) forbade a woman from directly touching another woman without a cloth between them.\nHe (sw) forbade women from describing their intimate relations with their husbands to other women.\nHe (sw) prohibited a man from having intimate relations with his wife while facing the Qiblah or on a public road. He (sw) said: \"Whoever does so, upon him is the curse of Allah (swt), the angels, and all people.\"\nHe (sw) forbade a man from saying to another man, \"Marry me your sister, and I will marry you mine.\"\nHe (sw) prohibited visiting fortune-tellers and said: \"Whoever visits one and believes in them has disbelieved in what Allah (swt) revealed to Muhammad.\"\nHe (sw) forbade playing with dice, chess, drums (Al-kubah), and stringed instruments (Al-ará¹­abah, referring to the lute and oud).\nHe (sw) forbade backbiting and listening to it, as well as gossiping and listening to it. He (sw) said: \"A tale-bearer will not enter Paradise.\"\nHe (sw) forbade accepting invitations to the meals of corrupt individuals.\nHe (sw) prohibited taking false oaths.\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:\n\"Indeed, false oaths leave lands desolate.\"\nAnd he (sw) said: \"Whoever swears a false oath deliberately to unlawfully seize the wealth of a Muslim will meet Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, while He (swt) is angry with him - unless he repents and returns the right.\"\nHe (sw) forbade sitting at a table where alcohol is being consumed.\nHe (sw) prohibited a man from taking his wife into the bathhouse and said: \"Let none of you enter the bathhouse without wearing a waistcloth (loincloth).\"\nHe (sw) forbade conversations that lead to anything other than the remembrance of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic.\nHe (sw) prohibited slapping the face and drinking from gold and silver vessels.\nHe (sw) forbade men from wearing silk, brocade, and fine silk (qazz), though it is permissible for women.\nHe (sw) forbade selling fruits before they ripen, meaning before they turn yellow or red.\nHe (sw) prohibited muhaqala, which is selling dates for fresh dates and raisins for grapes or similar transactions.\nHe (sw) forbade selling dice games (nard) and purchasing or serving alcohol.\nHe (as) said: \"May Allah (swt) curse alcohol, its planter, its presser, its drinker, its server, its seller, its buyer, the one who consumes its price, its carrier, and the one to whom it is carried.\"\nHe (as) also said: \"Whoever drinks it, Allah (swt) will not accept his prayer for forty days. If he dies with any of it in his stomach, it becomes a right upon Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, to make him drink from the mud of filth, which is the pus of the people of Hell and what comes out of the private parts of the adulterers. This mixture will collect in the cauldrons of Hell, and the people of Hell will drink it, causing their insides and skins to melt.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade consuming usury, bearing false witness, and writing contracts involving usury.\nHe (sw) said: \"Indeed, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, has cursed the one who consumes usury, the one who pays it, the one who records it, and its two witnesses.\"\nHe (sw) forbade combining a sale with a loan and prohibited two sales in one transaction.\nHe (sw) forbade selling what one does not possess and selling what has not been guaranteed.\nHe (sw) prohibited shaking hands with a non-Muslim under a protection pact (dhimmi).\nHe (sw) forbade reciting poetry or announcing lost items in the mosque.\nHe (sw) prohibited drawing swords in the mosque.\nHe (sw) forbade striking animals on their faces.\nHe (sw) prohibited a man from looking at the private parts of his Muslim brother and said:\n\"Whoever intentionally looks at the private parts of his Muslim brother, seventy thousand angels will curse him.\"\nHe (sw) forbade a woman from looking at the private parts of another woman.\nHe (sw) prohibited blowing into food or drink and blowing on the place of prostration.\nHe (sw) forbade praying in graveyards, on pathways, at mills, in valleys, at camel enclosures, and on the roof of the Kaaba.\nHe (sw) prohibited killing bees and branding animals on their faces.\nHe (sw) forbade swearing an oath by anything other than Allah (swt) and said:\n\"Whoever swears by anything other than Allah (swt) is not connected to Allah (swt) in any way.\"\nHe (sw) prohibited swearing by a chapter (Surah) of the Book of Allah (swt) and said:\n\"Whoever swears by a Surah from the Book of Allah (swt), for every verse in it, there is an expiation for the oath. Whoever wishes may fulfill it, and whoever wishes may break it.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade a man from saying to another, \"No, by your life\" or \"by the life of so-and-so.\"\nHe (sw) prohibited a man from sitting in the mosque while in a state of major ritual impurity (janabah).\nHe (sw) forbade exposing oneself naked during the night or day.\nHe (sw) prohibited cupping (hijama) on Wednesdays and Fridays.\nHe (sw) forbade speaking while the Imam is delivering the Friday sermon and said: \"Whoever does so has engaged in idle talk, and whoever engages in idle talk, his Friday prayer is void.\"\nHe (sw) prohibited wearing rings made of brass or iron and forbade engraving images of living creatures on rings.\nHe (sw) forbade performing prayer at sunrise, sunset, and when the sun is at its zenith.\nHe (sw) prohibited fasting on six specific days: the Day of Eid Al-Fitr, the Day of Doubt (the 30th of Sha'ban when uncertain if Ramadan has begun), the Day of Eid Al-Adha, and the Days of Tashreeq (the three days following Eid Al-Adha).\nHe (sw) forbade drinking water in the manner of animals and said: \"Drink with your hands, for it is the best of your vessels.\"\nHe (sw) prohibited spitting into a well from which water is drawn for drinking.\nHe (sw) forbade hiring a worker without first agreeing on his wage.\nHe (sw) prohibited severing ties and said: \"Whoever must do so should not abandon his brother for more than three days. Whoever abandons his brother for more than that, the Fire will be more deserving of him.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade selling gold for gold with any increase, except when it is weight for weight.\nHe (sw) prohibited excessive praise and said: \"Throw dust in the faces of those who excessively praise others.\"\nHe (sw) also said: \"Whoever supports the argument of a wrongdoer or assists him, when the Angel of Death comes to him, it will be said to him: 'Receive the glad tidings of Allah's (swt) curse and the Fire of Hell, and what a terrible destination!'\"\nHe (sw) said: \"Whoever praises a tyrannical ruler or humbles himself before him out of greed will be his companion in the Fire.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) also said: \"Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, says: 'Do not incline towards the wrongdoers, lest the Fire touch you.'\"\nHe (sw) said: \"Whoever supports an oppressor in his oppression will be the companion of Haman (the advisor of Pharaoh) in Hell. And whoever builds a structure for show and reputation will be burdened with it on the Day of Judgment, carried from the seventh layer of the earth while it blazes with fire. It will then be placed around his neck and he will be thrown into the Fire, where nothing will stop him from reaching its depths unless he repents.\"\nIt was asked: \"O' Messenger of Allah (swt), how does one build (for) show and reputation?\"\nHe (sw) replied: \"By constructing more than what is necessary for him, to boast over his neighbours and to show off to his brothers.\"\nHe (sw) also said: \"Whoever wrongs a worker by withholding his due wages, Allah (swt) will nullify his deeds and forbid him from the fragrance of Paradise, and indeed, its fragrance is detected from a distance of five hundred years.\"\n\"Whoever betrays his neighbour over a handspan of land, Allah (swt) will place it as a collar around his neck from the lowest depths of the earth until he meets Allah (swt) on the Day of Judgment, unless he repents and turns back.\"\n\"Beware! Whoever learns the Qur'an and then forgets it will meet Allah (swt) on the Day of Judgment shackled, and for every verse he forgot, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, will assign a snake as his companion leading him to Hell, unless Allah (swt) forgives him.\"\nHe (sw) also said: \"Whoever recites the Qur'an and then drinks alcohol or prefers the love of this world and its adornments over it, the wrath of Allah (swt) becomes obligatory upon him, unless he repents. Beware! If he dies without repenting, the Qur'an will argue against him on the Day of Judgment and will not leave him until it defeats him.\"\n\"Beware! Whoever commits adultery with a Muslim woman, or a Jewish, Christian, or Magian woman, whether free or a slave, and does not repent before death, Allah (swt) will open for him in his grave three hundred doors from which snakes, scorpions, and the serpents of the Fire will enter, burning him until the Day of Judgment. When he is resurrected from his grave, people will be harmed by the stench of his odor, and he will be recognized by this and his evil deeds in the worldly life until he is commanded to be thrown into the Fire.\"\n\"Beware! Indeed, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, has forbidden what is unlawful and set limits. No one is more protective (ghayoor) than Allah (swt), and out of His (swt) protectiveness, He (swt) has forbidden immoralities.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade a man from peeking into his neighbor's house and said:\n\"Whoever intentionally looks at the private parts of his Muslim brother or at those not permissible for him to see, Allah (swt) the Exalted will place him among the hypocrites who used to search for people's faults. He will not leave this world until Allah (swt) disgraces him - unless he repents.\"\nHe (sw) also said: \"Whoever is not content with what Allah (swt) has allotted for him in sustenance, complains about it, does not show patience, and does not seek reward from Allah (swt), none of his good deeds will be accepted, and he will meet Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, while He (swt) is angry with him - unless he repents.\"\nHe (sw) forbade arrogance in walking and said: \"Whoever wears a garment and walks arrogantly in it, Allah (swt) will cause him to sink from the edge of Hell, and he will be the companion of Qarun (Korah), for he was the first to act arrogantly, and Allah (swt) caused the earth to swallow him and his home. Whoever behaves arrogantly has indeed challenged Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, in His (swt) supreme authority.\"\nHe (sw) also said: \"Whoever wrongs a woman regarding her dowry is considered by Allah (swt) as an adulterer. Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, will say to him on the Day of Judgment:\n'My servant, I married you to My maidservant on My covenant, but you did not fulfill My covenant and wronged My maidservant.' Her due will be taken from his good deeds and given to her according to what she is owed. If he has no more good deeds, he will be commanded to enter the Fire for breaking the covenant, for 'Indeed, the covenant will be questioned about.'\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade concealing testimony and said: \"Whoever conceals it, Allah (swt) will make him eat his own flesh in front of all creation. This is in accordance with Allah's (swt) saying:\n'And do not conceal testimony, for whoever conceals it - his heart is sinful, and Allah (swt) is Knowing of what you do.'\" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:283)\nHe (sw) also said: \"Whoever harms his neighbour, Allah (swt) will forbid him from the fragrance of Paradise, 'and his abode will be Hell, and what a miserable destination.'\nWhoever neglects the rights of his neighbour is not from us.\nArchangel Jibril (as) continued to advise me regarding the neighbour until I thought he would make him an heir.\nHe (Jibril (as)) kept advising me about slaves until I thought a time would be set when they would automatically be freed.\nHe (Jibril (as)) kept advising me about the use of the toothstick (siwak) until I thought it would be made obligatory.\nHe (Jibril (as)) kept advising me about praying at night until I thought the best of my nation would never sleep.\"\n\"Beware! Whoever belittles a poor Muslim has belittled the right of Allah (swt), and Allah (swt) will belittle him on the Day of Judgment unless he repents.\"\nHe (sw) also said: \"Whoever honors a poor Muslim will meet Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, on the Day of Judgment while He (swt) is pleased with him.\"\n\"Whoever is faced with an indecent act or desire and refrains from it out of fear of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, Allah (swt) will forbid the Fire upon him, grant him safety from the greatest terror, and fulfill for him what He (swt) promised in His Book in His (swt) saying:\n'But for he who has feared the standing before his Lord (azj) are two gardens.'\"\n(Surah Ar-Rahman 55:46)\n\"Beware! Whoever is presented with the choice between this world and the Hereafter and chooses the world over the Hereafter will meet Allah (swt) on the Day of Judgment without a single good deed to shield him from the Fire. But whoever chooses the Hereafter over this world and abandons worldly desires, Allah (swt) will be pleased with him and will forgive his past misdeeds.\"\n\"Whoever fills his eyes with what is forbidden, Allah (swt) will fill his eyes with fire on the Day of Judgment - unless he repents and turns back.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, also said:\n\"Whoever shakes hands with a woman who is unlawful for him has indeed incurred the wrath of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic. And whoever embraces a forbidden woman will be chained with a shackle of fire alongside a devil, and both will be cast into the Fire.\"\n\"Whoever cheats a Muslim in buying or selling is not from us and will be resurrected on the Day of Judgment with the Jews, for they are the most deceitful people towards Muslims.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) forbade anyone from withholding necessary items (ma'oon) from his neighbour and said:\n\"Whoever withholds useful items from his neighbour, Allah (swt) will withhold His (swt) goodness from him on the Day of Judgment and will leave him to his own self. And whoever is left to his own self - how miserable will be his state!\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:\n\"Any woman who harms her husband with her tongue, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, will not accept any obligatory or voluntary acts of worship from her until she pleases him. Even if she fasts during the day, prays during the night, frees slaves, and spends in the way of Allah (swt) by supporting horses for jihad, she will still be among the first to enter the Fire - unless she seeks his satisfaction. Likewise, the same applies to a man if he wrongs his wife.\"\n\"Beware! Whoever slaps the cheek or face of a Muslim, Allah (swt) will scatter his bones on the Day of Judgment, and he will be resurrected in chains until he is thrown into Hell - unless he repents.\"\n\"Whoever sleeps with malice in his heart towards his Muslim brother, he sleeps under the wrath of Allah (swt) and will awaken in the same state until he repents.\"\nHe (sw) also forbade backbiting and said: \"Whoever backbites a Muslim, his fast becomes void, his ablution is invalidated, and he will come on the Day of Judgment with a stench emanating from his mouth more foul than that of a decaying corpse, causing discomfort to the people at the gathering. If he dies before repenting, he dies considering lawful what Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, has forbidden.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said:\n\"Whoever suppresses his anger while being capable of acting upon it and chooses patience, Allah (swt) will grant him the reward of a martyr.\"\n\"Beware! Whoever defends his brother in his absence when he hears someone backbiting him in a gathering, Allah (swt) will turn away from him a thousand doors of harm in this world and the Hereafter. But if he does not defend him while being capable of doing so, he will bear the sin of backbiting seventy times.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) also forbade betrayal and said:\n\"Whoever betrays a trust in this world and does not return it to its rightful owner, then death overtakes him, he will die outside of my faith and will meet Allah (swt) while He is angry with him.\"\nHe (sw) further said: \"Whoever gives false testimony against someone will be hung by his tongue among the hypocrites in the lowest depths of Hell.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt), peace be upon him and his family, said: \"Whoever purchases something that was acquired through betrayal, knowing its origin, is like the one who committed the betrayal.\"\n\"Whoever withholds a rightful due from his Muslim brother, Allah (swt) will deprive him of the blessings of sustenance - unless he repents.\"\n\"Beware! Whoever hears of an indecent act and spreads it is like the one who committed it.\"\n\"Whoever's Muslim brother is in need of a loan and he has the means but refuses to help, Allah (swt) will forbid him from the fragrance of Paradise.\"\n\"Beware! Whoever patiently endures the bad character of his wife and seeks reward for it, Allah (swt) will grant him the reward of the grateful ones.\"\n\"Beware! Any woman who does not treat her husband kindly and burdens him with what he cannot bear or handle, Allah (swt) will not accept any of her good deeds, and she will meet Allah (swt) while He is angry with her.\"\n\"Beware! Whoever honors his Muslim brother is indeed honoring Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) also forbade a man from leading a group in prayer without their permission and said:\n\"Whoever leads a group in prayer with their permission, and they are pleased with him, and he is moderate in leading them - perfecting his prayer with proper standing, recitation, bowing, prostration, and sitting - will receive a reward equal to theirs, without their reward being diminished in the least.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:\n\"Whoever goes to visit a relative, using himself and his wealth to maintain family ties, Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, will grant him the reward of one hundred martyrs. For every step he takes, he will receive forty thousand good deeds, forty thousand sins will be erased from him, and his rank will be elevated by forty thousand degrees. It will be as if he worshiped Allah (swt) for one hundred years with patience and seeking reward.\"\n\"Whoever fulfills the need of a blind person from the needs of this world and walks with him until Allah (swt) fulfills his need, Allah (swt) will grant him freedom from hypocrisy and freedom from the Fire, fulfill seventy of his worldly needs, and he will continue to be immersed in Allah's (swt) mercy until he returns.\"\n\"Whoever falls ill for a day and night and does not complain to his visitors, Allah (swt) will raise him on the Day of Judgment with His close friend, Ibrahim, the Friend of the Most Merciful (as), allowing him to cross the bridge (Sirat) like a flashing lightning bolt.\"\n\"Whoever strives to fulfill the need of a sick person - whether he completes it or not - will leave his sins as pure as the day his mother gave birth to him.\"\nA man from the Ansar said: \"May my father and mother be sacrificed for you, O' Messenger of Allah (swt)! If the sick person is from his own household, isn't that more rewarding when he strives to fulfill their need?\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) replied: \"Yes! Indeed, whoever relieves a believer of a worldly hardship, Allah (swt) will relieve him of seventy-two hardships in the Hereafter and seventy-two hardships in this world, the least of which is Abdominal pain.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:\n\"Whoever delays giving the due right to someone while being capable of fulfilling it, every day that passes upon him will be recorded as the sin of a tax collector (oppressor).\"\n\"Beware! Whoever hangs a whip before a tyrannical ruler (to intimidate others), Allah (swt) will turn that whip into a serpent of fire on the Day of Judgment, seventy cubits long, which Allah (swt) will unleash upon him in the Fire of Hell - and what a terrible destination!\"\n\"Whoever does a good deed for his brother but then reminds him of it (to boast), Allah (swt) will nullify his good deed, record his sin, and will not reward him for his effort.\"\nThen he (peace be upon him and his family) said:\n\"Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, says: 'I have forbidden Paradise to the one who reminds others of his favors, the miser, and the tale-bearer (slanderer).'\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:\n\"Indeed, whoever gives charity, for every dirham he donates, he will receive in return the equivalent of Mount Uhud from the blessings of Paradise. And whoever personally delivers charity to a needy person will have the same reward as the giver, without the giver's reward being diminished in the slightest.\"\n\"Whoever offers the funeral prayer (Salat Al-Janazah) for a deceased person, seventy thousand angels will pray for him, and Allah (swt) will forgive his past and future sins. If he remains until the deceased is buried and the earth is placed over him, for every step he takes, he will earn a qirat of reward, and one qirat is like Mount Uhud.\"\n\"Whoever sheds tears out of fear of Allah (swt), for every drop of his tears, Allah (swt) will build for him a palace in Paradise adorned with pearls and jewels, filled with what no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and no mind has imagined.\"\n\"Whoever walks to the mosque seeking to join the congregation, for every step he takes, seventy thousand good deeds will be recorded for him, and his rank will be raised by the same number. If he dies in this state, Allah (swt) will appoint seventy thousand angels to visit him in his grave, to give him glad tidings, comfort him in his loneliness, and seek forgiveness for him until he is resurrected.\"\n\"Whoever calls the Adhan (the call to prayer) sincerely, seeking Allah's (swt) pleasure, Allah (swt) will reward him with the reward of forty thousand martyrs and forty thousand truthful ones (siddeeqin), and through his intercession, forty thousand sinners from my nation will enter Paradise.\"\nThe Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said:\n\"Whoever says: 'I bear witness that there is no God but Allah (swt),' seventy thousand angels will send blessings upon him and seek forgiveness for him. On the Day of Judgment, he will be under the shade of the Throne until Allah (swt) completes the reckoning of all creation. And whoever says: 'I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (swt),' forty thousand angels will write the reward for his statement.\"\n\"Whoever maintains the first row (in prayer) and safeguards the first Takbir (opening declaration of prayer) without harming any Muslim, Allah (swt) will grant him the reward equal to that of the callers to prayer (Mu'adhins) in this world and the hereafter.\"\n\"Whoever takes responsibility over a group of people (leadership) will be brought on the Day of Judgment with his hands chained to his neck. If he governed them according to Allah's (swt) command, Allah (swt) will release him. But if he ruled unjustly, he will be cast into the Fire of Hell, and what an evil destination it is.\"\nThe Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) also said: \"Do not belittle any act of evil, even if it seems small in your eyes, and do not think lightly of any act of goodness, even if it appears great in your eyes. For there is no major sin with repentance, and no minor sin with persistence.\"\nShuayb ibn Waqid said: \"I asked Husayn ibn Zayd about the length of this narration, and he replied: ' Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) ibn Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Al-Husayn ibn Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) narrated to me that Imam (as) compiled this narration from the book that was dictated by the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) and written in the handwriting of Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as).'\"", "arabicText": "4968 - Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙˆ Ø¬ÙØ¹Ù’ÙÙØ±Ù Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø­ÙØ³ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ù…ÙÙˆØ³ÙÙ‰ Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø¨ÙØ§Ø¨ÙÙˆÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙÙÙ‚ÙÙŠÙ‡Ù Ù†ÙØ²ÙÙŠÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ù…ÙØµÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙÙ Ù‡ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙØªÙØ§Ø¨Ù Ø±ÙØ¶ÙÙŠÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø£ÙØ±Ù’Ø¶ÙØ§Ù‡Ù Ø±ÙÙˆÙÙŠÙ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø´ÙØ¹ÙÙŠÙ’Ø¨Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù ÙˆÙØ§Ù‚ÙØ¯Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø­ÙØ³ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø²ÙÙŠÙ’Ø¯Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„ØµÙ‘ÙØ§Ø¯ÙÙ‚Ù Ø¬ÙØ¹Ù’ÙÙØ±Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ‡Ù ØŒ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¢Ø¨ÙØ§Ø¦ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙÙ…ÙÙŠØ±Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ¤Ù’Ù…ÙÙ†ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ‘Ù Ø¨Ù’Ù†Ù Ø£ÙØ¨ÙÙŠ Ø·ÙØ§Ù„ÙØ¨Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙ…Ù Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù: \"Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø±ÙØ³ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ØµÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙ‰ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¢Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø£ÙÙƒÙ’Ù„Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ†ÙØ§Ø¨ÙØ©Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙŠÙÙˆØ±ÙØ«Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙÙÙ‚Ù’Ø±Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ ØªÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„ÙÙŠÙ…Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø£ÙØ¸Ù’ÙÙØ§Ø±Ù Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø£ÙØ³Ù’Ù†ÙØ§Ù†Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙˆÙØ§ÙƒÙ ÙÙÙŠ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§Ù…Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„ØªÙ‘ÙÙ†ÙØ®Ù‘ÙØ¹Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ³ÙØ§Ø¬ÙØ¯Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙÙƒÙ’Ù„Ù Ø³ÙØ¤Ù’Ø±Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙÙØ£Ù’Ø±ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ù„Ø§Ù ØªÙØ¬Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙˆØ§ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ³ÙØ§Ø¬ÙØ¯Ù Ø·ÙØ±ÙÙ‚Ø§Ù‹ Ø­ÙØªÙ‘ÙÙ‰ ØªÙØµÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙˆØ§ ÙÙÙŠÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø±ÙÙƒÙ’Ø¹ÙØªÙÙŠÙ’Ù†Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ¨ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø£ÙØ­ÙØ¯ÙŒ ØªÙØ­Ù’ØªÙ Ø´ÙØ¬ÙØ±ÙØ©Ù Ù…ÙØ«Ù’Ù…ÙØ±ÙØ©Ù Ø£ÙÙˆÙ’ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ù‚ÙØ§Ø±ÙØ¹ÙØ©Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø·Ù‘ÙØ±ÙÙŠÙ‚Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ£Ù’ÙƒÙÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù’Ø³ÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø¨ÙØ´ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ£Ù’ÙƒÙÙ„Ù ÙˆÙ Ù‡ÙÙˆÙ Ù…ÙØªÙ‘ÙÙƒÙØ¦ÙŒ ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ØªÙØ¬ÙØµÙ‘ÙØµÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ‚ÙØ§Ø¨ÙØ±Ù ÙˆÙ ÙŠÙØµÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙ‰ ÙÙÙŠÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ø¥ÙØ°ÙØ§ Ø§ÙØºÙ’ØªÙØ³ÙÙ„Ù Ø£ÙØ­ÙØ¯ÙÙƒÙÙ…Ù’ ÙÙÙŠ ÙÙØ¶ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø£ÙØ±Ù’Ø¶Ù ÙÙÙ„Ù’ÙŠÙØ­ÙØ§Ø°ÙØ±Ù’ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙˆÙ’Ø±ÙØªÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ù„Ø§Ù ÙŠÙØ´Ù’Ø±ÙØ¨ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø£ÙØ­ÙØ¯ÙÙƒÙÙ…Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø¹ÙØ±Ù’ÙˆÙØ©Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¥ÙÙ†ÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ù…ÙØ¬Ù’ØªÙÙ…ÙØ¹Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙˆÙØ³ÙØ®Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ¨ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø£ÙØ­ÙØ¯ÙŒ ÙÙÙŠ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ§ÙƒÙØ¯Ù ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡Ù ÙŠÙÙƒÙÙˆÙ†Ù Ø°ÙÙ‡ÙØ§Ø¨Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙ‚Ù’Ù„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙØ©Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØµÙÙŠØ¨ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù†Ù‘ÙÙŠÙØ§Ø­ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø§ÙØ³Ù’ØªÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø¹Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙØªÙ‘ÙØ¨ÙØ§Ø¹Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ³ÙØ§Ø¡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ†ÙØ§Ø¦ÙØ²Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙÙ…Ù’Ø­ÙÙ‰ Ø´ÙÙŠÙ’Ø¡ÙŒ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙƒÙØªÙØ§Ø¨Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙØ²Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¬ÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ù’Ø¨ÙØ²ÙØ§Ù‚Ù Ø£ÙÙˆÙ’ ÙŠÙÙƒÙ’ØªÙØ¨Ù Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙÙƒÙ’Ø°ÙØ¨Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø±ÙØ¤Ù’ÙŠÙØ§Ù‡Ù Ù…ÙØªÙØ¹ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ø§Ù‹ ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"ÙŠÙÙƒÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙÙÙ‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙŠÙÙˆÙ’Ù…Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙŠÙØ§Ù…ÙØ©Ù Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ¹Ù’Ù‚ÙØ¯Ù Ø´ÙØ¹ÙÙŠØ±ÙØ©Ù‹ ÙˆÙ Ù…ÙØ§ Ù‡ÙÙˆÙ Ø¨ÙØ¹ÙØ§Ù‚ÙØ¯ÙÙ‡ÙØ§\" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„ØªÙ‘ÙØµÙØ§ÙˆÙÙŠØ±Ù ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ ØµÙÙˆÙ‘ÙØ±Ù ØµÙÙˆØ±ÙØ©Ù‹ ÙƒÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙÙÙ‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙŠÙÙˆÙ’Ù…Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙŠÙØ§Ù…ÙØ©Ù Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù ÙŠÙÙˆÙ‚ÙØ¸Ù Ù„ÙÙ„ØµÙ‘ÙÙ„Ø§ÙØ©Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ¯Ù’Ø®ÙÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø³ÙÙˆÙ’Ù…Ù Ø£ÙØ®ÙÙŠÙ‡Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ³Ù’Ù„ÙÙ…Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙÙƒÙ’Ø«ÙØ±Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙ…Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ¬ÙØ§Ù…ÙØ¹ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"ÙŠÙÙƒÙÙˆÙ†Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡Ù Ø®ÙØ±ÙØ³Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙˆÙÙ„ÙØ¯Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ù„Ø§Ù ØªÙØ¨ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙØªÙÙˆØ§ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ù…ÙØ©Ù ÙÙÙŠ Ø¨ÙÙŠÙÙˆØªÙÙƒÙÙ…Ù’ ÙˆÙ Ø£ÙØ®Ù’Ø±ÙØ¬ÙÙˆÙ‡ÙØ§ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙØ§Ø±Ø§Ù‹ ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ù…ÙÙ‚Ù’Ø¹ÙØ¯Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø´Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ’Ø·ÙØ§Ù†Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ù„Ø§Ù ÙŠÙØ¨ÙÙŠØªÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø£ÙØ­ÙØ¯ÙÙƒÙÙ…Ù’ ÙˆÙ ÙŠÙØ¯ÙÙ‡Ù ØºÙÙ…ÙØ±ÙØ©ÙŒ ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙÙØ¹ÙÙ„Ù ÙÙØ£ÙØµÙØ§Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ù„ÙÙ…ÙÙ…Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø´Ù‘ÙÙŠÙ’Ø·ÙØ§Ù†Ù ÙÙÙ„Ø§Ù ÙŠÙÙ„ÙÙˆÙ…ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„Ø§Ù‘Ù Ù†ÙÙÙ’Ø³ÙÙ‡Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ³Ù’ØªÙÙ†Ù’Ø¬ÙÙŠÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ø±Ù‘ÙÙˆÙ’Ø«Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ØªÙØ®Ù’Ø±ÙØ¬Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø£ÙØ©Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¨ÙÙŠÙ’ØªÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø¨ÙØºÙÙŠÙ’Ø±Ù Ø¥ÙØ°Ù’Ù†Ù Ø²ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¬ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø®ÙØ±ÙØ¬ÙØªÙ’ Ù„ÙØ¹ÙÙ†ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙƒÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ù…ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ ÙÙÙŠ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø³Ù‘ÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø¡Ù ÙˆÙ ÙƒÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ø´ÙÙŠÙ’Ø¡Ù ØªÙÙ…ÙØ±Ù‘Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ†Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù’Ø³Ù Ø­ÙØªÙ‘ÙÙ‰ ØªÙØ±Ù’Ø¬ÙØ¹Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø¨ÙÙŠÙ’ØªÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ØªÙØªÙØ²ÙÙŠÙ‘ÙÙ†Ù Ù„ÙØºÙÙŠÙ’Ø±Ù Ø²ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¬ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ \"ÙÙØ¥ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙÙØ¹ÙÙ„ÙØªÙ’ ÙƒÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø­ÙÙ‚Ù‘Ø§Ù‹ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙØ²Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¬ÙÙ„Ù‘Ù Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ­Ù’Ø±ÙÙ‚ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ§Ø±Ù \" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ØªÙØªÙÙƒÙÙ„Ù‘ÙÙ…Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø£ÙØ©Ù Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¯Ù ØºÙÙŠÙ’Ø±Ù Ø²ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¬ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ø£ÙÙˆÙ’ ØºÙÙŠÙ’Ø±Ù Ø°ÙÙŠ Ù…ÙØ­Ù’Ø±ÙÙ…Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡ÙØ§ Ø£ÙÙƒÙ’Ø«ÙØ±Ù Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø®ÙÙ…Ù’Ø³Ù ÙƒÙÙ„ÙÙ…ÙØ§ØªÙ Ù…ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ù„Ø§Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯Ù‘Ù Ù„ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ØªÙØ¨ÙØ§Ø´ÙØ±Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø£ÙØ©Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø£ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ù„ÙÙŠÙ’Ø³Ù Ø¨ÙÙŠÙ’Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…ÙØ§ Ø«ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¨ÙŒ ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ØªÙØ­ÙØ¯Ù‘ÙØ«Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø£ÙØ©Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙØ±Ù’Ø£ÙØ©Ù Ø¨ÙÙ…ÙØ§ ØªÙØ®Ù’Ù„ÙÙˆ Ø¨ÙÙ‡Ù Ù…ÙØ¹Ù Ø²ÙÙˆÙ’Ø¬ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ¬ÙØ§Ù…ÙØ¹Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù Ø£ÙÙ‡Ù’Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ù…ÙØ³Ù’ØªÙÙ‚Ù’Ø¨ÙÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù‚ÙØ¨Ù’Ù„ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø¸ÙÙ‡Ù’Ø±Ù Ø·ÙØ±ÙÙŠÙ‚Ù Ø¹ÙØ§Ù…ÙØ±Ù \"ÙÙÙ…ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙÙØ¹ÙÙ„Ù Ø°ÙÙ„ÙÙƒÙ ÙÙØ¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù \"Ù„ÙØ¹Ù’Ù†ÙØ©Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘Ù°Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ù…ÙÙ„Ø§Ù°Ø¦ÙÙƒÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù†Ù‘Ù°Ø§Ø³Ù Ø£ÙØ¬Ù’Ù…ÙØ¹ÙÙŠÙ†Ù\" \" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ \"Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙÙ‚ÙÙˆÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù Ù„ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù Ø²ÙÙˆÙ‘ÙØ¬Ù’Ù†ÙÙŠ Ø£ÙØ®Ù’ØªÙÙƒÙ Ø­ÙØªÙ‘ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙØ²ÙÙˆÙ‘ÙØ¬ÙÙƒÙ Ø£ÙØ®Ù’ØªÙÙŠ\" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¥ÙØªÙ’ÙŠÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ±Ù‘ÙØ§ÙÙ ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø£ÙØªÙØ§Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙ ØµÙØ¯Ù‘ÙÙ‚ÙÙ‡Ù ÙÙÙ‚ÙØ¯Ù’ Ø¨ÙØ±ÙØ¦Ù Ù…ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’Ø²ÙÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ù…ÙØ­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ¯Ù \" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙØ¹ÙØ¨Ù Ø¨ÙØ§Ù„Ù†Ù‘ÙØ±Ù’Ø¯Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø´Ù‘ÙØ·Ù’Ø±ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¬Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙÙˆØ¨ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¹ÙØ±Ù’Ø·ÙØ¨ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ù‡ÙÙŠÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø·Ù‘ÙÙ†Ù’Ø¨ÙÙˆØ±Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¹ÙÙˆØ¯Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ØºÙÙŠØ¨ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø§ÙØ³Ù’ØªÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø¹Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù†Ù‘ÙÙ…ÙÙŠÙ…ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø§ÙØ³Ù’ØªÙÙ…ÙØ§Ø¹Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡ÙØ§ ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ù„Ø§Ù ÙŠÙØ¯Ù’Ø®ÙÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙØ©Ù Ù‚ÙØªÙ‘ÙØ§ØªÙŒ\" ÙŠÙØ¹Ù’Ù†ÙÙŠ Ù†ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§Ù…Ø§Ù‹ ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø¥ÙØ¬ÙØ§Ø¨ÙØ©Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙÙØ§Ø³ÙÙ‚ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø·ÙØ¹ÙØ§Ù…ÙÙ‡ÙÙ…Ù’ ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙŠÙÙ…ÙÙŠÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙØ§Ø°ÙØ¨ÙØ©Ù ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ø¥ÙÙ†Ù‘ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ ØªÙØªÙ’Ø±ÙÙƒÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ø¯Ù‘ÙÙŠÙØ§Ø±Ù Ø¨ÙÙ„Ø§ÙÙ‚ÙØ¹Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù‚ÙØ§Ù„Ù \"Ù…ÙÙ†Ù’ Ø­ÙÙ„ÙÙÙ Ø¨ÙÙŠÙÙ…ÙÙŠÙ†Ù ÙƒÙØ§Ø°ÙØ¨ÙØ©Ù ØµÙØ¨Ù’Ø±Ø§Ù‹ Ù„ÙÙŠÙÙ‚Ù’Ø·ÙØ¹Ù Ø¨ÙÙ‡ÙØ§ Ù…ÙØ§Ù„Ù Ø§ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±ÙØ¦Ù Ù…ÙØ³Ù’Ù„ÙÙ…Ù Ù„ÙÙ‚ÙÙŠÙ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù„Ù‘ÙÙ‡Ù Ø¹ÙØ²Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙ Ø¬ÙÙ„Ù‘Ù ÙˆÙ Ù‡ÙÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡Ù ØºÙØ¶Ù’Ø¨ÙØ§Ù†Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„Ø§Ù‘Ù Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØªÙÙˆØ¨Ù ÙˆÙ ÙŠÙØ±Ù’Ø¬ÙØ¹Ù\" ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø¹ÙÙ†Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø¬ÙÙ„ÙÙˆØ³Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ù…ÙØ§Ø¦ÙØ¯ÙØ©Ù ÙŠÙØ´Ù’Ø±ÙØ¨Ù Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ’Ù‡ÙØ§ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø®ÙÙ…Ù’Ø±Ù ÙˆÙ Ù†ÙÙ‡ÙÙ‰ Ø£ÙÙ†Ù’ ÙŠÙØ¯Ù’Ø®ÙÙ„Ù Ø§ÙÙ„Ø±Ù‘ÙØ¬ÙÙ„Ù Ø­ÙÙ„ÙÙŠÙ„ÙØªÙÙ‡Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰ Ø§ÙÙ„Ù’Ø­ÙÙ…Ù‘ÙØ§Ù…Ù
